loans.name: Basiru

texts.en:
Basiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Basiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Basiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Basiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Basiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Basiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Farmers' Smile Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tần is 49 years old, and she is married with 3 children.

She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Tần lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Tần faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Tần joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Tần has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the Farmers' Smile, which consists of 3 members.

With her business profit, Tần hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Elder

texts.es:
Elder con 22 años de edad,de estado civil soltero, vive junto a sus padres y tres hermanos menores, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona rural.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican básicamente a la agricultura,ganadería,cultivo de productos de pan llevar y a la cría de animales menores.

Elder se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café,de variedad Catimor, contando a la fecha con 1 hectárea, plantación tiene 5 años de edad estando en tercer año de producción,con una experiencia en el rubro de 5 años. Cultivo de café lo realiza en terreno propio 1 hectárea ubicada en el C.P.M. Tambillo comprensión del Distrito Santo Tomas.Producto vende en propio Distrito Santo Tomas a compradores mayoristas. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca). Siendo estos para su consumo.El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de 1 hectárea de café en producción, asegurando campaña agrícola 2016 con una mayor producción, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtener mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Elder es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Elder firmará con aval.
texts.en:
Elder, 22, is single and lives with his parents and three younger siblings in a rural part of Santo Tomás district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department, Perú. He has very good personal and work references from area residents. Locals work primarily in agriculture, ranching, growing basic food crops, and raising small animals.

Elder works in agriculture, specifically growing the Catimor variety of coffee. He currently has a one-hectare plantation that is five years old and in its third year of production. He has five years of industry experience.

He grows coffee on his own hectare of land located in C.P.M. Tambillo in Santo Tomas district. He sells his product to wholesale buyers in Santo Tomas district. In addition, he raises small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others) and grows basic food crops (yucca, bananas, taro) for his own consumption.

The purpose of the loan is to invest in maintaining one hectare of coffee in production, ensuring better production in the 2016 season. This will be reflected in a greater volume of sales and thus a higher income to improve his quality of life.

Elder is a repeat borrower with Edpyme Alternativa. Elder will sign with a guarantee.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining one hectare of coffee in production, to ensure greater production in the 2016 season.

loans.name: Ruzel

texts.en:
Ruzel is 33 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Ruzel works very hard to provide for them.

Ruzel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Ruzel has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, coffee, shampoo, candies, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Ruzel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Veronica is 42 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Veronica has a general store business in the Philippines. Veronica requested a PHP 21000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Veronica has been in this business for 5 years. Veronica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is maize farmer from Rumi village. As a member of Babban Gona, Saratu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
Saratu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use her increased earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
As a parent of four children, Florencia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Florencia is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fruits, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business.

Florencia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe  is 46 years old and married with six children.  

Fe  is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Fe  requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Fe  has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Fe  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario es una valerosa mujer que en medio de las dificultades no se dio por vencida, por el contrario emprendió su propio negocio de productos alimenticios hace ocho años, los cuales son  producidos en la región de donde es oriunda, en Luruaco un municipio del Atlántico, logrando generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, ya que su cónyuge enfermó y estaba inhabilitado para laborar.  Tras el fallecimiento de su cónyuge, ella continuó con esta actividad con la que ha logrado sostener a sus tres hijos que son mayores de edad y desean continuar con sus estudios profesionales, es por ello que su compromiso es grande y diariamente oferta carne de res, queso y bollos a vecinos del sector donde reside al sur de Barranquilla y también a conocidos que tiene en barrios del municipio; El Carmen, San José y Cevillar. Su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para atender toda la demanda de sus clientes, por ello está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en Carne de res, bollos y queso.  Aunque su principal desafío en la vida fue tener que llevar las riendas en el hogar a causa del fallecimiento de su cónyuge y tener que sobre llevar la pérdida de un ser querido, Rosario desea ampliar su negocio y su objetivo es contar con el capital necesario para seguir trabajando sin inconvenientes.
texts.en:
Rosario is a brave woman who was not defeated in the middle of difficulties. On the contrary, she launched her own food products business eight years ago. The products are produced in her native region--in Luruaco, a municipality of Atlántico.

She is managing to generate income for her household's support, since her partner became ill and was unable to work. After her partner's death, she continued with this business, with which she has managed to support her 3 children who are older in age and wish to continue with their professional studies. It is because of this that her commitment is large and she daily offers beef, cheese, and rolls to neighbors in the area where she lives (to the south of Barranquilla), and also to acquaintances she has in the city's neighborhoods: El Carmen, San José, and Cevillar.

Her working capital is not enough to deal with all of her clients' demands. Because of this, she is submitting a loan application--her first Kiva loan, done through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo--which she will invest in beef, rolls, and cheese.

Although her main life challenge was having to take the reins in her home due to her partner's death and having to overcome the loss of a loved one, Rosario wishes to expand her business and her objective is to have the necessary capital to continue working without issues.

loans.use: to invest in beef, rolls, and cheese.

loans.name: Diego Antonio

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en una zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 4 años al cultivo de maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con sus cultivos y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The young man's face has been pixelized because he is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area. He has grown corn for 4 years and when his harvest is ready he sells it in the area around where he lives. He lives in his home with his life partner and their two children.

He is asking for another loan for the purchase of more seeds, fertilizers, pest control, and to improve the land shown in the photo to continue his farming and be able to have better income.

loans.use: buy more seeds, fertilizers, pest control, and improve his land.

loans.name: Fara Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Fara a demostrado ser una mujer emprendedora y luchadora, responsable y fiel cliente de nuestra institución. Tiene 36 años, ajuntada y con cuatro hijos a responsabilidad de 13,9,2,6 años. Desde hace 10 años tiene su negocio de ventas de frutas y verduras. Actualmente esta solicitando crédito por segunda vez, para invertirlo en la compra de mamon chino, perotes, chilotes, limones, yucas. Con el crédito que obtuvo anteriormente incremento su negocio y las ganancias le han servido para el mejoramiento económico de su hogar.
texts.en: Fara has shown herself to be an enterprising woman and a fighter. She is a responsible and loyal client of our institution. She is 36 years old, in a relationship with four children under her responsibility aged 13, 9, 6 and 2 years old. She has has a business selling fruit and vegetable for ten years. She is currently requesting a loan for the second time to invest in the purchase of rambutan, perote (apple type fruit), chilote (young corn), lime, and yucca. With her previous loan she increased her business and the profits served to improve her household's economy.

loans.use: to buy rambutan, perote (apple type fruit), chilote (young corn), lime, and yucca.

loans.name: Gulchera

texts.ru: Прекрасная женщина Гулчера. Ей 55 лет. У нее муж, дети и внуки. Она активная и сильная женщина. Гулчера на рынке сидит и продает фрукты. Ей нравится торговля, и общаться с клиентами. Гулчера продает свежее фрукты. У нее имеется больше клиентов. Гулчера всегда перевезет свежее и качественные фрукты, что бы люди принимали здоровые фрукты. Гулчера планируют, перевозит еще больше фрукты на продажу. Из-за нехватки денег она запрашивает кредит. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет Гулчере увеличить товарооборот. Она заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Meet Gulchera, a lovely 55-year-old wife, mother and grandmother.  Gulchera is an active and strong woman.  She works as a market vendor and she sells fresh fruits.  She enjoys working in retail and dealing with her many customers.  She always brings in fresh and high-quality fruits, so that her customers can enjoy healthy produce.  At the moment, she is planning to bring in more fruits for resale.  She is taking a loan because of a lack of money.  Thanks to her loan, she will be able to increase her turnover.  She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to bring in more fruits for resale.

loans.name: Acasia

texts.en:
A $ 1000.00 loan is offered to Acasia to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy noodles, fish, chicken, Fanta, and rice.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Acasia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, fish, chicken, Fanta, and rice.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Это женщина Тахмина. Ей 32 лет. Она жительница района Хамадони. Муж Тахмины занимается земледелием. Тахмина в районе занимается выращиванием мелко рогатого  скота. Ей в работе помогает муж. У нее заботливый муж. Уже 3 года она занимается этой деятельности. Тахмина уверена в себе и хорошо справляется со своей работой. Она решила расширить животноводческую деятельность, путем увеличения поголовье скота. Для увеличения поголовье скота у нее нет денег, и она обратилась за кредитом. Тахмина верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Ей очень нужно финансы.
texts.en:
Meet Tahmina, a 32-year-old resident of the Hamadoni district of Tajikistan.  Her husband works in agriculture.  Tahmina herself raises small livestock in her native district.  Her husband, a very caring man, also helps her with her work.  Tahmina has been involved in this activity for three years already.  She believes in herself and she handles her work very well.  

At the moment, Tahmina has decided to buy more livestock and expand her animal husbandry business.  However, she doesn't have enough money to increase her livestock headcount, which is the reason why she is taking this loan.  She confidently relies on you and on your support.  She really needs this financing.

loans.use: to buy livestock and expand her animal husbandry activity.

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en:
Marigen, 40, is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. For the past eleven years she has worked steadily selling various dry goods in the Philippines. 

Marigen has taken out and successfully repaid a prior loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more stock to sell to her customers. She is saving her money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Teresa Del Socorro

texts.es: Teresa es una mujer emprendedora que ha logrado salir adelante con la venta de comida y derivados del maíz. Comenzó a los 18 años con una pequeña pulpería pero este fracaso, luego vio la oportunidad de vender comida ya que la demanda era muy alta, entonces puso su negocio de comideria sus hijas y su hermana la apoyan los fines de semana. Teresa solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio y comprar la materia prima para realizar la producción de las comidas, de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta ampliar su negocio y ofrecer sus comidas en los departamentos a diferentes empresas.
texts.en:
Teresa is an entrepreneurial woman who has managed to get ahead with food and corn product sales. She began 18 years ago with a small grocery store, but this failed. Later, she saw the opportunity to sell food since the demand was very high. So she set up her eatery business. Her daughters and sister support her on weekends.

Teresa requests a loan in order to invest in her business and buy the raw materials to carry out food production. In this way, she will be able to boost her income and improve her business' infrastructure. Her future plans are to expand her business and offer her foods in the departments of different businesses.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to carry out food production.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. She earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

Victoria is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for fishing boats, such as wood, paint, and nails, and to pay for laborers' salaries.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with help from loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing boats, such as wood, paint, and nails, and to pay for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Jennifer Eloisa

texts.es:
Jennifer tiene 20 años es soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el recinto caimito en el canton puebloviejo, de dedica a la agricultura, el credito lo solicita para la compra de insumo, semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.

El sueño de ellas es tener dinero para ponder comprarse una casa para cuando se case.. y tener dos hijos.
texts.en:
Jennifer is 20 years old. She is single and does not have children. She lives with her parents on the apple star street in the town of Puebloviejo. She works in agriculture.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies, seeds, fertilizers, and manure.

Her dream is to have money to be able to buy herself a house when she gets married and to have two children.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, and manure.

loans.name: Sokrat's Group

texts.en:
Sokrat is 33 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. She lives in Kratie Province where she has grown cassava for the past fifteen years. Weeds and drought are her problems as a farmer. She also fishes and works for others to earn extra income for her family. She earns approximately 12.5 USD a day and of this can save about 10 USD.

Past loans have enabled Sokrat to have enough capital to support her farm. She is now leading this group of three members to apply for a 3,500,000 KHR loan through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Cambodia to be apportioned among themselves.

Sokrat will use her portion of the loan to buy organic weed killer for her farm. She hopes that after using it her fields will produce cassava in abundance, bringing her extra profits. More money will improve her living condition and help her to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic weed killer for her cassava farm.

loans.name: Leonardo Fabio

texts.es: Leonardo es un emprendedor de 42 años de edad que durante muchos años estuvo empleado en una comercializadora de artículos, desempeñándose en el cargo de vendedor, experiencia que le permitió conocer muy a fondo aspectos del comercio que aprovecharía años más tarde para emprender con un pequeño capital su proyecto de negocio en el año 1998.  Él recorre los diferentes barrios del municipio de Barranquilla, ofertando artículos y productos de aseo para el hogar: traperos, escobas y recogedores, sin embargo esta no es su única cadena de comercialización, ya que distribuye a tiendas de barrios y ferreterías del municipio. En la actualidad está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá pedidos de sus clientes: repuestos de mechas para trapero, escobas y cepillos, los cuales no alcanza a cubrir con su capital.  Aunque se encuentra separado de su cónyuge es padre de dos hijos menores de edad a quien siempre ha ofrecido bienestar y su meta los incluye puesto apoyarles en sus necesidades y estudios. Leonardo se proyecta a futuro con una distribuidora de productos para el aseo en el hogar.
texts.en:
Leonardo is an entrepreneur of 42 years of age, who for many years was employed in business marketing various articles, working in the role of a salesman. This experience allowed him to be very familiar with aspects of business that he would take advantage of years later to set up, with a little capital, his business project in the year 1998. He goes through the various neighborhoods of the city of Barranquilla, offering cleaning articles and products for the home: mops, brooms, and dustpans. Nevertheless, this is not his only marketing chain, since he distributes to stores and hardware stores in the city.

Now he is applying to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation for a loan, his first Kiva financing, which he will invest in orders from his customers: replacement mop heads, brooms, and brushes, which he can't manage to fill with his capital. Although he is separated from his wife, he is the father of two minor children, to whom he has always offered well-being, and his goal includes them, to support them in their needs and education. Leonardo plans a future as a distributor of cleaning products for the home.

loans.use: to invest in items ordered by his customers: replacement mop heads, brooms, and brushes.

loans.name: Mastongul

texts.ru: 45 летняя Мастонгул  с юных лет искусно шьет традиционное женское платье. В округе её знают как талантливую рукодельницу. По ее словам ей удобно заниматься дома, и  она делает для себя и для продажи, чтобы жить и не надеется на пенсию и на отправки деньги мужа. Изделия Мастонгул покупают в основном местные девушки, выходящие замуж. Мастонгул желает, что бы её мастерство приносило людям радость и хорошее настроение. Мастонгул из района Хамадони. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. У нее один сын и одна дочка. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Мастонгул решила отремонтировать дом и улучшить жилищные условия семьи. Она давно не ремонтировала дом, вместе с семьей живет в старом доме. Мастонгул планирует взять кредит и за счет кредита отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Mastongul is 45 years old.  Since her youth, she has been sewing beautiful traditional women's clothes.  People around her describe her as a talented needlewoman.  Mastongul herself says that she enjoys working from home.  This is something she does for herself and for the earnings that her activity brings her. Her goal is to be able to live without relying on a pension or on the money sent home from her husband.  Mastongul essentially sells the clothes that she makes to local young women who are getting married.  She hopes that, thanks to her craftsmanship, she can make people happy and joyful.

Mastongul is from the Hamadoni district of Tajikistan.  She is married and the mother of two children, a son and a daughter.  Her husband is currently working in Russia.  Mastongul has decided to renovate her house and improve her family's living conditions.  The house in which she lives with her family hasn't been repaired for a long time and is very old.  Mastongul is taking this loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tamales y antojitos, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de maiz, papas, manteca, entre otros ingredientes y asi continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old. She lives in her own house with her life partner. She works making and selling tamales and antojitos. She sells her food as a street vendor in the different neighborhoods that are around her house.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, potatoes, and butter, among other ingredients; and thus continue with her sales that earn her a good income.

loans.use: to buy corn, potatoes, and butter, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 21 años estudia y trabaja es casado tiene un hijo vive en el recinto el caimito perteneciente al canton puebloviejo.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra del maiz duro en terrenos arrendados, el dinero del credito lo necesita para la compra de semillas y para pagar alos obreros.

El sueño de ella es tener dinero para la comprar de un terreno para seguir sembrando.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 21-year-old man. He studies and works, is married, and has a child. He lives in Recinto el Caimito, belonging to Puebloviejo canton.

He earns a living in agriculture, planting hard corn in rented plots. He needs the money from the loan for purchasing seeds and to pay the workers.

His dream is to have money to buy a plot in order to continue planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay workers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and has three children. For the past three years she has sold fruits and vegetables in an area busy with local customers.

Grace has applied for a 20,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner SMEP to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. Her goals are to build up her business and become a vegetable wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Barbara Mercedes

texts.es:
barbara es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora.. le gusta mucho tyrabajar en el campo es soltera tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz el dinero lo solicta para la compra de semillas, abonos y ferçtilizantes para que sus cultivos esten bien para la cosecha.

le gusta bailar con los hijos.
texts.en:
Barbara is a very responsible and hardworking person. She really likes to work in the fields. She is single and has three children that depend on her. She works in agriculture, growing corn. 

She is requesting money to purchase seeds, manure and fertilizers so that her crops are good at the time of harvest.

She likes to dance with her children.

loans.use: with the purchase of seeds, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Belli Maria

texts.es: Belli tiene la edad de 45 años, está casada y vive con el esposo y tres hijos  actualmente. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales para hacer un gallinero y además comprar las gallinas y el alimento para las mismas. Ella desea vender los huevos a los vecinos y en algunos negocios y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Belli is 45 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and three children currently. She wants the loan to buy materials to have a chicken coop, and additionally to buy hens and the food for them. She wants to sells the eggs to the neighbors and in some businesses and thus have better economic income.

She hopes in the future to provide her family with a better quality of life, better economic stability, and be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

This is her first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not have other loans before in the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided her the loan with better facilities and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy materials and hens.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Teresa de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada desde hace 20 años y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando las puertas y ventanas pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de puertas, balcones, ventanas y pago de mano de obra y asi tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Teresa is 53 years old and lives in her own home with her son. She has been working as an employee in a private company for the past 20 years. With her earnings, she is able to meet some of her household needs.

She would like to improve her housing by changing the doors and windows, but does not have enough capital. She requesting a loan to purchase doors, security railings, windows, and pay labor costs, to therefore have a decent home.

loans.use: to purchase doors, security railings, windows, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Pelsida Noemy

texts.es:
La socia es una muejer luchadora tiene 39 años de edad es madre soltera, el esposo se fue con otra persona y ella cuida de los hijos sola.

Pelsida se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz duro el credito solicita para la comprar de semillas certificadas fertilizantes y abonos para el cultivo.

En los tiempos libre le gusta salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Pelsida is a hardworking woman who is 39 years old. She is a single mother. Her husband left with another person, and she takes care of the children alone.

Pelsida works in agriculture planting hardy corn. She is requesting the loan to buy certified seeds, fertilizers, and manure to cultivate.

In her free time she likes to go out walking.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizers, and manure.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy  tiene la edad de 32 años, está casado   y vive con  la esposa y  un  hijo   actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unas vacas .El espera poder obtener   crías  y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Roy is 32 years old, married, and currently lives with his wife and child.

He wants a loan for purchasing some cows. He hopes to be able to get young cows and sell them at the ideal weight, and thus have greater economic income.

In the future, he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and be able to continue growing.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans in state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy heifers.

loans.name: Mónica Rocío

texts.es: Mónica de 50 años se encuentra dedicada a la confección de calzado, actividad que aprendió de la mano de su expareja, quien contaba con gran experiencia en esta labor por sus anteriores empleos en talleres de calzado y que luego de quedar desempleado, decidió trabajar como independiente y en compañía de Mónica.  Ellos emprendieron su taller en su residencia y Mónica se desempeñaba como ayudante, sin embargo logró tener un aprendizaje muy rápido y no tardó en hacer sus propias creaciones. Con el paso del tiempo a raíz de problemas de pareja disolvieron su sociedad y Mónica continuo su negocio con el que ha podido ofrecer bienestar a sus cinco hijos, hoy en día cuenta con 10 años de experiencia distribuyendo calzado a almacenes y misceláneas con cercanía a su lugar de residencia al sur de Barranquilla.  Ella es especialista en calzado femenino, pero en ocasiones elabora calzado masculino por encargos de sus clientes.  En la actualidad está aplicando una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar materiales como cuerinas, suelas, plantillas, pegante y accesorios, con la finalidad de aprovisionarse y estar preparada para la creciente demanda de fin de año. Su meta a futuro es incrementar su capacidad de producción y adquirir una vivienda.
texts.en:
Mónica is 50 years old.  She works making footwear, a trade that she learned from her ex-husband, who had a lot of experience in this job from previous employment in shoe workshops.  Later, he was left unemployed and he decided to work independently and in company with Mónica.  They started their workshop in their home, and Mónica was employed as an assistant.  Nevertheless, she learned very quickly and it wasn't long before she made her own creations.  With the passing of time, as a result of marital problems, they dissolved their partnership, and Mónica stayed with the business with which she has been able to offer welling being to her five children.

Today, she has 10 years of experience distributing footwear to stores near her home in the south of Barranquilla.  She specializes in women's footwear, but on occasion she makes men's footwear upon request of her customers.

Now she is requesting a loan.  It is her first credikiva loan from the Fundacíon Mario Santo Domingo to buy materials such as leather, soles, insoles, glue, and accessories in order to stock up and be prepared for the end of the year increase in demand.  Her future goal is to increase the capacity of production and to acquire a house.

loans.use: To buy materials such leather, soles, insoles, glue, and accessories.

loans.name: Edison Rolando

texts.es:
Edison es un hormbre joven que estudia en la universidad es soltero le gusta mucho trabajar en el campo.

Se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maiz en un terrenos de sus padres el credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos, por que desea tener mas ingresos para poder pagar los estudios ya que son muy costosos.

en los tiempos libres le gusta caminar por el campo cuidando los animales de los vecinos.
texts.en:
Edison is a young man who is studying in college. He is unmarried, and he very much enjoys working in the field. He works in agriculture, growing corn on his parents' land.

He is requesting the loan to purchase supplies, fertilizers and manure, because he wishes to have more income to be able to pay for his studies, which are very expensive. In his free time, he likes to walk through the countryside tending to his neighbors' animals.

loans.use: purchase supplies, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Mirian Yaneth

texts.es: Mirian  tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltera y vive con los padres actualmente. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que a recibido de FUDECOSUR. Élla no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Mirian is 18 years old. She is unmarried and currently lives with her parents.

With her loan, she plans to purchase fertilizers, fungicides, and pay for labor for assistants for coffee cultivation. With these improvements to the crops, she hopes to obtain a little bit of income, and improve her family's living conditions. 

This is the first loan that she has received from Kiva Field Partner FUDECOSUR. She has not had other loans in state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has provided her a loan with more ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing coffee.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is a sari-sari (variety) store owner. A sari-sari store is a small retail outlet that can be found in almost all neighborhoods, sometimes even on every street corner, in the Philippines. It is a privately-owned shop operated inside the store owner’s house.

Dinah, a 32-year-old woman, has been operating this business for 10 years in the town of Albuera, Leyte to help her husband raise their children. They have three children; ages 14, 12 and 10 years old. Dinah is thinking of a strategy to attract more customers so that her sales will increase. Thus, she is asking for a bigger amount of loans to buy more commodities to sell, like drinks, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, candies, chips, biscuits, salt, and sugar. In this way, her store looks full and it will attract more buyers. Dinah’s ultimate goal is to expand her business for her family's sustainability.

loans.use: to buy drinks, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, candies, chips, biscuits, salt, and sugar

loans.name: Safari Group

texts.en:
James, who is in his mid-20s, is single with no child. He has been running a general store for one year now. He works from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be James' 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the general store. He dreams of becoming an international businessman.

James will share this loan with his loan group Safari, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the general store.

loans.name: Oeurn's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kampong Cham province, Oeurn is 55 years old, and she has four dependent children. Catching fish is the primary source of her income for ages. To earn additional income, she has been working as a construction worker to get a fee as well. Her daily income earns her about 10 USD per day, and she can save 7 USD each day after offsetting her expenses.

Recently, she could not catch as many fish as before, so her income is going down. In order to save her current business, she needs more working capital to buy fishing net, which enables her to catch more fish.

Now, she leads a group of three members to take a loan, which will be the first loan for her. She hopes to gain more income to save for future needs through this loan.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, which enables her to catch more fish so as to gain more income to save for future needs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 34-year old woman who earns a living by doing sari-sari (varieties) store business and mobile electronic load. She has been doing this business for almost 10 years, and became proficient in this field. She is determined to continue doing this business hoping for some improvements in the future.

She is asking a loan to help her buy additional stocks such as drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices, sugar, powdered milk, powdered juice, coffee, toiletries, chips, biscuits, bread and candies. She will also buy mobile electronic load.

Additionally, Violeta is from Albuera, Leyte, married and has three children who still need their support. Her oldest child is 9 years old, while her youngest child is 4 years old.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices, sugar, powdered milk, powdered juice, coffee, toiletries, chips, biscuits, bread and candies; mobile electronic load.

loans.name: Sukvari's Group

texts.en:
Sukvari, a differently abled lady standing on the left in an orange saree, is a dedicated mother of two children who does tailoring work from her small home in Korba, Chattisgarh. Her husband is an agricultural worker. The family together has little savings and rely on minimal amenities in their small house.

Sukvari’s tailoring business is thriving, with strong demand and solid margins. However, now she wants to take her business to the next level to save more to cater to the family needs. Her plan is to buy one more sewing machine and hire an employee to extend her work. She will then train the employee and together they will strive to increase the sales. Hence, Sukvari, along with her group member, has applied for a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum.

loans.use: to buy one more sewing machine and hire an employee to extend her work

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 43 years old and has eight children. Leonora is married and three of her children are in school.

Leonora is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonora requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Leonora has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 48 years old and married with two school-aged children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gaudiosa runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, including detergent soap, sanitary pads, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, and noodles. She requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

In the future, Gaudiosa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store, such as detergent soap, sanitary pads, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, and noodles.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou's main source of living is by engaging in the raising and selling of hogs. She raises and sells pigs to the local settlers in her place.

She is a 27-year-old woman and has two young children. Her partner in life is a farmer. His income can be a great help to cater to the needs of the entire family.

She works hard and continues to seek ways to improve her livelihood. She has been raising hogs for three years already and wants to continue doing so.

Marilou has requested a loan to buy pig feed. This can enable her to raise quality hogs and provide her with an adequate supply of feed for the livestock. It can also help enhance her source of income and slowly enable her to pay her obligation.

She is thankful to Kiva for the funds and is determined to manage the loan successfully to support the education of her children in preparation for their respective studies.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Bineta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 21 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été  inauguré en février 2014. Il est regroupe des femmes du même village et des environs qui ont de bonnes relations et sont très solidaires. Elles s’activent principalement dans le commerce  et l’embouche.
SATOU debout à gauche de la photo et levant la main droite  est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle  est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 filles et 2 garçons. Elle s’active dans l’embouche et le commerce de niébé.
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter un mouton à 40 000 FCFA l'engraisser et le revendre à 60 000 FCFA.Elle achète également 30 kilogrammes de niébé, le kilo à 250 FCFA et le revend à 400 FCFA. Avec le reste du prêt, elle achète de l'aliment de bétail. 
Les bénéfices récoltés de ses activités serviront à épargner et aussi à répondre aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 21 members and belongs to a banc villageois launched in February of 2014. Its members are women living in the same village who maintain a spirit of friendship and solidarity. They work raising livestock. Satou, the one standing on the left in the photo raising her right hand is the star borrower. She is 45 years old. Satou is married and has five children: three daughters and two sons. She raises livestock and sells "niebe" [a type of black bean]. 

With her loan, Satou plans to buy a sheep for 40,000 West African francs to fatten up and resell for 60,000 francs. She will also buy 30 kg of "niebe" beans at 250 francs per kg, and resell at 400 francs. She will use the rest of her loan to buy animal fodder. Her revenues will  allow her to grow her savings and provide for family needs.

loans.use: to buy a sheep and 30 kg of black beans.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has 5 children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy water connection pipes and a water tank to store water for domestic use. Her business goal is to have a big business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy water connection pipes and a water tank.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 48 years old and married with 10 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, sugar, etc.

Bernadeth has been in this business for 4 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marina is 45 years old and has one child in school.

Marina has a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines. Marina requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Marina has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 48 years old and married with three children. Jesusa works very hard to provide for them.

Jesusa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jesusa has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, cooking oil, shampoo, coffee, sugar, eggs, cereals, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jesusa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 44 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Maribeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Maribeth has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old now.

Rebecca has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar, flour, etc..

Rebecca has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en: Sobia is a stay-at-home mother. She is 35 years old and she has two sons. She lives with her family in Lahore. She has discovered knitting as a source of income while she stays at home. She has been doing this for quite a while now and has become an expert. She can make hand-knitted crafts such as sweaters, gloves, shoes, and warm clothes for kids. She finds her work rewarding and can make a variety of designs. Customers come to her home to make purchases and place orders. She happily completes the orders and sells her products. She recently observed an increase in the demand for knitted products, especially for kids as winter has already arrived. To make the most of this opportunity, she wants to buy yarn in different colors to be able to fulfill orders without running out of stock. For this reason she has applied for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner. She is happy, empowered, and on her way to success.

loans.use: to buy yarn for her knitting business.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Apolonia to improve her business .Apolonia opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy tofu. Apolonia is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Apolonia is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy tofu.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a single woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy farm inputs. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Cesarina

texts.en: Cesarina is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and she has three children. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as a refrigerator, Fanta, beer, water, Coca Cola, Sagiko, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, fish, soap, noodles, biscuits and oils. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, Fanta, beer, water, Coca Cola, Sagiko, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, fish, soap, noodles, biscuits and oils.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more materials for her tailoring business.

Presentacion has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from selling dry goods.

Presentacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business.

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en:
Phy is a 41-year-old farmer who lives in Steung Treng province. She is the married mother of five children, four of whom depend on her and need her to support their studies. She has been growing rice as her main source of income for twenty years. Additionally, she has been working for others for a fee to earn additional income. Her farming business earns her only about $6 USD per day on average, as the crop didn’t grow well and she had to sell it at a lower price in the market.

With her first loan from VisionFund, she is going to buy seed to expand her rice-farming business. She hopes this loan will help her get high yields and earn more income so that she can keep her children in school until they graduate and find good jobs.

loans.use: to buy seed to expand her rice-farming business.

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Steung Treng District

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past five years, selling goat meat. She faces major challenges of transportation and seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a married woman. She has 4 children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals, cooking oil, soda and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the loan of 30,000 KES to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and cereals.

loans.name: Evangelio

texts.en:
Evangelio is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evangelio is 36 years old.

Evangelio has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Evangelio has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Evangelio would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 55 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Juliana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Juliana requested a loan of 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Juliana has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Juliana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Manuel Zacarias

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 35 años es soltero pero tiene dos hijos que no viven con el el vive con el hermano.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, arroz y a la crianza de gallinas, el dinero lo solicita para compra de insumos fertilizantes y semillas ademas para morocho para las gallinas.

en los tiempos libres les gusta visitar a los hijos y salir hacer deporte con ellos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 35 years old and single but he has two children that don't live with him. He lives with his brother.

He works in agriculture planting corn, rice and raising chickens. He's requesting money for the purchase of supplies, fertilizers and seeds as well as morocho [a variety of Ecuadoran corn] for the chickens.

In his free time he likes to visit his kids and go out and play sports with them.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers and seeds as well as corn for the chickens.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 58, married, and the mother of 7 children. She lives in a populated area in Lahore. Her children are grown up and one of her sons owns a small boutique where he makes exquisite and intricate designs for his customers. Men usually do embroidery work in the cities.

Traditional embroidery is very famous in Pakistan. Formal dresses are worn by women on special occasions, festivals and functions. The demand for them increases especially during weddings. The designs change with time and time is required to make them.

Kousar's son is skilled in this art and finds his work interesting. But he has to give it a lot of time. Since his business is not very well established and he cannot manage to save money, Kousar has requested for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner. She believes that this investment will help her son in getting more business and expanding his client base. She is a proud mother and wants a brighter future for her son.

loans.use: to help her son buy embroidery material for his small boutique.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a farm where she grows maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be farm pests. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia works hard to support three children. She is widowed and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Cresencia requested a PHP 9,200 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

She is getting the loan because she wants to buy materials like a toilet bowl, cement, sand, gravel, and roofing for the construction of her sanitary toilet.

Cresencia is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she has comfort, safety and privacy, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like a toilet bowl, cement, sand, gravel, roofing, etc. for the construction of her sanitary toilet.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: Noreen is a 32-year-old, hardworking woman who has two children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Noreen’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. Noreen has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for her prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en: Imtiaz is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Imtiaz is popularly known in her area for her skills in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulties in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of 50,000 PKR. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time. She hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu is a maize farmer from Shadauro village. As a Babban Gona member, Saidu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saidu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Saidu can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Saidu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land, Saidu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Segundo Bonifacio

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 35 años de edad es soltero vive con un hermano ya que su madre fallecio hace poco.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y tiene muy pocas gallinas para engordar y vender, el dinero lo solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos y alimento para las gallinas, lo necesario lo compra en ventanas.

Segundo en los tiempos libre le gusta hacer deposte con los amogos del barrio.
texts.en:
Segundo is 35 years old; he's single and lives with a brother since his mother died not long ago.

He works in agriculture planting corn and he has a very few hens to fatten and sell. He's requesting the money for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, manure and chicken feed. He buys necessary items in Ventanas.

In his free time Segundo likes to participate in sports with friends from the neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure and chicken feed.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elsa is 59 years old now.

Elsa has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Elsa requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items such as pants and shirts to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as pants and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Yesenia Maria

texts.es: Yesenia poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante con los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, se dedica a la venta de carnes, lácteos y otros productos. Está muy agradecida con los prestamos obtenidos es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de carne y productos lácteos. Con este nuevo crédito podrá obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Little by little Yesenia has managed to get ahead with the help of previous loans. She works selling meats, dairy products, and other products.
She is very thankful for the loans obtained and for that reason is requesting another loan for the purchase of larger quantities of meat and dairly products. With this new loan she will be able to achieve greater income and better her life style.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of meat and dairy products.

loans.name: Las Bellas Group

texts.es:
Las Bellas se llama este grupo, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose y luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gladys, quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chipas, la cual es una comida típica paraguaya, comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compran de ella las chipas que hace, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a sus familias.
Gladys pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus chipas para la venta, como ser almidón, queso, huevo, anís, manteca y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Las Bellas is the name of this group. They are part of the program for the eradication of poverty. They are fighting and making efforts to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones’. Gladys is one of its members, who works making and selling cheese buns which are the Paraguayan typical food. She says she has many customers who always buy the cheese buns she makes. She is thankful for the opportunity given in order to grow, improve her living conditions and help her family. 

Gladys requests a loan to buy ingredients such as, starch, cheese, egg, aniseed, butter and others, so that she can make cheese buns for sale and continue selling in the way she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make cheese buns, such as, starch, cheese, eggs, aniseed, butter, and others.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a widow with three children and lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. When her husband died she was left alone to raise their children. Her income is derived from palay (rough rice) production. She has already fully paid her previous loans and has now taken a new one.

With the loan, she will purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides for her rice farms. A portion of it will pay for manual labor for weeding and harvesting and for transportation of the products from the farm to the market.

The profit from this activities will be use to engage another business and purchase dress for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides and pay for manual labor for weeding and harvesting.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 36 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, soap, milk, sugar and eggs to sell.

Rosalia has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from boarding house rental.

She successfully paid back her previous loans, and has now requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rosalia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, soap, milk, sugar and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity or piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past five years selling meat goat . She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in her place of operations.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase a stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Miguel inician el 1º ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas desarrollan trabajo en equipo y la ayuda solidaria. Se fijaron como meta el crecimiento de cada una, no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona.
La Sra. Fidelina es miembro del comité de mujeres, es vendedora de artículos artesanales que ella  misma confecciona y realiza sus ventas en ferias y exposiciones. Comenta que por medio de sus artesanías tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos y darles así una mejor calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus artesanías, como ser telas, hilos, pinturas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group San Miguel will start the first cycle of the program, Committee for women in which everyone works as a team and in mutual cooperation.  They have set the goal of growth for each of them, not only at an economic level but also as human beings.  Fidelina is a member of the Committee for Women and also vendor of handicrafts made by her which she sells at fairs and exhibitions.  She says that through her handicrafts she has the means to help her loved ones and give them a better quality of life.  

She requests a loan to buy raw materials such as, fabric, thread, paint and others, in order to make her handicrafts and keep up with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make handicrafts such as, fabric, thread, paint and others.

loans.name: Miro

texts.es:
Miro con 29 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia, junto a su cónyuge, y sus cuatro menores hijos, en el distrito de de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Él cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Miro se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Miro es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Miro, 29, is married and lives in his own home. He shares his home with his wife and four young children, in the district of Pomahuaca in Jaen. This area falls under the Cajamarca office in Peru.

He is well-regarded in his area, both as a professional and as a person. Most of the people who live in this part of the province work in agriculture, commerce or livestock.

Miro works in agriculture, growing coffee for ten years now. He will use the loan on agricultural services and products, such as phytosanitary products, fertilizers, and labor costs at harvest time.

This will improve the health, aspect and production of his crops so he can reap a better harvest with a better quality product. This gives him better sales prospects.

He has had loans before with Edpyme Alternativa, applying together with his wife.

loans.use: to pay for various agricultural products and services.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Joya Grande Group

texts.en:
The group Las Rosas de Joya Grande is made up of 8 members, all of whom live in Chimaltenango, situated in the central region of Guatemala. These women are mothers and workers. Each of them is responsible for between 6 to 8 children in addition to their businesses.

María is a 46-year-old widow and cares for her 8 children by herself. Sadly, she could not attend school as a child, as she lacked the economic resources, but nonetheless, she has taken the initiative to develop the knowledge she does have, in order to provide a quality life for her family.

María has used her abilities in agriculture to plant vegetables such as peas and corn which she harvests and sells with the help of her children. She is requesting a loan and plans to use it to buy more seeds and materials to prepare more acres of land to plant vegetables and expand her farm.

In addition to increasing her income, María will also be trained in topics of saving, health, women’s rights, and debt-avoidance and management, through Friendship Bridge programming.

Las Rosas de Joya Grande appreciate the opportunities and support they receive through Friendship Bridge and its partner, Kiva, because with these organizations, these women can fight poverty and overcome it in their community.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and materials to prepare more acres of land to plant more vegetables and expand her farm.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a 53-year-old woman from Albuera, Leyte. She is married and has 10 children. Out of these ten children, she still has four-school-aged children who are 21, 18, 16 and 10 years old and who still need her support.

Thus, Rosario is in need of additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store business which she has run for almost 10 years and which serves as her source of income. She will buy grocery items such as drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, chips, biscuits, candies, powdered juice and powdered milk from the amount she is requesting. She wants to expand her business in the future for their sustainability and for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, chips, biscuits, candies, powdered juice and powdered milk.

loans.name: Octavio Enrique

texts.es: Octavio es un microempresario de 38 años de edad que reside en compañía de su familia en el municipio de Barranquilla y se dedica a la elaboración de capelladas de calzado que confecciona en su taller y suministra por contratos a todo costo a ensambladoras de calzado.  Su talento le ha permitido ser preferido entre mayoristas de la ciudad quienes solicitan de sus servicios para realizar la producción de capelladas de excelente calidad por un precio de oportunidad.  Este negocio le ha permitido ofrecer bienestar a su numerosa familia, él es padre de seis hijos menores de edad que en compañía de su cónyuge educan en valores y buenas costumbres, es por ello que para él es muy importante contar con los recursos pertinentes a la financiación de los materiales para su negocio, Octavio está aplicando una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar materiales como semicueros y adornos. Su meta a futuro es continuar con su microempresa más consolidada y comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Octavio, 38, is a small business owner who lives with his family in Barranquilla.

In his workshop he makes uppers for shoes which he then sells to shoemakers by contract at a wide range of prices. He is sought after by wholesalers in the area, because of his quality and affordable prices.

The business has allowed him to look after his large family. He is the father of six young children who he brings up in the best way possible together with his wife.

To continue like this, it is important for him to have the necessary materials for his business readily available. He is asking for a loan, his first with Kiva, through the 'Mario Santo Domingo' foundation. He will buy material such as imitation leather and decorative pieces.

His goal in the future is to strengthen his business and buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy shoe-making materials.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a hardworking entrepreneur who farms seaweed in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy seaweed seedlings and rope for her farming seaweed business.

Florita has been in this business for 6 years. Florita earns more income from fishing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Florita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and rope for her business.

loans.name: Jose Eliberto

texts.es: Con 34 años de edad José muestra cada día que es un hombre trabajador, él vive actualmente en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de una niña de 3 años y un varón de 7 años de edad. José es un hombre dedicado a su familia, que se gana la vida desde hace 16 años, como ayudante de bodega, lo cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia. José desea construir una fosa séptica, en su vivienda, ya que no cuenta con un lugar adecuado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda, y de esta manera cuidar de la sanidad de su hogar. Con el crédito anterior José cambio el techo de su vivienda, brindando mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 34, is an everyday example of a hard-working man. He lives at the moment in his own home with his wife and two children - a two-year-old girl and a boy who is seven.

He is a dedicated family man, who has been working for 16 years in a winery. This job gives him enough income to support his family.

He would like to build a septic tank in his home; something his family needs for a better quality of life.

Therefore, he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy materials such as bricks, cement, sand, gravel and iron, so he can build one himself.

Once completed, it will provide his family with a healthier place to live. He would also like to improve the living conditions for his family by changing the roof on their home too.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build a septic tank for his home.

loans.name: Jesus Alfredo

texts.es:
Jesus tiene 22 años y se dedica de lleno a la agricultura en terrenos que le dijo su padre ya que es hijo unico, es soltero y ya se graduo de la universidad.

Se decida a la siembra de maiz y el dinero lo solicita para compra de fertilizantes y abonos para cuidar los cultivos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hecer ejercicio.
texts.en:
Jesus, 22, is fully dedicated to his agricultural work on the land his father gave him. He is an only child and single. He recently graduated from university.

He grows corn and will use the loan to buy fertilizer and compost to look after his crops.

In his free time he likes to do sport.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 60 years old and married with ten children. With one child in school, Paz works very hard to provide for them.

Paz runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries to sell.

Paz has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Paz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients such as flour, yeast, margarine and sugar for her business.

Sally has been in this business for 2 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.
