loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, yeast, margarine and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Fayry Esther

texts.es: Fayry de 43 años es habitante de Barranquilla un municipio del Atlántico en donde reside en compañía de sus padres. Ella encontró la oportunidad de progresar y beneficiar a su familia a través de su propio negocio y aunque durante años laboró en una empresa privada, al quedar cesante, tomó la decisión de emprender su propio negocio de venta de mercancías, el cual fue posible con el apoyo de su padre.  Ella promocionó prendas de vestir y calzado entre los integrantes de una comunidad religiosa en la que se congrega y con el paso del tiempo extendió su oferta de artículos a productos de consumo masivo; queso y suero. Hasta el momento ha obtenido excelentes resultados y espera formalizar un almacén que le garantice muchas más ventas.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar prendas de vestir  y calzado para aprovechar la temporada de fin de año. Su principal prioridad es continuar ayudando a su familia y mantenerse en el negocio.
texts.en:
Fayry, 43, lives in Barranquilla, Atlantico, with her parents.

She realised that she could look after her family by opening her own business. She set up a clothes selling business with the help of her father. She did this when she was made redundant after working in a private entity for several years.

She markets clothes and shoes among the people in the religious community where she lives. She has also started to branch out into offering a wider range of products such as cheese and whey.

She has been very successful up to now and would like to open her own store which will guarantee more sales.

She is asking for a loan from Kiva, through the 'Mario Santo Domingo' foundation to buy clothes and footwear so she can make the most of the season which is approaching.

Her main aim in life is to continue supporting her family and running her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes for the end of year season.

loans.name: Sarba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de femmes issues du même quartier sont unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. Madame Sarba est la responsables elle est âgée de 68 ans et mère de  deux enfants dont une fille et un garçon.Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de légumes et d’arachide depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 300 000 francs CFA elle va se payer des sacs d'arachide et de légumes qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de  petit marché de sa localité.Actuellement son activité marche bien  car elle une bonne clientèle. les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge.les besoins  alimentaire de sa famille et de renforcer ses épargne au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who come from the same neighborhood and who are united by good social and professional relationships.  Sarba is the group's representative.  She is 68 years old and the mother of two children, a boy and a girl.  She is an active retailer who has been selling vegetables and groundnut for a long time.  She has a good work experience.

Sarba will use her loan of 300,000 CFA francs to buy bags of groundnut and vegetables.  She will resell her goods on a retail basis at the small market in her locality.  Her business is doing well at the moment because she has a good group of customers.  Thanks to her profits, she is able to take care of her family's nutritional needs and to boost her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and groundnut.

loans.name: Henriette Mame's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis 2008 et il regroupe des femmes issues du même village et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. Madame Henriette est une femme mariée âgée de 50 ans et mère de deux garçons et une fille tous scolarisés.elle debout à gauche de la photo la main levée.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus et d’encens et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine avec son nouveau crédit de 250 000 francs elle va se payer des balles de tissus divers et des paquets d’encens qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son village. Actuellement son activité marche bien .
Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires  scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was created in 2008 and brings together women who come from the same village and are united by good social and professional relationships.

Henriette is a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of two boys and one girl, all of whom attend school. She is standing on the left of the picture with her hand raised. She sells fabrics and incense and has good experience in this line of work. She will use her new loan of 250 000 francs to buy bales of various fabrics and packets of incense which she will resell to retail customers in her village. Her business is currently doing well.

The profits she earns will allow her to take care of her children's food, education, and health needs, and to build her savings with the "banc villageois".

loans.use: to buy bales of fabric and incense for resale.

loans.name: Asmao's Group

texts.fr:
Créé en Janvier 2002, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village .Elles ont comme activité le petit commerce. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe.
 
Madame Asmao, (debout à l’extrême  droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est veuve et mère de 04 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires (jus de fruits)

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 02 sacs de 50 kg  pain de singe 05 sacs de 50 kg d’oseille, des sachets et 03 sacs de 50 kg de sucre et d’autres condiments pour la préparation de jus.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte s’occuper de la dépense journalière et de ses enfants (habillements, scolarité et soins médicaux).
texts.en:
Created in January of 2002, this "banc villageois" is made up of women who come from the same village. They are small retailers. Group meetings benefit from a good atmosphere.

Asmao (standing on the far right and raising her hand) is the group's featured borrower. She is a widow and the mother of 4 children. She sells fruit juice.

She plans to use her new loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of monkey bread, five 50-kilo bags of sorrel, small plastic bags, three 50-kilo bags of sugar, and other ingredients needed to make juice.

She plans to use the profits she earns to take care of the daily expenses and her children's needs (clothing, education, health care).

loans.use: to buy 2 50-kilo bags of monkey bread, 5 50-kilo bags of sorrel, small plastic bags, 3 50-kilo bags of sugar, and other ingredients needed for juice preparation.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Créé en Juillet 2006, ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives. Il existe une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aminata (assise à l’extrême gauche avec la main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de patte d’arachide et d’autres condiments qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 03 seaux de 25 kg de pattes d’arachide et d’autres condiments pour le revendre en détails chez elle.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte participer à la dépense quotidienne et aux soins médicaux de sa famille
texts.en:
Created in July 2006, this group is made up of very active women who get along well with one another.  Their main activity is small retail business.

Aminata (seated at the far left in the photo and raising her hand) is the group's featured borrower.  She is married and the mother of nine children.  She sells groundnut paste and other condiments which she buys at weekly markets.

She will be using this new loan to buy three buckets of groundnut paste (each weighing 25 kilos), as well as other condiments.  She will then resell her goods on a retail basis at home.

She plans to use her profits to contribute to her family's day-to-day expenses and to cover medical costs.

loans.use: to buy three buckets of groundnut and other condiments to resale on a retail basis.

loans.name: Fanta's Group

texts.fr:
Créé depuis Décembre 2009, les femmes du B.V sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué. Elles ont comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame Fanta, (assise à l’extrême droite en foulard jaune avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est veuve et mère de 06 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires (huile de palme et poisson sec). Elle a une bonne maitrise du travail pour l’avoir effectué pendant plusieurs années. 
 
Avec son nouveau prêt elle désire acheter 05 bidons de 20 litre d’huile de palme 03 paniers de poissons sec pour  les revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Les bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge ses enfants (habillements, soins médicaux et payer leur scolarités).
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" was created on December of 2009 and is made up of women who are very supportive of each other and have been able to develop a commendable solidarity and group spirit thanks to their working relationships. They are principally small retailers.

Fanta (sitting on the far right wearing a yellow head scarf and raising her hand) is the group's featured borrower. She is a widow and the mother of 6 children. She sells food products (palm oil and dried fish). She has a good understanding of her work, having done it for many years.

She wants to use her new loan to buy five 20-litre cans of palm oil and 3 baskets of fresh fish to resell to retail customers in her district.

The profits she makes allow her to take care of her children (clothing, health care and educational costs).

loans.use: to buy 5 20-litre cans of palm oil and 3 baskets of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is a 37-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Zahra is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth in different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a good life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth in different colors and earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Zolia de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal y ropa desde hace 20 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas es como ha podido salir adelante, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Zolia is 59 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband.

She has been selling personal use products and clothing for twenty years. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. The earnings she obtains allows her to get ahead.

She is asking for a new loan in order to buy perfume, lotions, creams, shampoo, and deodorants, buying everything at wholesale, so she can continue with her work and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy perfume, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc, buying everything at wholesale prices

loans.name: Osmin Mauricio

texts.es: Don Osmin de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, Él se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene 10 años de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela que cada día lo prefieren más. Desea invertir en su negocio en la compra de mayor cantidad de verduras y frutas y así aumentar sus ventas e ingresos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para hacer la inversión ya que no cuenta con los recursos suficinetes para hacerlo por su cuenta.
texts.en:
Osmin is 54 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and son.

He is dedicated to the sale of fruits and vegetables. His business in located in his home. He has been engaged in business for 10 years and so he already has many customers and they prefer him more everyday .

He wants to invest in his business buying more vegetables and fruits thereby increasing his sales and income. This is why he is asking for this loan from Apoyo Integral in order to make the investment as he does not have sufficient resources to do it on his own.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn has engaged in farming for the last five years. She toils the land and grows rice. She is a 35-year-old married woman and has two school-aged children. Her income mainly goes for food and school expenses. Aside from farming, she raises and sells hogs to have supplemental income.
Her husband is a carpenter.

Marlyn has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, pig feed and piglets. This could help enhance her sources of income and she will slowly able to settle her obligations. These resources could improve the yield of her farm and she could continue to raise quality hogs.

She is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage them successfully to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy   fertilizer, pig feed and piglets.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 39 years old and is engaged in a snack food selling business to earn a living. She has sold food for five years to the community of Albuera, Leyte, while her husband works hard as a laborer. They work together to provide for the needs of their big family. They have seven children; five adult and two school-aged.

In the future, she is thinking of starting up a sari-sari (variety) store business. Perhaps she wants to enhance their livelihood to give a good education to her children.

Emelia is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to help her buy food ingredients such as fruit, sugar, cooking oil and flour. She also plans to buy grocery items.

Definitely, she will start her store business.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as fruit, sugar, cooking oil, flour and other grocery items.

loans.name: Sabira

texts.en:
Sabira is 28 years old; she is a married woman. She has four children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, and in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

Sabira expects a boost in her earnings with the loan, and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arlyn is 35 years old and has one child in school.

Arlyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years.

Arlyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto tiene la edad de 33 años, está en unión libre y vive con la esposa actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 33 years old, in a common-law relationship and currently lives with his wife.

He wants a loan for the purchase of seedlings and fertilizer to provide assistance to a coffee plantation. He wants to give the crops appropriate maintenance as this will permit a better production and thus higher earnings. 

He hopes in the future to give his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer. 

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided a loan with better terms and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and supplies for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros and her family live a simple life in the town of Albuera in Leyte, Philippines. She has earned a living for 40 years by selling food to the community. And she raised her eight children (who are now already grown up) with this business. Currently, Milagros is 66 years old but still determined to improve her livelihood.

She plans to start a sari-sari (variety) store business. For this, she needs capital to operate her food selling business continuously and able to save money to start a store business.

Now she needs PHP 5,000 to buy food ingredients such as flour, sugar, cooking oil and fruit.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as flour, sugar, cooking oil and fruit.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be good. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products.

She hopes that in the future she will expand the business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more beauty product stock.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as patient. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes.

She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 39 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines.

Alicia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Alicia has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling coconuts.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Cristina dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap and canned goods.

loans.name: Dellie

texts.en:
Dellie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains to sell in her rice grains business.

Dellie has been in this business for 5 years. Dellie earns more income from buying and selling woven bamboo.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Dellie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell in her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cecilia is 47 years old and has three children who are in school.

Cecilia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evangeline is 48 years old and has children who are in school.

Evangeline has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a hardworking vegetable vendor. She sells vegetables like squash, okra, beans, tomatoes, eggplant, green leafy vegetables and assorted spices. She has a stall situated inside the market place, catering to locals in her place.

She is a 35-year-old woman with two children. Together with her children, she lives in the town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol.

She has requested a loan to acquire capital to buy various stocks of vegetables. More stocks of vegetables will help her daily earnings improve.

In the future, Marina is hoping that she will become successful in her project to improve the family’s living conditions and also finance the schooling of her children as well.

loans.use: to buy various stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Lisonia

texts.en:
Lisonia is married and a mother of five children.

In order to provide the needs of her family, she raises her pigs and sells them to the market. She has been running her piggery business for many years.

She wants to expand her business to earn more income. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase food supplements to feed to her pigs.

In the near future, she want to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with two children. She is 27 years old now. Jocelyn is a very hard working entrepreneur.; she has a buy-and-sell home care product business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like plates, etc..

Jocelyn has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like plates, etc.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Catherine is 18 years old and is the third of four children in the family. Her mother, Regina, is a member of NWTF and supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Catherine is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in her second year of this four year course.

Regina is borrowing PHP 7,000 to pay tuition fees of her daughter Catherine for the second semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When she graduates, Catherine plans to be gainfully employed so she can help to improve the quality of life of her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Castorina

texts.pt:
Dona Castorina tem 65 anos, tem uma filha de 24 anos e um neto de 3 anos que moram com ela. Ela mora em Maua em São Paulo. Ela e uma pessoa determinada, batalhadora e muito simpática. Uniu-se ao Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário(BPCS)para ter acesso aos serviços financeiros e este é o seu 12 empréstimo com BPCS.
Castorina tem uma loja de Roupas. Ela tem seu comercio há mais de 12 anos tem uma grande clientela na região de Mauá e  também vende para outros estados. Começou trabalhar vendendo de  porta em porta para ajudar no sustento da família .Sua atividade e especial por que  trabalha com vários tipos de roupas e de boa qualidade. Tem muito amor com o seu trabalho e trata seus clientes com muita dedicação.
Castorina  precisa de um empréstimo para a compra de roupas e vestidos de festa. A renda extra deste empréstimo e utilizada para pagar a escola de sua neta, e guarda em poupança .
Ela tem um sonho de comprar uma casa e um carro novo.
Castorina  gostaria falar para os investidores que se sente grata pela parceria  e falou também que  gostaria de algum dia poder dar  um abraço naqueles que ajudaram. Está muito orgulhosa de sua atividade por que hoje ela e uma pequena empresaria.
texts.en:
Castorina is 65, has a daughter of 24 years and a 3-year-old grandson who live with her. She lives in Maua in Sao Paulo. She is a determined, hardworking and very friendly person. She solicited a loan from Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário(BPCS) to gain access to financial services, and this is her 12th loan with BPCS.

Castorina has a clothing store. She has been in this business for over 12 years, and has a large clientele in the Mauá region and sells in other states as well. She began by selling door-to-door in order to help support her family. She business is special to her because she is able to sell a variety of clothes of good quality. She loves this work and treats her customers with great dedication.

Castorina need a loan to buy clothes and party dresses for to sell. The extra income from this loan will used to pay for school for her granddaughter, and to continue saving.
She has a dream to buy a house and a new car.

Castorina would like to tell Kiva lenders that she is grateful for the partnership, and that one day she would like to hug every person that helped her. She very proud of her business because she has become a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy clothes and party dresses to sell from her self-run business

loans.name: Lirio Dos Vales I Group

texts.pt:
O grupo Lírio dos Vales I se conheceu na comunidade de Maua são amigas há muitos anos. O grupo já solicitou três  empréstimos com o Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário (BPCS).  Cicera vende utensílios domésticos e cosméticos, Maria vende Roupas e bijuterias, e Neusa vende roupas.  
Vanicléia é a líder do grupo e tem 31 anos. Ela é casada tem 3 filhos com idade de 10, 8 e 3 anos, atualmente os filhos de 10 e 8 anos estão frequentando a escola . Ela mora com seus familiares  na comunidade de Maua  em São Paulo. Ela  e uma pessoa  responsável, alegre, determinada e muito simpática .
Vanicléia vende utensílios domésticos, bolsas e cosméticos, trabalha em sua comunidade para ajudar no sustento da casa. Ela tem três anos  de experiência com este negócio. Começou a trabalhar nessa área porque tem filhos pequenos e precisava ajudar no sustento da casa. Ela sempre gostou de trabalhar com o publico, ela vende de porta em porta e os clientes também vão ate a sua casa comprar seus produtos. Ela se sente motivada e muito satisfeita  com o seu  trabalho. A atividade dela e especial porque é um meio de sobrevivência  e sustento para a família. 
Vanicléia  precisa de um empréstimo para a compra de cosméticos,utensílios domésticos e bolsas para as vendas de final de ano. A renda extra de este empréstimo permiti  que ela poupe e também compre mais mercadorias. No futuro, ela planeja expandir e abrir uma loja . O Grupo gostaria de dizer aos investidores,que se sentem agradecidas por saber que existem pessoas interessadas em ajudar ouras que precisam.
texts.en:
The “Lírio dos Vales I” group met in the community of Maua and have been friends for many years. The group has already taken three loans through Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário (BPCS). Cicera sells household goods and cosmetics, Maria sells clothes and costume jewelry, and Neusa sells clothing. 

Vanicléia is the leader of the group and is 30 years old. She is married and has three children that are 10, 8, and 3 years old. Currently her 10-year-old and 8-year-old are often in school. She lives with relatives in the community of Maua in Sao Paulo.

Vanicléia is a responsible, happy, determined, and very kind person. She sells household items, purses and cosmetics, working in her community to support her home. She has three years of experience with her business. She began working in this area because of her young children and a need to support her home.  

She has always liked working with people. She sells door-to-door, and clients also come to her home to buy her products. She feels motivated and very satisfied with her work. Her business is special to her because it is a means to support her family. Vanicléia needs a loan to buy more cosmetics, household items, purses to sell during the holidays. 

The extra income will permit her to invest in more merchandise. In the future, Vanicléia plans to expand her business and open her own store. The group would like to tell Kiva lenders that they feel grateful to know that there are people interested in helping others that need it.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, household items, and purses to sell during the holidays.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta is 47 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school.

Marta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marta has been raising pigs for eight years now and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Marta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lidia Habisag

texts.es: Lidia de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de atoles tipicos desde hace 15 años, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, gracias a sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de leche, harina, avena, cacao, azucar, entre otras cosas y asi poder continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Lidia is 42 years old. She lives in her own home with her family.

She has been dedicated to the sale of typical atoles (popular hot beverage, custard or pudding—ingredients can vary) for 15 years. Her business is located close to where she lives and she has many customers. Thanks to her sales she can pay some of the household expenses.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy milk, flour, oatmeal, cocoa, sugar and other items and thus be able to continue with her sales to have better income.

loans.use: to buy milk, flour, oatmeal, cocoa, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Alzira

texts.en:
Alzira is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 38 years old.

Alzira is living in a town near the school. She is running a kiosk in front of her house. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as rice, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, soap, biscuits and fish.

She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, soap, biscuits and fish.

loans.name: Amizade Ii Group

texts.pt:
O grupo Amizade II se conhecem há 8 anos.Todas são amigas e moram na mesma comunidade de Mauá -São Paulo. O grupo já solicitou 12 empréstimos com o Banco do Povo (BPCS).Todas as mutuarias tem atividades diferentes. Flávia trabalha como cabeleireira, Edna vende frios e Roupas, Maria das dores Vende frios e roupas, Maria Jose vende cama, mesa e banho. 
Carmelita  é a líder do grupo ela tem 56 anos, é separada e  mora sozinha. Ela é uma pessoa amorosa, companheira e batalhadora. Carmelita  vende roupas e cama,mesa,banho  em sua comunidade para se sustentar. Ela tem 23 anos de experiência com este negócio. Começou trabalhar nessa área para ajudar no sustento de casa quando se casou. A atividade dela e especial porque gosta de trabalhar com o publico, se sente feliz em servir as pessoas e gosta do que faz. Por não ter outra pessoa para dividir as despesas da casa  Carmelita sempre da a volta por cima, para vencer as dificuldades.  
Carmelita  precisa de um empréstimo para a compra de mais roupas e roupas de cama, mesa e banho para as vendas de final de ano. A renda extra deste empréstimo permitirá que ela viaje para comprar mais mercadorias em outro estado. No futuro, ela planeja reformar a sua casa. O Grupo gostaria de dizer aos investidores  que se sentem feliz ,por ter pessoas que se preocupam em ajudar outros microempreendedores.
texts.en:
The Amizade II group (Friendship Group) have known each other for eight years. They are all friends and live in the same community, Mauá, in Sao Paulo. The group has taken out 12 loans through Banco do Povo (BPCS). All of the borrowers have different business. Flavia works as a hairdresser, Edna and Maria da Dores sell food products and clothing, and Maria Jose sells beds, tables, and bathrooms.

Carmelita is the leader of the group. She is 56 years old, is separated and lives alone. She is a loving, compassionate, and hardworking person. Carmelita sells bed sheets, table clothes, and bathroom fabrics in her community in order to support herself. 

She has 23 years of experience with this business. She started working in this area to help support her home, when she was married. Her business is special to her because she likes working with the public, is happy to serve people and enjoys it. Without someone to share household expenses, Carmelita has always worked to get ahead and to overcome difficulties.

Carmelita needs a loan to buy more bed sheets, table clothes, and bathroom fabrics to sell over the holidays. The extra income from this loan will allow her to travel to buy more goods in another states. In the future, she plans to renovate her home. The Amizade II group would like to tell Kiva lenders that they are happy that there are people who care about supporting microentrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy bed covers, table clothes, and bathroom fabrics to sell over the holidays in her microbusiness

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela, 29, is a married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Shiela has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Shiela requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, rice, fish, etc.

In the future, Shiela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, rice, fish, etc.

loans.name: Rea

texts.en:
Rea, 40, is a married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rea has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Rea requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

In the future, Rea would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Kasichana

texts.en:
Kasichana is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past five years, selling goat meat. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is married. He has practiced agriculture, mainly bananas, for now five years. He manages to sell a pickup of bananas every month, and therefore, he is able to provide for his family needs.

At this moment, Samuel wants to plant more bananas, but he needs labor. He is requesting money to pay for labor so that his bananas are planted.

In the future, he desires to start a business to supplement his income.

loans.use: to pay labor so that his bananas are planted.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 52 years old and married with three children.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. She has been raising chickens for 10 years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Evangeline requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena has a stall inside the market place in her locality where she sells items like slippers, shoes, sandals, pants, t-shirts, bags, and other dry goods. She has been engaged in that kind of livelihood for many years now.

She is 50-year-old married woman who has eight children. Four of her children are still attending school.

She would like to improve her main of source of income to become more productive and improve the family’s living conditions.

Lucena wants to buy additional stocks of dry goods like footwear and clothing. These could attract potential buyers and augment her daily earnings.

With the presence of the resources, she is hoping that someday, she will become successful and able to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dry goods like foot wear and clothing.

loans.name: Logina

texts.en:
Logina, 45, is a married woman with three children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Logina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Logina has been in this business for 15 years.

Logina requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more balut, tempura, fish balls, softdrinks, etc. to sell.

Logina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more balut, tempura, fish balls, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia, 40, is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lucia has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Lucia requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy cuticle remover, acetone, nail polish and other supplies for her business.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy cuticle remover, acetone, nail polish and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Fatima Marcya

texts.es: Fatima es una joven universitaria de 23 años. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando en una botica. Ella estudio la  carrera de Farmacia y Bioquimica porque le gusta mucho. Además de ser una joven muy aplicada y trabajadora en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a jugar voley con sus amigas. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar los tramites para el grado de bachiller. Se siente muy agradecida con los socios de Kiva por ayudarle a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Fatima, aged 23, is a young university student. She works in a pharmacy. She studied for a degree in Pharmacy and Biochemistry because she likes the subject very much. As well as working hard, she loves to go out and play volleyball with her friends.

She is requesting a loan to pay the university fees for her Bachelor's degree. She is very grateful to Kiva partners for helping her accomplish her goals.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for her Bachelor's degree

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 57 years old and married with one child.

Lydia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for five years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lydia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 51 years old, married, and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Delia operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for one year. She sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

Delia requested a loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as spices, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as spices, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana es una microempresaria de 67 años que a pesar de su avanzada edad manifiesta contar con una vitalidad y entusiasmo para continuar su vida con mucho dinamismo y deseos de adquirir sus propios ingresos. Esta mujer anteriormente se dedicaba a vender comidas de su autoría a vecinos y transeúntes del barrio donde reside en el municipio de Malambo, sin embargo decidió cambiar de actividad motivada por una amiga quien le propuso comercializar mercancías varias; prendas de vestir, calzado y accesorios, las cuales le generarían mejores utilidades, así que Ana adquirió la mercancía e inmediatamente la promocionó entres sus conocidos, contando con una gran acogida. Ana realiza visitas a sus clientes en sus domicilios para exhibirles las nuevas colecciones y está disposición de sus clientes a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. Como la temporada navideña se aproxima, solicitó un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar jeans, blusas, vestidos y accesorios, para tener disponible e incrementar sus ventas.  Ana desea mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a micro entrepreneur of 67 years of age. Despite her advanced age she has shown a vitality and enthusiasm to continue her life with a lot of dynamism and desires to earn her own income.

This woman previously sold food to her neighbors and passer-bys from her neighborhood where she lives in the municipality of Malambo. She decided to change her work motivated by a friend who proposed various commodities she could sell: clothing, shoes, and accessories which would generate better profits. So Ana bought the merchandise and immediately made it known among her acquaintances and was warmly welcomed.

Ana makes visits to her customers in their homes in order to show her new collections and is available to her clients from 8:00am until 8:00pm. Since the Christmas season is approaching she is asking for a Kiva loan. This is her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy jeans, blouses, dresses, and accessories, to have available to sell in order to increase her sales.

Ana wants to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy jeans, blouses, dresses, and accessories.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. In addition she also operates a tailoring and grocery that earns her another source of income.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mwelu

texts.en:
Mwelu is married and has three children, who attend school. She operates a vegetables stall at the market, where she sells to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

Mwelus requested a loan from Yehu for 50,000 KES, which she will use to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 39 and married with three sons and two daughters. They all live in a populated area in Lahore. Saima’s husband owns a fruit and vegetable shop in a nearby market where he sells fresh fruits and vegetables. His stock arrives almost every day and he sells the most common vegetables used in almost every dish such as onions, tomatoes, green chilies, ginger, garlic and coriander. He also offers a fresh variety of fruits in each season. Oranges and pomegranate are readily available in the winter. 

Saima is requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan to help her husband buy fruits and vegetables for his shop. Her loan will help him to increase sales and improve the outlook of his shop and help his business to grow and flourish. Saima and her husband dream of becoming financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Samantha Rubi

texts.es: Samantha es una joven estudiante de la carrera de diseño de modas, actualmente tiene 19 años y cursa su 2do ciclo en su instituto. Ella se dedica diariamente a confeccionar, y reparar trajes en su pequeño negocio que tienen sus padres. Ella comenta que desde pequeña tuvo la afición sobre los trajes y diseños, es por eso que actualmente lucha día a día para ser mejor estudiante y persona. El préstamo solicitado es para poder pagar sus pensiones y comprar algunos materiales requeridos en sus clases. Ella se siente muy agradecida con las personas de Kiva por ayudarle a cumplir sus meta.
texts.en:
Samantha is a young fashion design student. She is 19 years old and is in the second year of her studies. She works daily making clothing and doing alterations for her parents' small business.

She says that she has loved clothing and design since she was very young, and that is why she works hard every day to become a better student and person.

She will use the loan to pay university fees and purchase materials necessary for her classes. She is very grateful to everyone at Kiva for helping her accomplish her goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Rosangela

texts.pt:
Rosângela tem 56 anos e é casada a 34 anos. Ela tem 4 filhos adultos. Ela mora com seu esposo na comunidade de Mauá em  São Paulo. Ela e uma pessoa maravilhosa, engraçada, carinhosa, amigável, e tem muita paz com se próprio. Rosângela se juntou com o Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário (BPCS) para ter acesso aos serviços financeiros e este é o seu 12 empréstimo com (BPCS).
Rosângela faz bordados de panos de prato, toalhas, fraldas de bebe e uniformes personalizados e os vende na sua loja, em sua comunidade para se sustentar. Ela tem mais de 17 anos de experiência com este negócio. Começou trabalhar nesta área porque sempre gostou de bordados desde criança e com o credito de Banco do Povo ela tinha a oportunidade de abrir seu negocio. A atividade dela e especial para ela porque ela faz tudo com amor e quem compra gosta e elogia seus produtos. 
Rosângela precisa de um empréstimo para comprar material prima como linhas, tecidos, uma maquina de bordar e tinta. A renda extra deste empréstimo permitirá que ela continue investindo na própria loja. No futuro, ela planeja ter uma loja maior de confecções de bordados.
Rosângela gostaria falar para os investidores que “Agradeço por acreditar em mim. Futuramente eu quero retribuir ao outras pessoas da comunidade como eu fui ajudada.” Ela é orgulhosa da sua atividade porque traz sustento e se sente muito satisfeita e feliz com o trabalho.
texts.en:
Rosangela is 56 years old, and has been married for 34 years. She has four adult children. She lives with her husband in the Mauá community in São Paulo. She's a wonderful person, funny, affectionate, friendly, and peaceful. Rosangela started borrowing through Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário (BPCS) to gain access to financial services and this is her 12th loan with (BPCS).

Rosangela embroiders dish cloths, towels, custom bibs and even diapers, and sells in her shop in her community to support herself. She has over 17 years of experience with her business. She started working in this area because she has enjoyed embroidery since childhood and through her loans with BPCS she had the opportunity to open her business. Her business is special to her because she does everything with great care and everyone who buys from her always and praises purchase her products.

Rosangela needs a loan to buy raw material such as thread, fabric, a machine for embroidery and dye. The extra income from this loan will enable her to continue investing in the store. In the future, she plans to have a larger store of embroidered clothing.

Rosangela would like to tell Kiva lenders: "Thank you for believing in me. In the future I want to give back to others in the community, like I was helped." She is proud of her business because it supports her, and she feels very pleased and happy with her work.

loans.use: to buy thread, dye, fabric and an embroidery machine for her micro-business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 56 years old and married with six children. For the past 10 years, she has run a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Delia has borrowed 13 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.  

Delia is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Luz Saida

texts.es: Luz es una joven estudiante de la carrera de Farmacias, actualmente tiene 18 años y cursa el primer ciclo en su instituto.  Ella comenta que desde pequeña tuvo la afición por estudiar farmacia ya que le gusta preocuparse por la salud de los demás, es por eso que actualmente lucha día a día para ser mejor estudiante y persona. El préstamo solicitado es para poder pagar sus pensiones y comprar algunos materiales requeridos en sus clases. Ella se siente muy agradecida con las personas de Kiva por ayudarle a cumplir sus meta.
texts.en:
Luz is a pharmacy student. She is 18 years old and in the first cycle at her institution. She says that she had a passion for studying pharmacy ever since she was little because she likes to care for the health of others. That is why she now struggles, day to day, in order to be a better student and person.

The requested loan is to be able to make her payments to the university and to buy some required class materials. She is very grateful to the people from Kiva for helping her to meet her goal.

loans.use: to make her university payments.

loans.name: Jhosselym Jhuoely

texts.es: Jhosselym es una  universitaria de 23 años. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando en una pequeña empresa como asistente. Ella decidió estudiar la carrera de Administración y Sistemas porque ella considera que es necesario contar con profesionales capaces de tomar decisiones que generen valor económico y social en una empresa. Además de dedicarse a su trabajo y estudios en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a jugar basquetbol con sus amistades. Comenta que quiere especializarse en Recursos Humanos. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de la universidad. ya se encuentra a 3 años de terminar su carrera. Se siente muy agradecida con los socios de Kiva por ayudarla a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Jhosselym, age 23, is a university student. She is currently working at a small company as an assistant. She decided to study for a degree in systems administration because she thinks it is necessary to count on capable professionals to make decisions that generate financial and social value for a company. In addition to working and her studies, she likes to play basketball with her friends in her free time. She says that she wants to specialize in human resources.

She is requesting the loan to be able to make her payments to the university. She is very grateful to the Kiva members for helping her to meet her goals.

loans.use: to make university payments.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with 7 children who operates a business to sell sugar, rice, soda, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local people.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuating prices. She will use the 21,000 KES loan to buy sugar, bread, flour, soap, and other items. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy  sugar, bread, flour, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 23-year-old married woman with 1 child.

She has had a retail business for 6 years. She will use the loan to purchase maize, beans, sugar, salt, milk, tea leaves, and soap and hopes this will help her to expand her retail shop.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children to university level.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying her previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans, sugar, salt, milk, tea leaves, and soap.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 29 years old. He is married to Marceller and blessed with five children between three and 13 years old. For the past five years, David has been a livestock trader and he earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

David is requesting a loan with VisionFund Kenya to buy more cattle to resell in local village markets. He plans to use the profit from his loan to pay school fees for his children. In the future, David hopes to become a good father to his children in terms of provision and sustainability.

loans.use: to buy cattle to resell in village markets

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila is a 67-year-old married woman with nine children.

Petronila has raised livestock for 16 years and requests 26,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has previously borrowed 13 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

Petronila would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 62 years old and is married with two children. For the past year, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlinda has borrowed one previous loan from NWTF to sustain her business.

Erlinda is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Maria tem 52 anos é casada não tem filhos. Ela mora com 4 parentes na comunidade de Mauá em  São Paulo. Ela e uma pessoa honesta, sempre ativa e muito batalhadora. Maria  se juntou com Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário - BPCS para ter acesso aos serviços financeiros e este é o seu 14° empréstimo com BPCS.
Maria fabrica pães em sua fabrica para seu sustento e de sua família. Ela contratou 40 funcionários na fabrica. Vende seus pães na comunidade e na grande cidade de São Paulo. Ela tem 10 anos de experiência com este negócio. Começou trabalhar nesta área junto com os irmão pois queria fazer algo diferente e ajudar a todos.Cada irmãos contribuiu com uma quantia para iniciar o empreendimento. A atividade dela e especial porque a cada vez que cresce ela  ajuda novas pessoas. Ela ajuda e faz doações para muitas pessoas da sua família e da região onde mora, incluindo grupos filantrópicos, orfanatos e asilos e crianças com câncer.
 Maria precisa de um empréstimo para compra de matéria prima para a fabricação de mais Paes. A renda extra deste empréstimo permitirá que ela invista no próprio empreendimento. No futuro, ela planeja expandir mais a sua fabrica, para assim gerar mais empregos, e ajudar mais pessoas. 
Maria gostaria falar para os investidores  que  se sente feliz em saber que outras pessoas do mundo inteiro está ajudando e gostaria que eles conhecessem o Brasil e que continuassem acreditando no povo Brasileiro. Ela é orgulhosa da sua atividade porque ajuda seus sobrinhos, irmãos, e pessoas da comunidade gerando empregos.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old, married, and has no children. She lives with four relatives in the Mauá community in São Paulo. She is an honest, active and hardworking person. Maria works with Kiva partner Banco do Povo Crédito Solidário (BPCS) to have access to financial services, and this is her 14th loan with BPCS.

Maria makes bread in her bakery to support herself and her family. She employees 40 people at her bakery. She sells her bread to her community and in the city of São Paulo. She has 10 years of experience with this business. She started working in this area along with her brother because she wanted to do something different and help others. Each sibling contributed an amount to start the venture. 

Maria needs a loan to purchase raw material to make more bread. The extra income from this loan will allow her to further invest her business. In the future, she plans to further expand her bakery, thus generating more jobs, and helping more people. She loves her work, because her business keeps growing and because it helps people. She helps and donates to many people in her family and area of ​​residence, including philanthropic groups, orphanages, nursing homes and children with cancer.

Mary would like to tell Kiva lenders that she feels happy to know that other people around the world are helping, and one day would like them to visit Brazil and to continue believing in the Brazilian people. She is proud of her business because it helps her nephews, brothers, and people in the community by creating jobs.

loans.use: to pay her supplier for more flour and yeast, and hire employees at her bakery

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 65-year-old woman with two children.

Evangeline has raised pigs for 8 years and requests 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has previously borrowed 16 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Darwin Yiomar

texts.es: Darwin es un joven universitario de 18 años. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el cuarto ciclo de su carrera de Psicología. El decidió estudiar esta carrera porque para el es muy importante la salud emocional de la persona ya sea en diferentes ámbitos donde se encuentre. Ademas de ser un joven aplicado en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a jugar fútbol con sus amigos. Para obtener algún ingreso trabaja esporadicamente como asistente en un consultorio. El solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios. Ya se encuentra a tres años de terminar su carrera. Se siente agradecido con las personas que le pueden ayudar a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Darwin, age 18, is a university student. He is currently in the fourth cycle of his studies for a degree in psychology. He decided to study for this degree because people's emotional health in different environments is very important to him. In addition to being an industrious young man, he likes to play soccer with his friends in his free time. In order to get some income, he works intermittently as a helper at a clinic.

He requested the loan to be able to make his educational payments. He is three years away from completing his degree. He is grateful to the people who are able to help him meet his goals.

loans.use: to make his university payments.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman with 10 children. She describes herself as ambitious and operates a farm to grow maize and raise cows. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are localpeople. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather.

She will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is very hard working woman who grows rice as the main source of income to the entire family. She is a resident in the town of Alicia, Bohol.

She is 52-year-old married woman and has five children, two attend school.

She has requested a loan to acquire capital to purchase fertilizer. These serve as tools to gain a bountiful harvest and slowly augment her income. SHe plans to start to save money for emergency purposes.

In the future, Margarita is determined to continue work hard to improve the family’s living conditions and finance her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 47-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lolita has had a coconut wine vending business for 6 years and requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Yunapi

texts.en:
Yunapi is a widow who works hard to support her family through operating a used clothing business for 6 years.

Yunapi requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell to her customers.

In the future, Yunapi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina is a 25-year-old woman with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lorina has had a fishing business for 2 years and requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Lorina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is married and works as a corn farmer in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past 15 years and she works hard to support her family. 

Elvira is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Raimundo Yonathan

texts.es: Raimundo es un joven universitario de 23 años. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el noveno ciclo de su carrera de Administración. El decidió estudiar esta carrera porque para el es muy importante el espíritu emprendedor, capaz de participar en la gestión y dirección de empresas. Ademas de ser un joven aplicado en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a jugar fútbol con sus amigos. Para obtener algún ingreso trabaja esporadicamente como taxista. El solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios. Ya se encuentra a un tan solo medio año de terminar su carrera. Se siente agradecido con las personas que le pueden ayudar a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Raimundo is a young university student, 23 years old. Currently he is in his ninth term of his administration degree. He decided to study this degree because for him the entrepreneurial spirit and being able to participate in the creation and management of business is very important. In addition to being a diligent young man, in his free time, he likes to go out to play soccer with his friends. To get some income, he works sporadically as a taxi driver. He asks for this loan to be able to pay his room and board for his school. He only has a half year left to finish his degree. He is grateful to the people who can help him achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay university room and board.

loans.name: Fayzulohon

texts.ru: 65 летный энергичный житель района Хамадони, Файзулохон. Он отец и дедушка. Файзулохон живет вместе с женой, сыном, дочери, невесткой и внуками. Его сын занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Дочка работает учительницей в школе. Жена Файзулохон занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Сам Файзулохон жизнелюбивый человек. Он занимается перевозом людей. У него имеется автомашина марки «Tune Gun». На ней он занимается таксистом на районе. Файзулохон свободное время ухаживает за домашних животных и помогает жене в работе. Файзулохон на данный момент не занимается, по причине, что срок документы автомашин закончилось. Для оформления документы не хватает денег, и Файзулохон из-за нехватки денежных средств обратился за кредитом.
texts.en:
Fayzulohon is an energetic 65-year-old resident of the Hamadoni region. He is a father and a grandfather and lives with his wife, their daughter, their son and his wife and the grandchildren. His son works in construction doing home renovations, and his daughter is a schoolteacher. His wife works in agriculture. Fayzulohon himself is a cheerful person who works transporting people. He has a Tune Gun brand vehicle with which he works as a taxi driver in the area. In his free time he cares for the livestock and helps his wife with her work.

Fayzulohon is not currently working because the papers for his car have expired. He doesn't have the money to renew them, which is why he is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to renew the papers for his car

loans.name: Sayuri

texts.es: Sayuri es una socia antigua. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando en una oficina contable. Ya esta en su ultimo ciclo de la carrera de Contabilidad ya que terminando le ayudara mucho para que así consiga mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones atrasadas de la universidad. Agradece mucho a los socios de kiva por ayudarla a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Sayuri is a former borrower. Currently she is working in an accounting office. She is in her last term for her accounting degree and finishing will help her a lot to be able to get better job opportunities. She asked for the loan to be able to pay her late fees for the university. She is very grateful to the Kiva members for helping her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Katty Barbara

texts.es: Katty tiene 38 años de edad, que estudia y trabaja. Actualmente esta estudiando su maestría para así poder ascender a otro puesto dentro su trabajo. Decidió estudiar dicha especialización, porque en un mundo tan competitivo solo los conocimientos avanzados permiten sobrevivir con éxito. Su pareja y sus dos hijas son su mayor motivación para seguir adelante. El crédito que solicito es para pagar sus pensiones de su maestría. Katty se siente feliz y agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por ayudar a personas como ella.
texts.en:
Katty, age 38, is going to school and working. She is now studying for a Master's degree in order to be able to rise to another position at her work. She decided to study said specialization because the world is so competitive that only those with advanced knowledge are allowed to survive successfully. Her life partner and their two children are her greatest motivation to get ahead.

The loan that she requested is to make payments for her Master's degree studies. Katty is happy and grateful to the Kiva lenders for helping people like her.

loans.use: to make payments for her Master's degree.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando es un joven universitario de 27 años. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando como ayudante en una mecánica. El decidió estudiar la carrera de Mecánica de mantenimiento porque desde muy pequeño le gustaba. Ademas de ser un joven aplicado en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a jugar fútbol con sus amigos. El solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios. Ya se encuentra a medio ciclo de terminar su carrera. Se siente muy agradecido con las personas que le pueden ayudar a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Rolando is a young university student, 27 years old. Currently, he is working as an assistant in a mechanic shop. He decided to study for a degree in mechanical maintenance because he has liked it since he was very young. In addition to being a diligent young man, in his free time he likes to go out to play soccer with his friends. He asked for the loan to be able to pay his education expenses. He has a half term left to finish his degree. He is very grateful to the people who can help him to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay university expenses.

loans.name: Marvin Brayan

texts.es: Marvin es un joven universitario de 20 años. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando como ayudante en una mecánica. El decidió estudiar la carrera de Mecánica de mantenimiento porque desde muy pequeño le gustaba ya que miraba a su padre trabajar también como mecánico. Ademas de ser un joven aplicado en sus ratos libres le gusta leer mucho como revistas, libros, periódicos, etc para así estar siempre informado de todo. El solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios. Ya se encuentra a un año de terminar su carrera. Se siente muy agradecido con las personas que le pueden ayudar a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Marvin is a young university student, 20 years old. Currently he is working as an assistant in a mechanic shop. He decided to study for a degree in mechanical maintenance because he has liked it since he was very young since he watched his father, who also works as a mechanic. In addition to being a diligent young man, in his free time, he likes to read a lot, such as magazines, books, newspapers, etc. to always be informed of everything. He asked for the loan to be able to pay his school fees. He is one year from finishing his degree. He is very grateful to the people who can help him to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a farm to grow maize and raise cows. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are local people. She describes her biggest business challenge as changing weather conditions.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and other farm inputs. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 35 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. For the past six years, she has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for her family. 

Mary Ann is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, home care products, and groceries

loans.name: Isack

texts.en:
Isack who is in his early 20s is single with no children. He has been selling clothes for one year now. He works from 8:00 am to 9:30 pm daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit.

This will be Isack's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to increase his stock of clothes. He dreams of having a big clothes shop. Isack will be accountable for paying back this loan.

loans.use: to increase his stock of clothes.

loans.name: Yoshelin

texts.es: Yoshelin es una socia antigua. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando como asistente en una empresa de la localidad. Para poder solventar sus gastos sigue criando sus animalitos (cuy, conejo, gallinas) y así solventar sus gastos económicos. Ya se encuentra a un año de terminar su carrera de Administración y Sistemas. Ella solicito el préstamo para poder pagar su pensiones atrasadas de la universidad. Yoshelin esta muy agradecida con los socios de kiva por creer en ella y ayudarla a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en: Yoshelin is a previous borrower. Currently she is working as an assistant in a local business. To be able to pay her expenses, she is still raising her animals (guinea pigs, rabbits, chickens) and with this, she covers her expenses. She is one year from finishing her degree in systems administration. She asked for the loan to be able to pay her late fees for the university. Yoshelin is very grateful to the Kiva members for believing in her and helping her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Juan Roque

texts.es: Juan es un  universitario de 31 años. Actualmente se encuentra trabajando en una empresa minera. El estudio Geología porque esta carrera para el es muy importante todo lo concerniente a la naturaleza. Ademas de trabajar y estudiar en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a jugar fútbol con sus amigos. El solicito el préstamo para poder pagar los tramites del grado de bachiller. Ya se encuentra a un tan solo poco tiempo para que le otorguen el grado de bachiller. Se siente agradecido con las personas de kiva por ayudarlo a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Juan is 31 years old and a university student. At the moment his working for a mining company.

He studied geology because everything concerning nature is very important to him.

After working and studying, he likes to play soccer with his friends in his free time.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay the tuition fees of his bachelors degree.

He is only a short time away from getting his bachelor's degree. He is very thankful to the people of Kiva for helping him to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees of his bachelor's degree.

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.en:
Gualberto, 49 years old, did not finish college. He lives with his spouse, with whom he has one child.

At a very young age, Gualberto was exposed to work in farms. His father planted different varieties of rice and taught him to cultivate, together with his other siblings.

Gualberto's previous loan was already fully paid; that's why he is taking another loan to purchase pesticides and fertilizers to combat the insects and to have good harvest.

His future plan is to venture into another business to have additional income for him to provide a good education to his only child.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Poor But Fun Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lam is 46 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Lam lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Lam faces is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future She is a reputable person in the community, although this is Lam's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, all members in her group agree to vote her to be group leader.

With her business profit, Lam hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

location.town: Nhóm 02, Nhuyễn Sơn, Tượng Lĩnh, nông cống

loans.name: Janerose

texts.en: Janerose is a married woman. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a farm where she keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. Her business goal is to have more dairy cows within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use

loans.name: Jacquelyne

texts.en: Jacquelyne is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 26,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 32 years old, with three children. With one child in school, Cecile works very hard to provide for the family.
