Cecile runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Cecile has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Cecile would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 36 years old and has two children. Fe is married and has two children who are in school.

Fe is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Fe has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her child. She is married and has a business direct selling Avon products in the Philippines.

Rowena requested a PHP 2,200 loan through NWTF to buy a water filter. She is getting the water filter because she wants to have safe drinking water and a healthy family without any diseases caused by contaminated water. Rowena is aware that by using the water filter, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 31 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Miriam has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Miriam is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old and has six children. Lolita is married and has three children who are in school.

Lolita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lolita has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support her family. Cecilia is married and has a seafoods vending business in the Philippines.

Cecilia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more seafoods to sell in her stall.

Cecilia has been in this business for 10 years now.

Cecilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafoods to sell in her stall

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a maize farmer from Rikochi village. As a Babban Gona member, Idris is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Idris would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Idris can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Idris no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Idris hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Nhẫn

texts.en:
Nhẫn is 50 years old and she is married. She lives in Tinh Gia district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Nhẫn has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. She also raises pigs on her farm. Nhẫn's family is a low-income household in a village and her job is unstable. She hopes her family can have a biogas system to save energy for cooking and make the environment around her house better.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Nhẫn is her lack of money to build a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to builda biogas system. This is Nhẫn's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profits, Nhẫn hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a biogas system.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a food vendor from the rural town of Bilar, Bohol. She prepares snack foods like bibingka (rice cake), steamed cassava cake, banana cake and puto kutsinta (a type of steamed rice cake found throughout the Philippines made from a mixture of rice flour, brown sugar and lye, enhanced with yellow food coloring or annatto extract).

She is 31-year-old woman and has two children. She has been engaged in the food vending business for many years now.

Leah has requested a loan to buy ingredients like glutinous rice, flour, sugar, and other ingredients. With these, she will be able to sell a variety of snack food, and her respective clients will have a wide array to choose from.

She is hopeful that she could make it more productive to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like glutinous rice, flour, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 38 years old, and eight of her children are currently in school.

Mary Ann has a buying and selling of used clothing business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is a 50-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Carmencita has a business direct selling Avon and personal collection products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Carmencita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products from Avon to sell to her customers. In the future, Carmencita would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more personal products from Avon to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Leydi Johana

texts.es:
Progresar, tener un mejor futuro, constituir una empresa para obtener el dinero para sostener su familia, son los motivos que hoy llevan a Leidy a solicitar un préstamo. Ella es Madre cabeza de familia de 30 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de mercancía como ropa, calzado y accesorios. 
El Préstamo que actualmente está solicitando Leidy es para constituir un local comercial en un espacio que tiene en su hogar, el cual será atendido por su madre (ver foto), mientras ella sigue vendiendo puerta a puerta.
Su objetivo es en un futuro comprar vivienda y pagar la educación de sus hijos.
El dinero será destinado en la compra de 2 vitrinas, adecuación del local, surtido de ropa, accesorios y calzado para hombre y mujer y tener una nueva línea de venta de lociones.
texts.en:
Progressing, having a better future, and earning money to support her family, are the reasons why Leidy is requesting a loan today. She is a mother head of the family. She is 30 years old and works selling products such as clothes, shoes, and accessories.

The loan that Leidy is requesting will be used to adapt a space she has at home to open a store. Her mother (see photo) will work there, while she continues selling door-to-door.

Her goal for the future is to buy a house and pay for her children's education.

She will use the money to buy two showcases, remodel the room, buy clothes, accessories and shoes for men and women, and start selling perfumes.

loans.use: to buy two showcases, remodel a room to open a store, and buy clothes, accessories and shoes for men and women.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 53 years old and has eight children. Enriquita is married, and two of her children are in school.

Enriquita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Enriquita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Enriquita has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Enriquita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 36 years old and has four children. Zenaida is married and has four children who are in school.

Zenaida is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Zenaida has been raising livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is 39 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines.

Neneth requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Neneth would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Love Kids Group

texts.en:
Hường is 35 years old and married with two children. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Hường lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in her village, and demand is low in this region.

The main hardship that Hường faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. In 2014, Hường joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Hường is the group leader of the Love Kids group, which consists of three members.

With her business profits, Hường hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years old and single. Virginia works very hard to provide for the family.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, beverages, coffee, etc.

Virginia has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, beverages, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 59 years old and a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and has been in this business for four years.

Marietta requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Elkin Eladio

texts.es:
Elkin es un productos agropecuario de 45 años de edad, padre de un pequeño de 12, actualmente separado.
Diariamente se levanta a trabajar entre 10 y 12 horas, persiguiendo un sueño de comprar una vivienda propia, un lugar donde pueda habitar tranquilamente, donde pueda cultivar lo que quiera, criar los animales que le gusten, un sitio donde tenga la libertad de tomar sus propias decisiones.
Actualmente el señor Elkin se dedica a la cría de vacas productoras de leche, gracias a esta actividad genera el sustento de su familia y destina un pequeño capital, cada que puede, para alimentar su sueño de comprar una vivienda.
Buscando mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda el clientes solicita un préstamo para la compra de una vaca, que le permita aumentar su producción, comprara también alimento para complementar la alimentación, vacunas, y abonos para el pasto.
texts.en:
Elkin is a 45-year-old agricultural producer. He is the father of 12-year-old child, and at the moment divorced.

Every day he gets up to work 10 to 12 hours to pursue his dream of buying his own house - a place where he can live quietly, where he can grow what he wants, raise the animals he wants, a place where he has the freedom to make his own decisions.

At the moment Elkin is earning a living raising cows for milk production. Thanks to this work, he is generating the means of living for his family and saving a little money - as much as he can - to achieve his dream of buying his own home.

His goal is to improve his living situation, which is why he is requesting a loan to buy a cow, that will allow him to increase his production. He will also buy fodder to complete the nutrition, vaccines and fertilizer for the pasture.

loans.use: to buy a cow, fodder, vaccines and fertilizer for the pasture.

loans.name: Miguel Mariano

texts.es:
Miguel es un empresario de 38 años de edad, que busca empezar un negocio de  alquiler de lavadoras, oficio muy común en el pueblo, puesto que es una zona de bajos recursos y no cuentan con el dinero para adquirir dicho activo.
Es padre de 3 princesas, dos de 8 y la menor de 5, su propósito es mejorar las condiciones de vivienda para que sus hijas. Su pareja y él puedan vivir y convivir en un espacio sano, un ambiente de educación y en donde no pasen necesidades.
Miguel se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar dos lavadoras, con las que espera tener éxito y cumplir con sus propósitos, lo más importante para él es iniciar, ya los clientes los buscara en cada rincón de su sector buscando por todos los medios posibles tener buena acogida del público y bastante trabajo.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 38-year-old businessman who wants to start a business renting washing machines. This is a popular business in his town, since locals are poor and cannot afford to buy such an appliance.

He is the father of three princesses; two of them are eight years old, and the youngest one is five. His goals are to improve his daughters' living conditions, have a healthy environment where he can live together with his partner, offer his daughters a good education, and live without unfulfilled needs.

Miguel is requesting a loan to buy two washing machines, which, he hopes, will help him to succeed and achieve his goals. For him, the most important thing is to start; he will take care of looking for customers in every possible corner. He will try as hard as he can to gain a good reputation and find lots of work.

loans.use: to start a business renting washing machines.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Safiya is a maize farmer from Bazana II village. As a Babban Gona member, Safiya is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Safiya would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Safiya can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Safiya no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Safiya hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using her additional income to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Quê's Group

texts.en:
Quê is 57 years old and married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 10 years. Quê lives in Yen Dinh district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in her village and demand is low in this region.

The main hardship that Quê faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry to raise and sell in the future. This is Quê's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profits, Quê hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Leidy Yohana

texts.es:
Leidy es una mujer soltera cabeza de familia, tiene 25 años de edad y trabaja desde su casa en un negocio de venta y cría de aves, negocio que inicio pro necesidad económica, dado que no tiene con quien dejar a sus dos hijos, los cuales tienen 4 años y el menor de tan solo 2 meses de edad.
 Actualmente no tiene animales para trabajar, por ende solicita un préstamo para completar el dinero con el cual comprara 50 pollos y alimento de engorde.
Su propósito es generar el dinero suficiente para alimentar a su familia, brindarles progreso y un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Leidy is a single woman head of household. She is 25 years old and works from home, raising and selling poultry. She started this business out of financial need, since she didn't have anyone to leave her two children with, as one was 4 and the youngest was only 2 months old.

Right now, she doesn't have animals to work with. That is why she is asking for a loan to complete the amount of money she needs to buy 50 chickens and feed to fatten them.

Her goal is to generate enough money to feed her family and offer them progress and a better future.

loans.use: to buy 50 chickens and feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 40 years old and a mother with three children who are still enrolled at school. Naomi runs a kiosk business as an additional income source for her family. She has been involved in the business for the last three years. She is grateful for the business as it enables her to help her husband, Yonatan, 39, in earning more income. As a building laborer, Yonatan cannot provide a fixed income, as it depends on the project that he has.

Naomi plans to improve her business by providing more stock in her business such as sugar, noodles, cooking oil, wheat, rice, etc. She then was introduced the TLM loan product by a neighbor who has received a loan. She was interested and requested a loan of IDR 2,500,000. She is sure the loan provided by Kiva – TLM will encourage her to have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock and supplies for adding to her kiosk, such as sugar, noodles, cooking oil, wheat, rice, etc.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, she has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize at harvest time, when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, she now can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest time.

As a Babban Gona member, Maryamu will benefit from marketing support that could help her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. She is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the lives of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary, who is a resident in Siem Reap province, is a 33-year-old, married mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living through growing rice, raising pigs and working as tailor.

This will be her second loan cycle with VisionFund. The past loan helped her support her living and send her child to school. She is now requesting a loan to pay tuition fees for her studies. She hopes that after finishing school, she will have a bright future and earn more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her studies.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Soni kom District

loans.name: Selene Amparo

texts.es:
Selene es una mujer de 55 años de edad, mujer casada ama de casa, madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, que trabaja diariamente desde su hogar vendiendo productos de primera necesidad.
Selena se dedicó gran parte de su vida a criar a sus hijos, su esposo llevaba con la carga del hogar, pero al no ser suficiente esta optó por montar un negocio y complementar el dinero suficiente para su hogar, ahora que sus hijos son mayores siguen trabajando por asegurar una vida a futuro, no pasar necesidades, no tener que recurrir a pedir limosna y/o ayuda alguna para sostenerse.
Hoy Selene quiere recurrir a una ayuda por un corto periodo de tiempo, un dinero para invertirlo en la compra de surtido de productos de primera necesidad tales como papel higiénico, alimentos, granos, dicho aliento económico le permitirá abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Selene is a 55 year old woman, She is a married housewife, the mother of 3 grown children. She works every day from her home, selling staple products.

Selena spent a big part of her life raising her children. Her husband supported the home, but when it wasn't enough she decided to open a business and bring in the rest of the money for the home. Now that her children are grown they continue to work to ensure their future, so they won't have to resort to asking for charity and/or any help to support themselves.

Today Selene wants to ask for short term help, some money to invest in buying inventory of staple products such as toilet paper, food, and grains. Such financial encouragement will allow her to stock her business.

loans.use: to stock her business with staple products such as toilet paper, food, grains and beverages.

loans.name: Yimmy Alexis

texts.es:
Yimmy es un joven de 22 años de edad, una persona humilde, trabajadora, el cliente busca por todos los medios posibles pagar sus estudios universitarios, sin descuidar a su familia que necesita mucho del dinero que él pueda producir, ya sea para comprar alimentos o pagar los servicios públicos.
Por esto y por superación personal, el joven quiere solicitar un préstamo para iniciar un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, principalmente prepara arepas rellenas pero espera en un futuro preparar más productos.
texts.en:
22-year-old Yimmy is a young, humble, and hardworking person. He looks everywhere for means to pay for his university studies, without forgetting that his family needs a lot any money he can earn, be it for buying food or for paying the utilities bill.

This, together with his own self-improvement goals, is why this young man is applying for a loan to start selling fast food, mainly stuffed arepas [thick corn tortillas]. He hopes to be able to offer more products in the future.

loans.use: to start selling stuffed arepas [thick corn tortillas].

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, she has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize at harvest time, when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, she now can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Maryamu will benefit from marketing support that could help her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. She is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the lives of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Quang Dai Women Group

texts.en:
Hiền is 25 years old and married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for four years. Hiền lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in her village and her job is unstable.

The main hardship that Hiền faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. In 2013, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profits, Hiền hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Aleida De Jesus

texts.es:
En el año 2004, la señora Aleida decidió seguir su propio camino, confiar en sus habilidades, fue este año donde guiada por el deseo de tener una mejor calidad de vida, mejores ingresos y ser económicamente independiente monto su negocio de confección directa.
Aprendió de la confección gracias a su madre, y ha trabajado en diferentes lugares, pero se siente feliz de tener su propio negocio.
Aleida es madre de dos hijos ya mayores de edad, su propósito no es más que mejorar su vivienda y tener una vida cómoda.
La cliente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de hilos en grandes cantidades, necesita abastecerse y comprar en cantidades le sale mucho más económico y rendidor.
Su propósito es contar con el inventario de herramientas y materia prima suficiente para deslumbrar y sorprender a sus clientes con nuevas modas y diseños que desafían la cotidianidad de la moda vista en el municipio de Medellín
texts.en:
Aleida decided to become independent in 2004, trusting her skills. This same year, led by her wishes of having better living conditions, a better income, and becoming independent economically, she opened a seamstress workshop.

She learned to sew thanks to her mother, and has worked in different places. However, she feels happy because she has now her own business.

Aleida is the mother of two adult children. Her only intention is to improve her home and live a comfortable life.

Aleida is requesting a loan to buy threads in bulk. She needs to stock her business and purchase in bulk, which is cheaper and more efficient.

Her goal is to have enough tools and raw materials to surprise and dazzle her customers with new fashions and designs that challenge what people normally wear in the city of Medellín.

loans.use: to stock her business with sewing supplies.

loans.name: Rizallie

texts.en:
Rizallie is a married woman with two young children, and she lives in the town of Dagohoy, Bohol. Her husband's occupation is farming. He grows and sells rice.

Rizallie runs a sari-sari (variety) store from the front of her house. She sells commodities such as noodles, powdered milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo and assorted canned goods. She has been running the sari-sari (variety) store for three years now serving neighbours and nearby residents.

Rizallie would like to improve her main income to become more productive and improve her family’s living conditions. Due to a high demand for commodities, she decided to join CEVI to access a loan.

She would like to buy soft drinks and liquor. In this way, she will be able to cater to customer demands and increase her profits.

In the future, Rizallie looks forward to continuing to strive and manage her business successfully and to continue supporting the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and liquor.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman and she has three children. She describes herself to be honest.

Nelly operates a retail business where she sells soap, sugar, bread, rice, cooking oil, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Nelly will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, rice, cooking oil and other items.

This is Nelly's fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, rice, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Irish is 31 years old now.

Irish has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines. Irish requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Irish has been in this business for four years. In the future, Irish would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Ella es Beatriz es una mujer de 57 años de edad, con un gran talento en el arte que nunca saco a flote por el temor a no poder generar los recursos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar, hoy se siente preparada, dispuesta a triunfar, a compartir sus obras con el público, pero para lograrlo necesita mínimamente un capital para la compra de insumos, por ello solicita tu ayuda, un dinero para iniciar su negocio, el cual será usado para comprar tela y pinturas.
Si apoyas a esta empresaria, incentivas el arte y la creatividad de una habitante Antioqueña que quiere hacer de su pasión un trabajo para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
This is Beatriz. She is a 57 year old woman with a great talent for art that she never was never able to get going because she was afraid she wouldn't generate enough resources to support her home. Today she feels ready, willing to triumph and share her work with the public. But to do this, she needs a minimum of capital to buy materials. That is why she is asking for your help, some money to start her business. It will be used to buy fabric and paints.

If you support this businesswoman, you will give an incentive to the art and creativity of a resident of Antioquia who wants to make her passion for work into support for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and paints to develop her art.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre de 36 años de edad que siguiendo sus raíces campesinas, sus creencias, enseñanzas monto un negocio de cría de aves, negocio con el cual genera el sustento para su amada familia conformada por 3 hijos de 8, 9 y 11 años de edad y de su pareja con quien vive en unión libre, en una casa alquilada en el municipio de Fredonia. 
Todos los días se levanta a trabajar, recibe una bendición de su pareja, se despide de sus hijos y comienza con su faena, sabe que su familia depende de él y espera no defraudarlos y en un futuro darles una enorme alegría comprando una casa, sueño que ha perseguido por un largo tiempo junto con su pareja.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de gallinas ponedoras y adecuaciones al galpón.
Con esta inversión espera aumentar en número de aves, tener producción más abundante de huevos y por ende mayor utilidad.
texts.en:
Jaime is a 36-year-old man who is following his farming roots, his beliefs, and his teachings to build a chicken breeding business, with which he is generating the means of living for his beloved family, that consists of three children of 8, 9, and 11 years and his spouse with whom he is living in cohabitation in a rented house in the town of Fredonia.

Every morning he gets up to work, receives a blessing from his spouse, says goodbye to his children, and begins with his task. He knows that his family is depending on him and hopes not to disappoint them. In the future he wants to give them great joy by buying a house, a goal he has been pursuing for a long time together with his spouse.

At the moment he is requesting a loan to purchase of laying hens and adaptations to the shed.

With this investment he wants to increase the number of chickens, to have a plentiful egg production and therefore greater utility.

loans.use: purchase of laying hens and adaptations to the shed.

loans.name: Blanca Nury

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer de 27 años de edad, madre soltera cabeza de familia que dio los mejores años de su vida a su hijo, trabajando por este, luchando por sacarlo adelante puesto que el padre los abandono, ella no cuenta con estudios superiores, solo con su corazón y su fortaleza mental, salió a las calles a buscar trabajo, pero al no encontrar comenzó inmediatamente a buscar alternativas para generar dinero. Termino vendiendo frutas en la calle, y ahora gracias a su negocio puede llevar el alimento diario a su hogar.
Ahora esta joven pensando en su progreso en tener un negocio mejor constituido, solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de frutas en cantidades principalmente, mango, sandía, peras, papaya, manzanas y mandarina, también realizara adecuaciones locativas para exhibir mayor número de frutas.
texts.en:
27-year old Blanca is a single mother and head of the family. She has devoted the best years of her life to her son, working hard to bring him up as the father abandoned them. She doesn't have any further education, only her heart and mental strength. She set out into the streets looking for work, but when she didn't find any, she immediately sought alternatives in order to earn money. Blanca ended up selling fruit in the street, and now thanks to her business, she is able to put food on the table every day.

Now Blanca is looking to the future and thinking how she can have a stronger business. She is seeking a loan to buy fruit in bulk, principally mangos, watermelon, pears, papaya, apples and mandarines. As well she wants to improve her premises so she can better display the larger amount of fruit.

loans.use: buy fruit in bulk, principally mangos, watermelons, pears, papaya, apples and mandarins

loans.name: Phet

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house, Phet is 41 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She lives in Tbuang Khmum province, where she has been growing rice for her main source of income for 23 years. She also works for others for a fee to supplement her income. The daily income of this family is about USD $12, and Phet can manage to save about USD $7 each day.

She is now applying for a loan from VisionFund to pay for tuition fees and to buy school supplies for her daughter. She hopes that this loan will enable her daughter to study and get a good-paying job after graduating from university.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and to buy school supplies for her daughter.

location.town: Tbaung Khmum province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Women Do Business Group

texts.en:
Thanh is 44 years old and married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years. Thanh lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her household was recognized by the local government as poor and demand is low in this region.

The main hardship that Thanh faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell. In 2012, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profits, Thanh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Small Farm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thịnh is 56 years old, and she is married.

She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for more than 10 years. Thịnh lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Thịnh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

This is Thịnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Along with her business profit, Thịnh hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Maritha

texts.en:
Maritha is a married woman with five children. She describes herself as patient. Maritha operates a retail business where she sells cereals and she has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She says her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

Maritha will use this KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to open more business outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future she will educate her children to the university level. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank and she repaid her previous loans successfully. Maritha will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a five-star hotel within five years.

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a married man. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells doughnuts and he has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

Robert says his biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of doughnuts to sell. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of doughnuts to sell

loans.name: John Geimar

texts.es:
John es un hombre de 31 años de edad, una persona correcta, digna, responsable, dedicado a la agricultura y a sus hijos, vive solo, se separó de su esposa, algo que lo afecto mucho pero sigue trabajando por su familia, por sus hijos, por su futuro.
Actualmente John se encuentra preparando su tierra para el nuevo cultivo, pues quiere incrementar sus ganancias y tener sostenibilidad de su negocio. Por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, principalmente, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para aplicar los productos.
Solicita el préstamo dado que le precio de los insumos son muy elevados, dicho dinero le traerá progreso, le traerá estabilidad, tendrá la oportunidad de seguir trabajando en el negocio que le ha dado de comer estos años tanto a él como a su familia, por ello apóyalo, dale la herramienta para que forje y moldee su futuro.
texts.en:
John is a 31-year-old man. He is a courteous, honorable, responsible person, a hardworking farmer, and a devoted father. He lives alone since he got separated from his wife. This had a strong impact on him, but he continues working for his family, his children, and his future.

John is currently preparing his land for the new planting season. He wants to increase his profits and have a sustainable business. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers, and pay for the labor needed to spread them.

He is requesting this loan because the price of the supplies is very high. This money will help him to get ahead and reach financial stability. He will have the opportunity to continue doing what has given him and his family food all these years. This is why you must support him; give him the tools to build and shape his future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers, and pay for the labor needed to spread them.

loans.name: Ku Lar Su Village Group

texts.en:
Ka Lar Hsu group members focus on raising livestock, such as ducks and pigs. Clients in this village were able to use the boosted income from their livestock business to increase their investment in new businesses, such as seasonal crops. Also, additional income that they made was spent on their childrens' higher education fees.

This new loan will help the group purchase more ducks and high quality feed, as well as paying additional business expenses. Also, due to early indications of successful use of these funds, five new borrowers will join this group for the next loan. Ka Lar Hsu group members are so grateful for the help from Kiva’s lenders, and they are excited to continue their business with Kiva’s support.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feed

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 49-year-old woman with eight children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Edna has a rice vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years.

Edna requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Kheri

texts.en:
Kheri is a married woman in her early 50's. She has six children, four of whom are still in school, while the others are grown up. She has been selling charcoal for five years. Kheri works from 6 am to 8 pm daily, and is able to earn a good monthly profit.

This will be Kheri's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock of charcoal, and has managed to repay all of her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan.

Kheri used her profits to pay school fees for her four children, to repay her loan, and to take care of her family. She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to meet her customers' needs. Kheri dreams of building her own house. She will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 30 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Marilou has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as beauty products, toiletries, beverages, vinegar, soy sauce, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Guiada por la motivación y el deseo de pagar la educación de dos hijos la señora Yaneth montó, por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente un negocio de venta de ropa para hombre y mujer, dicho negocio es la representación de sus deseos hacia su familia, esas ganas de progresar, de que sus hijos sean alguien en la vida, que estudien, se conviertan en  profesionales, esto es lo que quiere Yaneth y seguirá trabajando diariamente con mucho empeño para lograr sus objetivos.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para abastecerse de pantalones, blusas, zapatos, jeans, camisas, preparándose para la temporada de fin de año.
texts.en:
With the motivation and wish to pay for her two children's education, Yaneth built a business of selling clothing to men and women through the pleasure and a calling of self-employment.

This business is the representation of her wishes to her family, her desire to progress, so her children can be someone in life, so they can study, and turn into professionals. This is what Yaneth wants and she will continue to work every day with a lot of effort to achieve her goals.

Now, she is requesting a loan to stock up on pants, blouses, shoes, jeans, and shirt to prepare for end-of-year season.

loans.use: to stock up on pants, blouses, shoes, jeans and shirts.

loans.name: Mamataly

texts.en:
Mamataly was born in 1961. He is married and has six children. He lives with his family in the southern part of Tajikistan. His wife is a seamstress. Mamataly is a doctor and he has worked in a local hospital for more than 10 years. He knows his job well.

Mamataly is a very careful father to his children. He has always wanted to see his children gain a higher education. Mamataly is asking for a loan of 5500 Somoni to pay for his daughter's university tuition. He and his daughter await your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is a widowed woman with four children. She describes herself as honest. Emelda operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables and she has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

Emelda will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in the little village of Bakurtsikhe in the famous Kakheti wine region of Georgia. Zurab grows grapes on his land and sells them to the wine producer in the neighborhood.

This loan will help him to buy additional land so that he can increase his output of grapes. Zurab is already storing some plants to plant them immediately after full funding. The high demand for wine exports will help his family to increase their income.

loans.use: to buy additional land and expand his grape cultivation for wine production.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un campesino de 30 años de edad, el cual está buscando ayuda para completar el dinero que necesita para comprar una vaca lechera y así aumentar la producción, algo que necesita con algo de urgencia puesto que el bajo precio de venta de leche a afectado sus ingresos.
Juan Carlos inicio su negocio por necesidad económica, la sostenibilidad de su trabajo es lo primordial para él, dado que la producción de leche es con lo único que genera ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Por tal motivo Juan Carlos pide el apoyo de todos, para terminar de juntar el dinero para comprar la vaca y así evitar recaer en deudas con personas naturales a interés altos.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 30-year-old farmer. He is looking for help to complete the money he needs for buying a dairy cow and this way increase the production. It is something he needs somewhat urgently because the decrease in the price of milk has affected his income.

Juan Carlos started his business because of financial need. The continuation of his work is paramount for him, because milk production is the only thing that generates an income for the support of his family.

For this reason Juan Carlos is asking for the help of everyone. To raise the money to buy a cow and thus avoid relapsing into debt with individuals with a high interest rates.

loans.use: to buy a cow in the gestation period.

loans.name: Elisam

texts.en: Elisam is a coffee trader who also grows bananas to supplement his income. He is a very hard working man, and is doing very well in his two businesses. However, he is faced with a challenge of price fluctuation and bad roads because he has to go to remote villages to buy the coffee that he sells in his store. At the moment coffee is in season, and he would love to stock more so that he can earn abnormal profits during the peak season. He is requesting a loan to buy coffee for selling.

loans.use: to buy more coffee for selling.

loans.name: Victor Edison

texts.es:
Víctor necesita de tu ayuda, este hombre anteriormente de dedicaba al trabajo independiente pero debido a los malos resultados tuvo que cerrar su negocio. 
Víctor es padre de dos hijos, siempre ha gustado del trabajo independiente y no había encontrado la manera de volver a iniciar con su profesión, principalmente por la falta de recursos.
Ahora que ante él, está la posibilidad de reiniciar su labor de venta de ropa, quiere solicitar un préstamo con el cual comprará ropa juvenil para hombre y mujer, sin dejar de lado su trabajo.
texts.en: Victor needs your help. Before, this man made an independent living, however due to bad results he had to close his business. Victor is a father of two children, and has always liked to work independently. He has not found a way to go back to start his profession, principally because of the lack of resources. Now that before him is the possibility of restarting his work of selling clothes, he wishes to request a loan with which he will buy youth's clothing for males and females, without leaving his job to the side.

loans.use: to buy youth's clothing for males and females.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr:
Amy est membre d'un banc villageois qui a été inauguré en novembre 2009. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont un garçon. Elle est âgée de 45 ans et s'active dans le commerce de mil, de pagnes et d'encens.
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter 15 barils de mil pour 17500 FCFA le baril et revend le kilo de mil à 250 FCFA.Elle achète un rouleau de tissus à 16 000 FCFA qu'elle va tricoter pour obtenir ensuite 20 pagnes qu'elle va revendre à 1500 FCFA l'unité.Elle achète enfin 2 seaux d'encens à 12 000 FCFA qu'elle met dans des sachets revendu à 1 000 FCFA l'unité.Le reste du prêt constitue son fond de roulement.
Avec les bénéfices elle envisage d'acheter un mouton pour faire de l'embouche et aussi aider ses enfants dans leurs scolarités.
texts.en:
Amy is a member of the 'banc villageois' which was inaugurated on November 2009. She is the married mother of six children, including a boy. She is 45 years old and active in marketing millet, 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), and incense.

With this loan, she intends to purchase 15 barrels of millet for 17,500 francs CFA each to resell for 250 francs per kilo. She is purchasing a roll of fabric for 16,000 francs she is going to use for [knitting] to have 20 ‘pagne’, which she will resell at 1,500 francs a unit. She is also purchasing 2 pails of incense for 12,000 francs to put into pouches and sell at 1,000 francs a unit. The rest of the loan is for her working capital.

With the profits, she envisions buying a sheep to fatten and also to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase millet, fabrics, and incense

loans.name: Mónica Patricia

texts.es:
Mónica es una perseverante mujer de 27 años de edad, mujer soltera cabeza de familia que se dedica a la venta de mercancía por temporada, tiene una pequeña de 6 años de edad, ha entregado gran parte de su juventud por trabajar, por generar el sustento a esa nena que tanto ama y gracias a ella esa niña no ha pasado necesidades.
La temporada de diciembre está próxima y quiere estar totalmente prepara con surtido variado de ropa para hombre y mujer, niño y niña.
Su propósito es seguir generando el sustento para su hija y darle una excelente navidad, llevarle un regalo para continuar con la tradición de papa Noel.
texts.en:
Mónica is a persevering woman of 27 years old. She is single head of the family who sells seasonal clothing for living. She has a little girl of 6 years old. She has spent a big part of her youth working in order to support her daughter who she loves so much. Thanks to Mónica, her daughter has never had to do without.

The December season is close, and Mónica wants to be completely prepared with the supply of a variety of men's and women's as well as boys' and girls' clothing. Her intention is to continue generating the means of living for her daughter and to give her an excellent Christmas, by bringing her home a gift to continue with the tradition of Santa Claus.

loans.use: supply a variety of women's and men's clothing and be prepared for the high sales season

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Karina tiene 27 años es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 2 años, razon por la cual ha tenido que sacarle a su hijo adelante sola por lo que tiene un negocio propio de ecuadernacion de libros es un muy buen negocios el credito lo solicita para comprarse una copiadora y ampliar el negocios.

Karina dice que el negocios de las copias es super bueno ya que en el sector que esta ubicada no tiene competencia. Ella en los tiempos libres sali de paseo con el hijo.
texts.en:
Karina is 27 years old, a single mother who has a two-year-old son. To get her son ahead, she has her own business of bookbinding, which is going very well.

She is asking for the loan to buy herself a copying machine and to increase the business. Katrina says that the book copying business is very good since there is no competition in this sector. In the free seasons she goes out to work with her son.

loans.use: buy a copying machine

loans.name: Ndeye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupes de 23 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été inauguré en novembre 2009. Il regroupe de braves femmes très solidaires et dynamiques. Elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche.
KHOUDIA debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée, âgée de 45 ans et mère 4 enfants dont une fille et 3 garçons. Elle s'active dans le commerce d'épices et de tamarins.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs d'oignons de 30 kilogrammes chacun à 8 000 FCFA l'un et revendre le kilo à 600 FCFA. Elle compte aussi acheter un sac de tamarin de 50 kilogrammes à 8500 FCFA et revendre le kilo à 600 FCFA. le reste du prêt servira à acheter des épices en gros qu'elle va revendre en détail dans des sachets.
Les bénéfices serviront à acheter une brebis pour commencer une activité d'embouche et aussi aider ses enfants dans leurs scolarités.
texts.en:
This group of 23 members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was inaugurated in November 2009. It is composed of good, honest, and energetic women who have a lot of solidarity. They are mainly active in commerce and livestock.

KHOUDIA, standing at the right in the photo with her left hand raised, is the featured borrower. She is married, 45 years old, and the mother of four children (a girl and three boys). She is active in the commerce of spices and tamarind.

With this loan, she intends to purchase two 30-kg sacks of onions for 8,000 francs CFA each sack to resell at 600 francs per kilo. She also intends to purchase a 50-kg sack of tamarind for 8,5000 francs to resell at 600 francs per kilo. The rest of the loan will be used to purchase some spices in bulk that she will sell retail in pouches.

The profits will be used to buy a ewe to begin a business fattening livestock and also to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of onions, a sack of tamarind, and some spices

loans.name: Tahira Parveen

texts.en:
Tahira is 50 years old and a mother of seven children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business seven years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Tahira buys materials such as hand embroidery kits, ribbon, needles, and embroidery machines from the market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers. She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn more profit for her family. She has become an expert in the embroidery business.

Tahira requested a loan to buy raw materials from the market. She is thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis con 30 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y su hija, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio, ganadería, cultivo de productos de pan llevar y a la cría de animales menores.

José Luis se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, tiene 1.5 hectáreas, de variedad Catimor, plantación tiene cuatro años de edad, esta en segundo año de producción, con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 10 años, ya que su padre les crió con este tipo de cultivo. Adicionalmente cría animales menores como (gallinas, pavos, chanchos y cuyes) y al cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, vitucas, plátanos, menestras y otros) siendo estos para su consumo y en ocaciones para la venta; cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de 1 hectárea de café, con ello obtendrá una buena producción campaña 2016 incrementando mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

José Luis es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
30-year-old José Luis lives together with his partner and daughter in his own home of rustic materials, in Santo Tomás district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department, in the country of Peru. He has many personal and professional references from the area's inhabitants. The majority of the town's residents earn a living in agriculture, commerce, livestock, cultivating cereal crops, and breeding small animals.

José Luis earns a living in agriculture, specifically coffee cultivation. He has had a 1.5 hectare plantation for 4 years, and is in the second year of production (Catimor variety). He has 10 years of experience in the field, since his father raised them with this kind of farming. Additionally, he raises small animals (e.g. chickens, turkeys, pigs, and guinea pigs) and in growing cereal products (e.g. yucca, taro, plantains, lentils, and others)--these being for his consumption and occasionally for sale.

He trusts his ample experience in this field. The loan's destiny is to be for maintenance of one hectare of coffee. With this, he will get a good output in the 2016 season, growing greater income to thus be able to improve his and his family's quality of life.

José Luis is a recurring member for Edpyme Alternative. He will cosign with his partner.

loans.use: to maintain a hectare of coffee.

loans.name: Malam Gambo

texts.en:
Malam Gambo is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Malam Gambo is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Malam Gambo would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Malam Gambo will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.
With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Malam Gambo now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy a motor bike.

loans.name: Thae Kone Gyi Village Group

texts.en:
Thae Kung Gyi Village group members used loans to increase investment in their duck businesses by purchasing more ducks, thereby boosting incomes.

A previous loan from Kiva alleviated their debt needs, freeing them from informal money lenders charging high interest rates. Instead of paying higher rates, village members were able to use these saved funds to invest in their duck businesses.

The Thae Kung Gyi community are excited to continue to build through Kiva’s support. For the upcoming loan, five more borrowers will join the group for a total of 43 members. Funds will be used to buy new ducklings and purchase more high-quality duck feed. All the members are so excited for the generous support of the Kiva community. With the new loan, customers are excited to be able to use some of their increased income to not only cover their living costs, but also support their children's educations.

loans.use: To purchase new ducklings and more high-quality duck feed

loans.name: Ansim

texts.en:
Ansim is 52 years old and married. He has one child. He resides in Tanago, Ozamiz City, with his family. Ansim has owned and operated a transport service in the community for years to earn a living. He successfully repaid his previous loan used for buying spare parts and tires.

Recently, he took a new loan to cover the cost of repainting and motor repair of the motorcycle used for the transportation business as well as for his personal use. He plans to buy a sidecar for his motorcycle for expansion of his business in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for repainting and motor repair.

loans.name: Ngoyo

texts.en: Ngoyo is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, bananas. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price changes. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions.

loans.name: Ricieri Gavino

texts.es:
Ricieri con 32 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ricieri se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café,con una experiencia en el rubro de 12 años.El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna,y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Ricieri es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Firmará con cónyuge.
texts.en:
Ricieri is 32 years of age and is part of a civil union. He lives in his own house made of rustic materials with his life partner and two young children in the district of Pomahuaca located in the province of Jaén, the region of Cajamarca in Perú. He has very good references, both personal and employment, from the inhabitants of the area. Most of the inhabitants of this area make a living through agriculture, commerce and livestock.

Ricieri makes a living through agriculture, specifically through the cultivation of coffee, with his 12 years of experience in the field. He will use the loan which granted to him for the agricultural labor, applications and the incorporation of plant protection products, fertilizers and manual labor for his harvest. In this way it will help towards improving his crop's physiology, morphology and productivity. Also, he will have an opportune harvest, and hence have more production and a better quality product. Therefore he will not have problems selling his product.

Ricieri is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa. He will sign with his life partner.

loans.use: to do agricultural labor, applications and incorporate plant protection products, fertilizers and manual labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Bashari

texts.en:
Bashari is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Bashari is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Bashari would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Bashari will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Bashari now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Buhari

texts.en:
Buhari is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Buhari is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Buhari would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Buhari will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Buhari now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mpipi Group

texts.en:
Christina who is in her early 30s, is married with three children, one of them is still small and the other two are in school. She has been running a genge business for twelve years now. She works from 08am to 06pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the fruits and vegetables and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, to reinvest in business and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restore the out of stock items in the genge store. She dreams of owning a super market.

Christina will share this loan with her loan group Mpipi which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy needed fruits and vegetable items for her genge store.

loans.name: Jamilakhon

texts.en:
Jamilakhon was born in 1968 year. She is the married parent of 6 children: 3 sons and 3 daughters. Jamilakhon’s husband works in a hospital. Jamilakhon sews a variety of women clothes. Jamilakhon has a workshop in her house. She works hard every day and she tries to offer high quality service to her clients.

Jamilakhon is asking for a loan of 3500 Somoni to pay for the university tuition of her son as her son is a student of the first course. Jamilakhon and her son await your support.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition of her son.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has five children. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be competition.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. His business goal is to own a transport vehicle within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase another motorcycle and employ someone use it.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 43 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mercedita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mercedita has been in this business for 11 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, es una mujer que está acompañada y vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos de los cuales solo uno depende económicamente de ella, María se dedica a la ganadería oficio que aprendió de su familia y que lo desempeña desde hace ya 10 años sin presentar dificultad para su desarrollo.
El crédito lo invertirlo en la compra de dos reses para engordarlas y luego venderlas, esto le permitirá incrementar sus ganancias para poder darle a su familia una vida más digna y cancelar la deuda adquirida.
María sueña poder tener un establo bonito y hacerle mejoras a su vivienda para una mejor comodidad de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
María is a woman who is in a relationship. She lives with her life companion and their children, only one of whom is economically dependent on her. Maria works in raising livestock, a trade she learned from her family and one she has been carrying out for 10 years with no problems with it's development.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of two cows to fatten which she will later sell. This will allow her to increase her profits to be able to provide her family with a more dignified life and pay off her acquired debt.

María dreams of having a beautiful barn and making improvements to her house for the comfort of her family unit.

loans.use: to buy two cows to fatten and later sell, which will allow her to increase her profits.

loans.name: Eider Ferney

texts.es:
Eider es un hombre visionaria, un hombre que gusta del trabajo independiente que sabe aprovechar muy bien las oportunidades que se le presentan, anteriormente trabajaba como empleado en una ebanistería, pero cuando se le presento la oportunidad de adquirir un negocio no dudo en tomarlo y buscar su propio progreso, hoy en día ha constituido una empresa sería, cuenta con empleado y sigue con su proyecto en ascenso. 
Eider es padre de 2 niños el mayor de 3 y la menor con tan solo 4 meses de edad, estos dos muchachos son su inspiración, su fuerza, por ellos es que se levanta cada día, simplemente los ama y quiere lo mejor para ellos. 
Actualmente el cliente solicita un préstamo para comprar madera y R.H, insumos muy necesarios en su negocio.
texts.en: Eider is a visionary man, a man who likes to work independently and knows how to take advantage of the opportunities presented to him. Before, he worked as an employee at a cabinetmaker's, but when he was presented with the opportunity to start a business, he had no doubt in taking it and made his own progress. Today he has set up a serious business with employees, and his project continues on the rise. Eider is a father of two children, the older is 3 years old and the younger is only 4 months old. These two boys are his inspiration, his force, and it is for them that he wakes up each day. He simply loves them and wants the best for them. Currently, he requests for a loan to buy wood and R.H, supplies very much necessary in his business.

loans.use: to buy wood and R:H, supplies necessary for the making of furniture.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Liman village. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Ibrahim can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ibrahim no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Ibrahim hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is maize farmer from Liman Mahuta village. As a member of Babban Gona, Aminu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Aminu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Aminu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Aminu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:
Garba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Garba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Garba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Garba can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Garba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land. Garba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a young man who has a barber shop, which has been open for the past seven years. He now has good experience and he is well known in his city, Tulkarem. He loves his job and always thinks how to improve it.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and make some decoration for his barber shop. This will improve his business and make his barber shop more attractive. Mohammad appears in the picture.

loans.use: to buy new tools and make some decoration for his barber shop.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem is 31-year-old man from Rafah City He is married and father to three kids. Hazem was living with his family in a small humble house, but during the latest war on Gaza his house was destroyed completely. Then he had to rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently Hazem took a USD loan from Palestine for development (FATEN) in order to rebuild his old house. The loan will allow Hazem to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return his family to their normal life.
Hazem appears in the photo.

loans.use: in order to rebuild his old house.

loans.name: Saber

texts.en:
Sabir is a 28-year-old married man from Qabatia city, located in the West Bank. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all his family needs. However, he wants to improve his family's standard of living and help them to live more comfortably.

Sabir took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Sabir will be able heat water more efficiently, enabling the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing their electricity expenses.

Sabir appears in the photo.
