loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Rokaya

texts.en:
Rokaya is a 47-year-old married mother of two, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees.

The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back-to-School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation and fees for students from low income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses.

By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Hanaa hopes to continue supporting her children's education and improve their living.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Ramel

texts.en:
Twenty-year-old Ramel earns a living by operating habal-habal (motorcycle) transportation services. He is a single man and resides in the town of Batuan, Bohol. Aside from that, he raises and sells hogs to have supplemental income to cater to the needs of his family.

For the past two years, Ramel has been transporting passengers from one place to remote areas, to earn a living. He decided to join Kiva's field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) to access loans.

Ramel has requested a loan to purchase motor accessories, pay for maintenance, and buy piglets and feed. These are items that will enable him to continue to handle both his sources of income.

Ramel is thankful for the funds and is determined to manage them successfully to support his entire family and also to have a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase motor accessories, pay for maintenance, and buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 27 and married with two children. They are settled in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He manages his own transportation services for a living. He has been doing well, earning a better income from this, and has been able to buy a secondhand motorcycle. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to cover motorcycle repair costs to provide safe services. He wants to have a comfortable house and improve the living situation for the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to be used in repairing.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows maize, tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy seeds and other farm inputs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells soap, sugar, bread, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 8 years, which is located in a busy area.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour,salt and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business. within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, salt and other items.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juanita is 60 years old and has one child in school.

Juanita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Juanita  has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Juanita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Bello

texts.en:
Bello is a maize farmer from Kaza village. As a Babban Gona member, Bello is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Bello would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Bello can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Bello no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Bello hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single young man from Rafah city. His father works in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. His income barely covers all their family needs.

Mohammad is a student at the university where he studies Medical Sciences. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support his family.

Mohammad took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay his university fees for the last semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to register at the university and pay part of his urgent expenses.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay his university fees for the last semester.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila was born in 1984 and is a single woman. She lives with her child, brothers and parents in a village which is situated in the South part of Tajikistan. Jamila has had own farming business for more than 12 years. She grows variety of crops as rice, wheat and also she grows pomegranates.

Her brothers help her with farming and the pomegranates. Jamila is going to make new sowing of crops but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 9000 Somoni to buy seeds, fuel and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season. She awaits your help.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fuel and mineral fertilizers for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Aala' is a 20-year-old, single man from Ramallah City, West Bank. He lives with his family in a small, old house, where he is the only breadwinner for his family and they depend on him for support.

Aala' has a small auto repair workshop in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in Ramallah is bad because of conflict.

Aala' took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of tools for his auto repair business. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of tools for auto repair.

loans.name: Fresh Fruits Group

texts.en:
Mrs Mai is 36 years old and she is married.

She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fruit for 5 years. Mai lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in their village, moreover her job is unstable.

The main hardship that Mai faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to resell. This is Mai first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Mai hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell.

location.town: ÁI Sơn - P. Đông Hải- TPTH

loans.name: Janis

texts.en:
Janis is a married woman. She has five children.

She operates a farm where she grows bananas, maize, and other crops. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient water.

Janis will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that, in the future, she will create employment.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was successfully repaid.

She will use the anticipated profits to buy a water pump.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 53 and a widow with three children. He lives in the Gango Ozamiz City in Misamis Occidental where he serves the community with his transportation business. He carries passengers and baggage to earn a living.

He joined GDMPC recently after a friend invited him to join. He took a loan to buy new tires for the motorcycle used in his business. With this business, he was able to buy another unit to use for transportation.

In the future, he wants to have better transportation services so that he could earn more and in that way have a comfortable and improved living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a set of tires.

loans.name: Cử's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Cử is 50 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Cử lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Cử faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

This is Cử first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Cử hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

location.town: Nhuyễn sơn, tượng lĩnh, nông cống

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nemesia is 43 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Nemesia has a general store business in the Philippines. Nemesia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Nemesia has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Nemesia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maria Nidia

texts.es:
Ella es Nidia es una mujer de 49 años que busca lograr la independencia económica, día a día lucha por ganarse la vida en su negocio de venta de ropa, a pesar de que tiene un esposo, quiere ser una persona que logre sostener a su familia, quiere tener dinero para cumplir y satisfacer las necesidades y deseos de su familia.
Actualmente Nidia se encuentra solicitando un apoyo para abastecerse de ropa, aprovechando que se avecina la temporada alta de venta de ropa, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertir en blusas, camisas, camisetas, pantalones, suéter, entre otros.
texts.en:
Nidia is a 49-year-old woman who is looking to achieve economic independence, and day by day she fights to earn her living in her clothing-selling business. Despite having a husband, she wishes to be a person who aims to support her family, and she wants to have money to fulfil and satisfy the needs and wishes of her family.

Currently Nidia is asking for support to supply her business with clothing, taking advantage of the fact that she is approaching the high season for clothing sales. For this she wants to ask for a loan to invest in blouses, shirts, t-shirts, pants, and sweaters, amongst other things.

loans.use: to invest in blouses, shirts, t-shirts, pants, and sweaters, amongst other things.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer from Baure village. As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Yakubu can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yakubu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Yakubu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abubakar has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abubakar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Abubakar can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abubakar will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land. Abubakar is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en:
Inusa is a maize farmer from Ali Gari village. As a Babban Gona member, Inusa is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Inusa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Inusa can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Inusa no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Inusa hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with it.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Batbayar, 28 years old, lives with his mother and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling mobile phones since 2008 to local people, renting a stall in the phone mart.

Using his previous loan, he has installed vacuum insulated windows and hardwood floors into his house, limiting dust exposure. Now he is requesting a loan of 500 USD to buy fiberglass and foam for home insulation. By doing so, he will help his family to burn less coal for heating, releasing less pollutant into the air.

loans.use: to insulate his home

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia lives a simple life with her family in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is 22 years old and married woman. Her husband does “tuba” (coconut wine) gathering to earn a living; while Antonia is engaged in hog raising business. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs. In addition to this, she will also buy variety of goods such as chips, biscuits, candies, sugar, coffee, toiletries, spices and laundry soap to sell. Definitely, she is thinking of other business opportunities that will help them augment their livelihood such as starting up a sari-sari (varieties) store business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and a variety of goods such as chips, biscuits, candies, sugar, coffee, toiletries, spices and laundry soap to sell

loans.name: Jose Ines

texts.es:
José Ines con 55 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge y una nieta de 3 años de edad, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Él cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Jose Ines se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con 2 hectáreas de variedad Catimor, plantación tiene cuatro años de edad, esta en segundo año de producción, actividad lo realiza hace más de 20 años en terreno propio Caserio Las Juntas del Distrito Santo Tomas. Su producto lo comercializa en Distrito Santo Tomas a compradores mayorista de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de piña portuguesa y a la cría de animales menores como (gallinas, pavos, chanchos y cuyes) y al cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, vitucas, plátanos, menestras, frutas y otros) siendo estos para su consumo y en ocaciones para la venta,cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito será para invertir en el mantenimiento de 1 hectárea de café de las 2 hectáreas con las que cuenta, asegurando campaña 2016 con una mayor y mejor producción, obteniendo un mayor volumen de ventas reflejado en mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

José Ines es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
José Ines is 55 years old. He lives in his own house made of basic materials with his spouse and a 3 year old grandchild in the district of Santo Tomás, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department, Perú. He has very good references both personal and for work, from the people of the area. The inhabitants of this place work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Jose Ines works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has two hectares of Catimor varietal coffee. His plantation is four years old and is in it's second year of production. He has carried out this activity for more than 20 years on his own property in Las Juntas village of Santo Tomas district. He sells his product to the wholesale buyers in the district of Santo Tomas. Additionally he grows pineapples and raises small animals like chickens, turkeys, pigs and guinea pigs and grows food products (yucca, taro, plantains, legumes, fruits and others). These are for his own consumption and occasionally for sale. He has a lot of experience in the field.

The loan will be used to invest in the maintenance of 1 hectare of coffee of his two hectares, which will assure greater and better production for the 2016 season. He will obtain a higher volume of sales, providing more income and therefore he will be able to improve his and his family's quality of living.

José Ines is a repeat member of Edpyme Alternativa. He is signing with his spouse.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of 1 hectare of coffee of his two hectares, which will assure larger and better production for the 2016 season.

loans.name: Calib

texts.en:
Calib has been running his business for many years. He is a father of his 3 children. He wants to help his wife who is a teacher in providing for the needs of their children in school such as tuition fees.

He has been selling a variety of shoes to his local community members. He wants to expand his business. Recently, he took a loan to purchase plenty of shoes from the market to have greater sales.

Calib's plan for the future is to save more money to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy different kind of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly works hard to support her family. Merly is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Merly has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Merly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 56 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Liberty works very hard to provide for them.

Liberty runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Liberty has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Liberty would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Cerelyn

texts.en:
Cerelyn works hard to support four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,400 loan through NWTF to invest in a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Cerelyn is aware that by using the solar, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en:
Maylinda is 39 years old and has nine children. Maylinda is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Maylinda is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Maylinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maylinda has been raising livestock for 15 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maylinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Nermilyn

texts.en:
Nermilyn is 27 years old and married with one child who is in school. Nermilyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

Nermilyn has been in this business for seven years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Edna is 50 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Edna has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Edna has been in this business for 15 years. Edna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Iborooga Abagambakamu Group

texts.en:
Pauline, age 31, is a mother of three children. She is a hard-working and married woman, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.

Pauline deals in a produce business, where she sells a variety of products, like beans and rice, among others, depending on the season.

To supplement her income, she does farming, where she has reaped more income to sustain her family. She is challenged by seasonality changes, in addition to price fluctuations of produce.

Pauline’s dream is to become a leading produce dealer in her area, with a well-stocked produce store.

Pauline is guaranteed by Iborooga Abagambakamu Group members to get a loan which she will use to buy more produce to sell, like maize and beans.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell, like maize and beans.

loans.name: Kabahango Kisomoro Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Rose is a 32 year old married lady with 1 child living in Fort Portal Uganda. She owns a retail shop where she works for 8 hours a day. In addition, she also does crop production and livestock farming that add her more income. She is faced with a hardship of customers who default on her and this makes her operate on low profits and delayed expansion.

Despite that, she has hopes of expanding her business to a wholesale shop. Rose has asked for a loan through Kabahango Kisomoro Tweyimukye group to help her add stock of sodas, beers, sugar and cooking oil in her retail shop for sale

loans.use: to add stock of sodas, beers, sugar and cooking oil in her retail shop for sale.

loans.name: Elena Patricia

texts.es: Elena de 47 años es una microempresaria que en su almacén misceláneo maneja una gran variedad de productos de uso escolar, cosméticos, cremas corporales, fragancias y regalos para toda ocasión, idea de negocio que emprendió en el año 2013 considerando que en el sector existía una buena demanda, así que con sus ahorros convirtió este proyecto en una realidad y hoy en día logra solventar a su familia con los ingresos que le genera.  Ella es viuda y tiene a su cargo a sus tres hijos de los cuales aún uno es menor de edad y con su negocio ha podido ofrecerles bienestar y  educación académica de calidad.  Sus principales clientes son vecinos y transeúntes del sector a quienes atiende todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., sus ventas son generadas de contado y en ocasiones brinda créditos a clientes frecuentes. Sus compras las realiza a proveedores de confianza y para aprovechar los descuentos que ellos le mantienen, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en nuevo surtido de cosméticos, esmaltes, perfumes, cremas corporales, productos para el aseo personal y detalles para toda ocasión, así podrá aprovechar la demanda que se avecina por la temporada decembrina.  Elena proyecta que con esta inversión a corto plazo es incrementará el surtido de su negocio y sus ventas se dinamizaran.
texts.en:
Elena, age 47, is a micro-entrepreneur who handles a wide variety of products in her variety shop: school supplies, cosmetics, body creams, fragrances, and gifts for all occasions.  She had the idea for this business that she established in 2013, knowing that there was a great demand in this sector.  So, she turned the project into reality with her savings, and today she keeps her family afloat with the income that it generates.  She is a widow and has her three children (one of whom is still a minor) under her care.  With her business she has been able to offer them a good life and a quality education.  

Her main customers are neighbors and passers-by.  She waits on them every day from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  Her sales are made in cash, and occasionally she offers credit to her frequent customers.  

She makes her purchases from reliable merchants.  In order to take advantage of the discounts they have, she is asking for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will invest it in new stock of cosmetics, nail polish, perfumes, body creams, personal cleansing products, and accessories for all occasions.  In this way she can take advantage of the demand that will come with the December season.  Elena projects that with this investment, her stock will increase and her sales will be invigorated in short order.

loans.use: to invest in new stock of cosmetics, nail polish, perfumes, body creams, personal cleaning products, and accessories for every occasion

loans.name: Nonna

texts.en:
This nice lady is 28 years old and her name is Nonna. She lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. Nonna graduated Yerevan State University the faculty of Philology. Already 4 years she works of her specialty; she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. Nonna is very patient and clever young pedagogue who very seriously and carefully manages her teaching activities.

Nonna very properly explains the grammar and nicely introduces Armenian literature to her pupils so that each of them gets very interested in the lesson. She also gives paid private courses of Armenian Language and Literature for those pupils who will have entrance exams of this subject. Nonna is married and she has a pretty daughter. Her husband works as a locksmith.

This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Nonna asks as she wants to buy a big table and chairs for her work room and she also wants to buy some very important pieces of professional literature.

loans.use: to buy a big table and chairs for her work room and also to buy some very important professional literature.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan, de 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive solo en uno de los barrios de Ceguaca, Santa Bárbara. Él se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares desde hace 3 años en su casa, allí ofrece los productos como ser libros, papel, cuadernos, lápices, sobres, tijeras, pegamento, cintas, hilos y otros. Antes de poner su negocio estudiaba. Ha mantenido su negocio mediante la inversión de dos préstamos anteriores solicitados en ODEF. Actualmente solicita otro préstamo por la cantidad de 18,000 Lempiras para la compra de útiles escolares como cuadernos, bolígrafos, marcadores, papel, mochilas, libretas etc. con el propósito de aumentar su inventario y estar preparado para el próximo periodo escolar en la comunidad. Su meta es fortalecer su negocio y poder obtener ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan, 25, is single and lives alone in a neighborhood of Ceguaca, Santa Barbara. For thee years he has been selling school supplies from his home, including books, paper, ringbinders, pencils, envelopes, scissors, glue, tapes, strings and other items. Before establishing his business he was a student. He has kept his business afloat by investing two previous loans from ODEF.

Now he is requesting another loan in the amount of 18,000 HNL to buy school materials such as ringbinders, ballpoint pens, markers, paper, backpacks, notebooks, etc. in an effort to increase his stock and prepare for the upcoming school year.

His goal is to strengthen his business to earn more income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy school materials such as ringbinders, ballpoint pens, markers, paper, backpacks, notebooks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Miryam Group

texts.en:
Maya is the featured borrower of Miryam group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they all seek to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Maya is the lady at the center of the picture. She is a 32 years old single lady, who has been working as a sales person in a clothes selling company since 2004.
Since she is limited to her monthly salary, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for necessary urgent dental needs expenses.

As for the other group members, her sister Yohana at the far right side, a divorced mother of two, will use her loan share to buy a living room for her house and curtains to warm up her house during the winter season. While Darine is the lady at the left, a married mother of four, and her acquired loan will be invested in buying carpets to warm up her family and house during the coming cold winter season.

loans.use: to pay for necessary urgent dental needs expenses.

loans.name: Ngân's Group

texts.en:
Ngân is 32 years old and is married with 1 child. She has had a retail business selling medication for 6 years.

Ngân lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village and moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Ngân faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more medicine to resell.

This is Ngân's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the Ngân's group, which consists of 3 members. With her business profit, Ngân hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine to resell.

loans.name: Keith

texts.en: Keith is 36 years old and single. He is working in Dipolog City as a government employee. He is the one who provides for the educational needs of his nephew and niece. The purpose of his loan is to fully pay the tuition of his nephew and also to purchase additional goods for his sari-sari store business. Keith wants to make expansion nearby in their barangay so he took a new loan for his business preparation. Keith is preparing now for the future of his family and for the expansion of his business: he will improve his living through this business.

loans.use: to pay his nephew's tuition fee and to purchase additional goods for his sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Karambi Bakyara Twekambe Group

texts.en: Brian is a 32 year old married man with 2 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like matooke, Irish potatoes and beans. He has not stopped on that, but also owns a video hall, motorcycle transport, poultry farming and a unisex salon that adds him more income for his family. He is faced with challenges of customers who default him and unpredictable weather changes that hinder prosperity growth of his business. However, Brian has future hopes of building rentals and investing more capital in transport business. Brian has asked for a loan in a group of Karambi Bakyara Twekambe that will enable him  buy chicken feeds for his poultry project.

loans.use: to buy chicken feeds.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 61 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child in school.

Gloria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gloria has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a maize farmer from Bazana II village. As a Babban Gona member, Amina is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Amina would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Amina can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Amina no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Amina hopes to realize better yields. She plans on using her additional income to move into a better home with her family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Angela Patricia

texts.es:
Estar cerca de sus hijos, es el motivo que tiene a Diana hoy ante todos ustedes Solicitando un apoyo económico para Iniciar un negocio de confección.
Diana vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene 27 años de edad y tres hijos de 12, 11, 4 años de edad, con su negocio solo quiere poder disfrutar más de ellos, estar pendiente de su crecimiento, de su estudio, es muy preocupada por sus muchachos.
Diana aprendió de la confección  gracias a unos cursos que tomó, por ello se siente preparada para afrontar este reto como independiente, donde solo necesita dos máquinas una plana y una fileteadora,
texts.en:
Being close to her children is what motivates Diana who is here before you today to request your economic support to start a sewing business.

Diana lives with her common-law partner. She is 27 years old and has three children, ages 12, 11 and 4. With her business she wants only to enjoy more time with them, watching after them as they grow and study. She is very concerned about her boys.

Diana learned how to sew by taking courses, so she feels prepared to take on the challenge of working independently, needing only two sewing machines: a normal one and an overlock machine.

loans.use: to start a sewing business and be close to her children.

loans.name: Arame's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 22 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en novembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes du même village très solidaires et dynamiques. Une bonne ambiance règne pendant les réunions de groupe.Elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce, l'agriculture et l'embouche.
DIABA debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est l'emprunteuse vedette. Elle est âgée de 56 ans, mariée et mère 5 garçons et 3 filles. Elle s'active dans le commerce d'huile de palme et d'épices.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 20 litres d'huile de palme à 1 000 FCFA le litre et revend le litre à 1300 FCFA. Elle compte aussi acheter des épices, 15 kilogrammes de poivrons à 800 FCFA le kilo et le revendre à 1100 FCFA. Elle va aussi acheter 5 kilogrammes de poivres à 7 000 FCFA le kilo et le revendre à 8 000 FCFA.Pour le transport des marchandises elle paye 3 000 FCFA.
Les bénéfices serviront à répondre aux charges familiales notamment en achetant de la nourriture pour la famille mais aussi à épargner.
texts.en:
This group of 22 members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created in November 2009. It is composed of women from the same village who are very energetic with a lot of solidarity. A good ambiance reigns over group meetings. The women are mainly active in commerce, agriculture, and livestock.

DIABA, standing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is the featured borrower. She is 56 years old and the married mother of five boys and three girls. She is active in the commerce of palm oil and spices.

With this loan, she intends to purchase 20 liters of palm oil at 1,000 francs CFA per liter to resell at 1,300 francs/liter. She also intends to purchase some spices and 15 kg of bell peppers at 800 francs/kg to resell at 1,100 francs. She is also going to purchase 5 kg of black pepper at 7,000 francs/kg to resell at 8,000 francs/kg. For transporting the merchandise, she pays 3,000 francs.

The profits will be used to respond to family expenses, especially by buying food for the family and also by putting money toward savings.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and some spices.

loans.name: Phượng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phượng is 55 years old and married. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry for more than ten years.

Phượng lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Phượng faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. This is Phượng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Phượng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

location.town: nhóm 07, Trung Tâm, Yên Mỹ, Nông Cống

loans.name: Ruth Mary

texts.es:
Ella es Ruth, una mujer sonriente, alegre, esas personas que te sacan una sonrisa, ella es casada, tiene 45 años de edad y una hermosa hija de 14 años.
Ruth es peluquera con varios años de experiencia, pero lo suyo no es trabajar para alguien, le gusta ser su propio jefe, manejar sus tiempos, por ello hoy necesita tu apoyo, un dinero para completar el monto necesario para la compra de una silla de peluquería, un tocador, un lava-cabezas y enseres de peluquería. 
El motivo del préstamo es, que quiere montar su propio salón de belleza, trabajar para ella, buscar una independencia económica, mejorar sus ingresos para aumentar su calidad de vida, por tener un negocio propio, pro asegurar un futuro, por generar empleo, por felicidad, múltiples sentimientos que acarrean un solo préstamo y que tú con un préstamo puedes hacer realidad, ayudando a una madre colombiana a constituir un negocio, brindándole la herramienta primaría para que labre su futuro.
texts.en:
This is Ruth, a pleasant, cheerful woman who knows how to get you to smile. She is married, 45 years old and has a beautiful 14-year-old daughter.

Ruth is a hair stylist with several years' experience. But she is not the type to work for someone else since she likes to be her own boss and manage her time. Therefore she needs your support in the form of a loan to complete the amount she needs to buy a styling chair, vanity station, shampoo station and salon equipment.

The reason for the loan is that she wants to open her own beauty salon, working independently to earn more income and increase her quality of life. She wants her own business to insure her future and to generate employment to be happy. Many emotions are involved in this one single loan and you can help make her dreams come true. By helping a Colombian mother build her business you are giving her the primary tool to carve out her future.

loans.use: to buy a styling chair, vanity station, shampoo station and salon equipment.

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es: Gloria, tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una de las aldeas de San José de Colinas, Santa Bárbara. Ella se dedicaba a la elaboración de sombreros de palma pero en busca de obtener más ingresos decidió vender ropa nueva para niños, mujeres y hombres, esta actividad la realiza en forma ambulante y por pedidos desde hace 1 año. Está solicitando un segundo préstamo a la institución por 10,000 Lempiras para invertir en la compra de mercadería nueva de ropa en general para surtir su negocio y aumentar las ventas. Su meta es ampliar su negocio hasta que sea estable y genere los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gloria is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and her two children in one of the villages in  San José de Colinas, Santa Bárbara. She works making palm hats. But looking to make more income she decided to sell clothing for children, women and men. She has done this itinerantly and by order for one year. She is requesting a second loan from the institution for 10,000 Lempiras to invest in the purchase of new clothing, merchandise to stock her business and increase her sales. Her goal is to expand her business so it is more stable and generates income to cover the needs of her family to provide them with a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy new clothing for children, women and men to stock her business and increase her sales.

loans.name: Coumbayel's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place en Juillet 2002, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’élevage.

Madame Coumbayel, (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est veuve et mère de 11enfants. Elle s’active dans l’élevage de moutons.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 04 moutons et des aliments pour les engraissés et les revendre en détails dan les marchés hebdomadaires au bout de 03 ou 06 mois.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte prendre en charge l’alimentation l’habillement et les soins médicaux de ses enfants et aider dans la prise en charge de ses petits enfants.
texts.en:
Established in July 2002, this 'banc villageois' is composed of women who have experience in 'banc villageois' programs. The women share strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and livestock.

Ms. Coumbayel (sitting at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower. She is a widow and the mother of eleven children. She is active in the livestock farming of sheep.

With her new loan, she intends to purchase 4 sheep and some feed for fattening them to resell at the weekly markets after three or six months.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sheep and some feed to fatten them for resale at weekly markets after 3 or 6 months.

loans.name: Maria Camila

texts.es:
María Camila es una joven de 24 años de edad, dedica a la confección directa, residente del municipio de bella, soltera y sin hijos, trabaja pro cumplir sus sueños y metas, tales como estudiar, comprar vivienda, tener una verdadera independencia, rodeada de lujos comprados de su bolsillo, fruto del esfuerzo y sudor que deja en cada día de trabajo.
Pensando en la temporada alta de venta de ropa, donde mejores ventas genera y consigue nuevos clientes para trabajar en el año la joven quiere solicitar un préstamo que dividirá en dos partes; la primera será para la compra de insumos como telas y artículos decorativos para la confección, el otro restante será capital trabajo para pagar proveedores como lo son las estampaciones, el corte de tela, envíos, e imprevistos.
texts.en:
Maria Camila, 24, is a seamstress. She lives in the municipality of Bella, is single and has no children. She works to realize her dreams and achieve her goals such as getting an education, buying a home, being truly independent, and enjoying the nice things she has bought herself as a result of the hard work she does every day.

In her mind is the high season for clothing sales when sales volume is up and new customers can be attracted. Maria Camila wants to request a loan to be divided into two parts; the first will be used to buy fabrics and decorative sewing items, and the rest will be used to pay suppliers like the fabric printers and cutters, shipping and contingencies.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fabric and sewing decorations.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace operates a farm where she grows coffee and other crops. Her business is located in a good area. She describes herself to be honest. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Grace requested her third loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank for 30,000 KES, which she will use to buy pipes for water connection.

loans.use: to purchase pipes for water connection.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is 35 years old, married, and has five children. She is lives with her family in Lahore. Her husband runs a tire shop; her son helps his father in the business and is learning business tactics. They work together to make sure that they are profitable enough to cover all their expenses.

Due to high demand, they want to buy more tires from wholesellers to sell at their store, but they do not have sufficient funds. Suriya requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan to help her son and husband purchase more tires. They are striving to get stable and believe that this business can help them achieve it.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase tires for his tire shop.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 6 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été inauguré en décembre 2012. Il est constitué de femmes du même village qui s’activent dans le commerce, l’embouche, l’agriculture et la transformation. Elles partagent des liens forts de solidarité.
DIOUMA debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est âgée de 29 ans, elle est l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée sans enfant. Elle s’active dans le commerce de carte de crédit téléphone. Elle mène cette activité depuis son entrée dans le banc villageois.
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter des cartes de crédit téléphone suivant les opérateurs du pays, Expresso, Orange, Tigo et kiréne. Pour chaque type de carte, elle achète pour un montant de 50 000 FCFA. Elle achète également du crédit par transfert pour un montant de 150 000 FCFA qu'elle va revendre ensuite. Le reste du prêt constitue son fond de roulement.
Les bénéfices serviront à réinvestir dans son activité pour encore le développer mais aussi à épargner et satisfaire les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
This group of 6 members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created in December 2012. It is composed of women from the same village who are active in commerce, livestock, agriculture, and food processing. The women share strong ties of solidarity.

DIOUMA, standing at the right in the photo with her left hand raised, is 29 years old. She is a the featured borrower. She is married, without children, and active in the commerce of phone-minutes cards. She has been in this business since joining the 'banc villageois’.

With this loan, she intends to purchase some phone-minutes cards of the service suppliers in the country: Expresso, Orange, Tigo, and Kiréne. For each type of card, she is spending 50,000 francs CFA. She is also purchasing minutes by transfer, worth 150,000 francs, that she will resell afterward. The rest of the loan is for her working capital.

The profits will be used for reinvesting in her business to develop it more and also for her savings in order to satisfy day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase phone-minutes cards

loans.name: Mame Diarra's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 4 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en novembre 2010. Il regroupe des femmes très dynamiques et très solidaires qui s'activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche.
MAME DIARRA debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l'emprunteuse vedette, elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée sans enfants.Elle s'active dans l'embouche et le commerce en allant acheter des bœufs et de l'huile dans les villages environnants.
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter un bœuf à 300 000 FCFA et le revendre après élevage à 800 000 FCFA au bout de 5 mois. Elle achète aussi un bidon de 20 litres d'huile à 15 000 FCFA qu'elle va revendre à 16500 FCFA. Avec le reste du prêt, elle achète de l'aliment de bétail.
Avec les bénéfices elle compte acheter des moutons pour continuer son activité d'embouche les élever et les revendre après.
texts.en:
This group of 4 women belongs to a Banc Villageois that was created in November 2010. Its members are very dynamic and they share a strong bond of solidarity. They run commercial activities and raise animals.

MAME DIARRA, age 45, is the member standing on the right in the group photo and raising her left hand. She is the featured borrower for the group. She is married without children. Mame Diarra works in commerce and animal fattening, buying cows and oil in surrounding villages.

With this loan, she will buy one cow at 300,000 FCFA to raise and sell for 800,000 FCFA after 5 months. She will also buy one 20-liter jug of oil at 15,000 FCFA to sell for 16,500 FCFA. The remainder will be used to buy animal feed.

Mame Diarra will use her profits to buy sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.use: to buy one cow and a jug of oil.

loans.name: Evan

texts.en: Evan is a 44 years old and married with one child. She lives in Pan-ay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. She owns a farm and is doing well. She earns a good income for the family while her husband is an electrician. She has successfully repaid her previous loan which she used for re-planting of her farm. With her investment, she was able to generate more income than before and was able to support her child's education. She took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to improve her farm. She wants to improve her farm and her future plan is to renovate their home for a safer living environment for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn cultivates and sells seaweed to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years, and she works hard to support her family.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase seaweed seedlings and plastic rope for her business.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings and plastic rope for her business

loans.name: Carmen Adriana

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre cabeza de familia de 40 años de edad, una persona tierna, humilde, trabajo y perseverante, tiene un niño de 8 años de edad, que se encuentra estudiando y no le falta nada gracias a esa madre luchadora que tiene.
Carmen por necesidad económica y pro estar cerca de su hijo y por una incapacidad que no la deja realizar varios trabajos, inicio un negocio como independiente de venta de bebidas alcohólicas, cerveza, refrescos y bebidas energéticas.
Carmen representa el espíritu de una mujer guerrera que da todo de sí y no tiene pretextos para trabajar y luchar por el futuro de su hijo.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para ampliar su negocio, teniendo nueva línea de venta con la que complementara sus bebidas, el dinero será para la compra de activos fijos para iniciar con la venta de carne asada y chorizos; necesita comprar asador, carbón, sillas, mesas, carpa, e insumos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 40, is her family's head of household. She is a tender, kind, hard-working, persisent person with an 8-year-old son who attends school. He lacks for nothing thanks to the persevering mother he has.

Out of economic need, an incapacity to do several types of work and to be close to her son, Carmen started an independent business selling alcoholic beverages, beer, soft drinks and energy drinks.

Carmen represents the spirit of the warrior woman who gives her all, without pretext, in her work and the struggle for her son's future.

She is requesting a loan to expand her business and add new lines of complementary products. The money will be used to buy fixed assets to start a roast meat and chorizo business. She needs to buy a rotisserie, coal, chairs, tables, an awning and supplies.

loans.use: to buy a rotisserie, coal, chairs, tables, an awning and supplies.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been operating his own tailoring shop in the local market for one year. He is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Uzma's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories such as pieces of clothes, laser needles, and sewing machine accessories. Due to some financial constraints, he is not in suitable condition to buy these items for his business.

Uzma requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan which she will use to financially assist her husband to purchase these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income.

loans.use: help her husband increase his tailoring business.

loans.name: Asmia

texts.en:
Asmia is a 38-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver, by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not worked properly and her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

Therefore, Asmia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Asmia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her husband in repairing his rickshaw.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 37 years old and an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Sonia's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring supplies like pieces of cloth, lace, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to financial constraints, he is not able to afford these items at this time. Therefore, Sonia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With this loan she will be able to assist her husband with purchasing these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, enabling him to increase his income.

Sonia is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be responsible. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She will save the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
This will be Aram’s second Kiva loan and he is very hopeful for another beneficial loan. Aram lives in the village of Noratus in the Gegharkunik region. He is married with two children and he lives with his parents.

Aram works in the military and also farms along with his family. On his farm he keeps cows and calves. With the help of his mother and wife, Aram sells farm products such as milk, macun (a national dairy product), cheese and meat. Aram is anxious to store enough feed for all of his cattle and has started to stockpile it very early. With this loan of 700, 000 Armenian drams, Aram will be able to purchase a lot of feed for his cattle.

loans.use: to buy feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Halima has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Halima would have had to sell her maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Halima can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest time.

As a Babban Gona member, Halima will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Halima is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mathew has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mathew would have had to sell his maize at harvest time, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mathew can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest time.

As a Babban Gona member, Mathew will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Mathew is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en:
Rabab is a single 24-year-old lady who opened her photography shop in 2012. She has worked in this skilled career for five years, having previously been employed at a photography shop and getting vocational training where she worked on refining her skills.

Rabab is acquiring her third YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a car for her business so that she can transport her photography equipment to photograph special occasions.

Her previous loans helped her a lot with establishing and developing her business. She is working hard to expand her business in a well managed way and hopes to open a new branch in the future.

loans.use: to buy a car for her business so that she can transport her photography equipment to photograph special occasions.

loans.name: Rosalio Guadalupe

texts.es: Rosalio es una mujer emprendedora de 37 años de edad que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de tamales la cual realiza desde hace 3 años, elaborando de diferentes ingredientes cada día, entre sus especialidades están: tamal de gallina, de chipilín con queso, de elote, de azúcar y de pato. Ella tiene 3 años de habitar en la zona, junto a su hijo de 12 años de edad y su grupo familiar. Rosalio desea invertir en ingredientes para su negocio, por mayor y de esta manera aumentar sus ganancias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: maíz, gallinas, patos, tomates, entre otros productos para elaborar sus tamales.
texts.en:
Rosalio is a busy, 37-year-old woman who earns her living with her business of selling tamales (steamed filled dumplings) which she is doing for three years now. She develops different ingredients every day. Among her specialties are: tamal with chicken, with chipilín (leafy vegetable) and cheese, with corn, with sugar and with duck. She has been living for three years in the area, with her 12-year-old son and her family group. 
Rosalio wishes to invest in ingredients for her business in bulk and to increase her earnings in this way. That´s why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: corn, chickens, ducks, tomatoes, among other products to produce her tamales.

loans.use: to buy corn, chickens, ducks, tomatoes, among other products to produce her tamales (steamed filled dumplings)

loans.name: Nohemy Aracely

texts.es:
Nohemy, es una mujer que vive con sus cuatros hijos, es casada pero actualmente se encuentra separada de su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, así como también a la venta de lácteos y otros. Empezó con este negocio gracias a la inducción de unas amistades ella utilizo capital propio para la venta de tortilla, posteriormente poco a poco empezó a ofrecer crema, queso y otros, ella ya cuenta con más de ocho años en este negocio el cual lo desempeña en su casa de habitación.
Ella solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de maíz, leña, bolsas, queso duro, crema, quesillo y otros, Nohemy considera que esto le será de gran ayuda para el fortalecimiento del negocio, generar más ingresos, crecer como micro-empresaria, además de poder realizar la ampliación de su vivienda.
Como toda madre de familia su sueño es poder hacer de sus hijos unos profesionales y con el incremento de sus ganancias considera que le será más fácil ver su sueño realizado.
texts.en:
Nohemy lives with her four children. She is married but is currently separated from her husband. She sells tortillas, dairy products and other items. She started this business thanks to the advice she received from friends. She invested her own capital to sell tortillas and later started to sell cream, cheese and other products. She has had this occupation for 8 years and runs her business from home. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of corn, firewood, bags, cheese and other items. Nohemy considers that this will help her strengthen her business, generate more income, grow her small business, and enlarge her home.

As a mother, her dream is to help her children become professionals. It will be easier for her to realize her dream with the increase in income that she expects.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, bags, cheese and cream, among other supplies.

loans.name: Martin Emilio

texts.es:
Martin es un agricultor de 66 años de edad una persona trabajadora, padre de 3 hijos, se separó de su esposa hace ya un tiempo por diferencias que prefiere no mencionar.
Como ven en la foto sus cultivos están en etapa de maduración, pero falta aplicarle algunos productos, principalmente para alejar las plagas y devoradores de estos, pero el señor Martin no cuenta con el dinero para comprar dichos productos, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual será destinado en la compra de insecticidas y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Martin is 66 years old and a farmer. He is hard-working and a father to three children. Some time ago he separated from his wife for reasons that he prefers not to talk about.

As can be seen in the photo, Martin's crops are ripening. However, they need some products, mainly to prevent disease and pests. Martin does not have the money to buy these products and is therefore applying for a loan, which he will use to buy insecticides and fertilisers.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilisers, supplies that will sustain his crops.

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 21 años de edad, una persona estudiosa, inteligente, emprendedora y luchadora, un joven práctico el cual tiene un negocio de venta de alimentos, principalmente pollos asado, pero también vende refrescos y productos fritos. 
Inicio su negocio en el año 2013, buscando recursos para ayudar a sus familiares y pagar sus estudios, en este periodo de dos años, se ha preocupado por consolidarse en el sector y no dejar que lo venza la competencia, pero  ahora quiere crecer y no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para hacerlo.
Por ello quiere solicitar hoy el apoyo de todos ustedes, un capital que le servirá para abastecer, comprara surtido de pollos en cantidades y surtido de refrescos.
Para Juan lo más importante es la sostenibilidad de su negocio, por ello recurre al préstamo además que le brindará la oportunidad de crecer, partiendo de la idea que tendrá materia prima para trabajar.
texts.en:
Juan is 21 years old. He is studious, intelligent, enterprising and plucky. He is practical, and has a business selling food. He mainly sells roast chicken but also sells soft drinks and fried products.

Juan started his business in 2013 in order to earn an income to help his family and pay for his studies. In the two years since starting the business, Juan has looked to strengthen his business in the area, and worked not to be defeated by competition. Now, however, Juan wants to expand his business but does not have enough capital to do so.

Juan is therefore applying for a loan from all of you. This capital will help him to stock up on large quantities of chickens, and to buy soft drinks.

The most important thing for Juan is sustaining his business. He is applying for this loan as it will give him an opportunity to grow. The loan will give him the supplies he needs in order to work.

loans.use: to stock up on chickens for his business selling roast chicken.

loans.name: Jose Efrain

texts.es: Don José, tiene 71 años de edad, está casado, tiene 4 hijos y reside en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara junto a su esposa y un hijo. Don José, lleva muchos años dedicado a la agricultura y ganadería. Su negocio comenzó hace 19 años con el cultivo de  maíz, frijoles y café el cual vende en el mercado de la zona y es su fuente de ingresos. El cultivo ha mejorado por la inversión de varios préstamos, actualmente solicita el octavo ciclo a la institución y es por 6,000 Lempiras para comprar insumos, abonos y plantas de café para seguir  cultivando más área de café. Tiene como meta la compra de ganado ya que ahora cuenta con un buen espacio de terreno para tener ganado.
texts.en: José is 71 years old, married, has 4 children, and lives with his wife and one son in a village in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. José has farmed and raised livestock for many years. He started his business 19 years ago with the growing of corn, beans and coffee, which he sells in the local market. This is his source of income. He has improved his plantation through the investment of several loans. Now he is requesting his eighth loan from the institution and it is for 6,000 lempiras. This is to buy agricultural supplies, manures and coffee plants so that he can keep expanding his coffee plantation. His goal now is to buy cattle, as he now has a good area of land to raise cattle on.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, manures and coffee plants so that he can keep expanding his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as honest and operates a farm where she grows tea and also keeps dairy cows. Her farm is located in a fertile area, but her biggest business challenge is having inadequate working capital.

She will use this KES 80,000 loan to buy pipes for a water connection and a cow. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy pipes for a water connection and a cow.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Feliciano con 41 años de edad, vive en casa familiar de material rústico, junto a su madre, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Feliciano se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 hectárea. En producción de 3 años de edad variedad Catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación está en segundo año de producción, este cultivo realiza en terreno propio en el caserío Playa Grande del Distrito de Santo Tomas.Su producto se vende en Distrito Santo Tomas a compradores de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría-engorde de ganado vacuno y a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, menestras, vitucas y otros productos de la zona.El destino del crédito será para asumir gastos de mantenimiento de parcela agrícola de 1 hectárea de café de 3 años de edad, plantación en fase de espigas florales, asegurando campaña 2016 con una mejor y mayor producción reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtener mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Feliciano es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Firmará solo.
texts.en:
Feliciano is 41 years old and lives with his mother in his family home, made of rustic materials, in the district of Santo Tomas, in the province of Cutervo, in the department of Cajamarca in the country of Peru. He has many good personal and professional references on behalf of the residents of the area. The residents of this town work primarily in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Feliciano works in agriculture, specifically harvesting coffee. He currently has 1 hectare of land. His crop is a 3-year-old Catimor varietal, is resistant to diseases and is in it's second year of production. He cultivates this crop in his own plot of land in the small village of Playa Grande of the district of Santo Tomas. He sells his product in the district of Santo Tomas to buyers in the area. Additionally, he works raising and fattening cattle and raising small animals (hens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others). He also cultivates food crops (yucca, beans, taro, and other products typical to the area).

The loan will be used to cover the costs of maintenance for the plot of land of 1 hectare of 3-year-old coffee crops, and the planting of floral sprigs, ensuring the 2016 season will have a larger and better production resulting in a larger volume of sales and, for that matter, generating greater income. This will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Feliciano is a recurring client of Edpyme Alternativa. He will take out the loan on his own.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of 1 hectare of coffee crops and to plant floral sprigs for the 2016 season.

loans.name: Jabeen

texts.en:
Jabeen is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan and lives in Rawalpindi with her husband and three children. Her husband has been running his own livestock business for the past 45 years. He is the guardian of the family and is responsible for managing the household.

Jabeen's husband needs to buy buffalo and other merchandise for his livestock business, but due to insufficient financial means he is not able to afford them at this time. Therefore, Jabeen has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will assist her husband with making these purchases so that he can maximize his profits for his business and household.

Jabeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy animals and other merchandise for her husband's livestock business.

loans.name: Olga Lucia

texts.es:
Olga es una joven de 20 años de edad que vive con su pareja en unión libre, tiene un pequeño de 2 años de edad y principalmente se dedica a atender a su pareja e hijo. 
Ella y su pareja son jóvenes, decidieron tener una aventura y a pesar de las dificultades han salido salir adelante, todo lo hicieron pro amor y ahora viven juntos.
Olga se siente un poco mal por no aportar nada a la casa, tiene una idea de montar un salón de belleza puesto que cuenta con los conocimientos y diploma para ofertar estos servicios pero la falta de capital no le ha permitido iniciar su sueño.
Por este motivo y pensando en montar un negocio para llevar dinero a su hogar y gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
Formalmente la cliente solicita la ayuda de todos para realizar un préstamo con el que comprara sillas, espejos, muebles, productos de belleza, plancha, secador, todo ello pensando en iniciar con peinados y lisado de pelo.
texts.en:
Olga is 20 years old and lives with her partner. She has a two-year-old son. Olga mainly spends her time looking after her son and partner.

Olga and her partner are young and decided to have a relationship together. In spite of difficulties, the have moved forward and everything they have done, they have done out of love.

Olga feels a little bad for not bringing home an income. She therefore has had an idea: to use her knowledge and qualifications to start a beauty salon with. She can offer these services but, owing to a lack of capital, Olga has not been able to start living this dream.

As a result, with a view to opening a business to bring home an income and enjoy a higher quality of life, Olga is applying for this loan.

Olga is formally applying for everybody's help to take out a loan. She will use the loan to buy seats, mirrors, furniture, beauty products, straighteners and curlers, and hairdryers and start by offering haircuts and hair-straightening.

loans.use: to buy seats, mirrors, furniture, beauty products, straighteners and curlers, and hairdryers.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is married and has six children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, vegetables, and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. She will use this KES 25,000 loan to buy more sugar, flour, vegetables, and other items to sell. She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, flour, vegetables, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past 10 years, selling meat goat . She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality in her business.

With the loan Fatuma is requesting, she wants to purchase goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat is a 45-year-old married woman from Bethlehem City, West Bank. She lives with her family in a small, old house. She is the only breadwinner for her family and they depend on her for support.

Janat has a small souvenir workshop in the city. It is a good business and provides her with a good income, but the economic situation in Bethlehem is bad. Because of conflict, tourists has decreased. Janat took a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development to fund the purchase of olive wood and new tools for the manufacturing of souvenirs. She hopes that this new inventory will enable her to increase her sales and customers, and eventually save enough income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy olive wood and new tools for manufacturing souvenirs.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 32-year-old married woman from Nablus City, West Bank. She lives in the old city with her family in a small, old house. Sahar is the only breadwinner for her family running a small business from her house making souvenir crafts from beads .

This business has provided her with a good income, but the economic situation in the West Bank is bad because of conflict, which discourages tourism.

Sahar took out a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help her buy olive wood and new tools for the manufacture of souvenirs. She hopes that this new inventory will enable her to increase sales, attract more customers, and eventually allow her to save enough income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy olive wood and new tools for the manufacture of souvenirs.

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.en:
Huseyn was born in 1965. He is married and raising a son. Huseyn works in a state organization and does a good job. He cares very much for his son and he wants to provide him with a good education. Huseyn is asking for a loan of 5,900 Somoni to help pay for his son's university tuition.
Huseyn and his son await your mercy and Kiva lenders are only ones who can help them.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for his son.

loans.name: Segundo Pedro

texts.es:
Segundo Pedro con 39 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.
