Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Segundo Pedro se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café,con una experiencia en el rubro de 6 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cuál no tendrá problemas en vender su producto. Adicionalmente se dedica a cultivos como maíz, fréjol, yuca, rocoto ingresos adicionales que le permites solventar el crédito.

Segundo Pedro es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido 2 créditos siendo los últimos de S/. 1500, S/.1000, S/.2000 del cual a pagado bien. Firma con su cónyugue.
texts.en:
Segundo Pedro is 39 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his wife and children. The house, made of rustic materials, is in the Pomahuaca district of Jaen province in the Cajamarca department of Peru. Here the locals work mainly in farming, cattle-raising and trade.

Segundo receives good personal and professional and references from locals in Pomahuaca. He works in farming. He grows coffee and has six years' experience in this trade. Segundo will use this loan in his farming work. He will buy phytosanitary products and fertilisers to apply on his crops, and will pay labourers to work at harvest time.

Segundo can thus help his crops to improve physiologically and morphologically; this will help production and Segundo will have a good harvest, with a higher yield and a higher quality product. Segundo will therefore have no difficulties selling his products.

In addition to growing coffee, Segundo has corn, bean, yucca and rocoto chilli crops, which provides him with an additional income that will allow him to pay off his loan.

Segundo is a repeat borrower at Edpyme Alternativa. He has taken out two loans: one for 1500 Nuevo Soles, one for 1000 Nuevo Soles. He has paid back 2000 Nuevo Soles. Segundo is a co-signatory to this loan with his wife.

loans.use: to use in farming work; to apply phytosanitary products and fertilisers on his crops, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. When he was asked to describe himself in a single word, he said, “Honest.”

John has a bakery from which he sells cakes and buns. His shop is in a residential area where he sells his goods to those in the neighborhood. His biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital to build up his business.

John has applied for a 20,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner SMEP to buy more ingredients to make his baked goods.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make his baked goods.

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Khachatur is 45 years old and lives with his parents in Gavar city, Gegharkunik region. Khachatur has been farming since he was school age. Now, his parents are old and are not able to help him with farm work so he manages it alone and rather skillfully.

Khachatur has cows and calves. He sells a lot of milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese and beef from his farm. This farmer does his best to provide his parents with good living conditions.

Khachatur sells farm products at the city’s wholesale market during the week. He asks for this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams to buy fodder for his farm cattle since he must store a lot of fodder for the harsh winter months.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle since he must store a lot of fodder for the harsh winter.

loans.name: Paola Carolina

texts.es:
Paola es una hermosa joven de 21 años de edad, visionaria y centrada en sus objetivos de convertirse en una profesional y tener una casa propia, para alcanzar sus metas trabaja diariamente en un negocio que con mucho esfuerzo constituyo y el cual atiende diariamente y genera un empleo.
Ella quiere demostrar que puede lograr todos sus objetivos, su negocio refleja su firmeza y su agresividad para sumir los grandes retos.
Actualmente la bella joven solicita un préstamo para abastecer su negocio con cervezas, que es el producto más consumido en su local y el resto del capital será destinado en el mantenimiento del refrigerador que está presentando inconvenientes.
texts.en:
Paola is a beautiful 21-year-old woman, visionary and focussed on her objectives of becoming a professional and of having her own house. To achieve her goals she is working every day in a business which she set up with great effort. It´s open daily and generates employment.

She wants to prove that she can reach all her goals. Her business reflects her firmness and her aggressivness to pursue great challenges.

Currently the pretty young woman is requesting a loan to stock up her business with beers, which is the most consumed product in her bar. The remaining capital will be used for the maintainance of the refrigerator which is showing shortcomings.

loans.use: to stock up her business with beers

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yusif has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yusif would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yusif can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Yusif will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Yusif is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26-year-old single man, the sole breadwinner to four other members of his family. He works to provide cable internet services to homes and offices in his region with encouraging prices. He has an encouraging well-developed business. He works hard to provide his customers with the best maintenance services and prices.

Ahmad is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary cable Internet supplies to develop his business and support it before the coming winter season. He started his current business in July 2015, with 156 customers and has reached 218 now within three months, and the best is yet to come!

He is working hard to expand his working region and increase his customers.

loans.use: to buy the necessary cable Internet supplies to develop his business and support it before the coming winter season.

loans.name: Tursuntosh

texts.en:
Tursuntosh is a kind woman who was born in 1947. She is married and has five children, and her husband is a pensioner. The family lives and works in southern Tajikistan.

For the past eighteen years Tursuntosh has bought and sold fabrics. She buys a variety at the market in Tajikistan’s capitol, then sells it in her local market. She periodically renews the assortment of her goods.

Tursuntosh is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS through Kiva's field partner IMON International to buy more fabrics for the upcoming season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is 26 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Sevan city, Gegharkunik region.

Lusine has no higher education and with her husband she is engaged in farming. The farm is the only source of income for her family. She has cows, a calf, pigs and chickens.

Lusine makes very tasty cheese and butter to sell. She also sells her farm’s milk, macun (national dairy-product), meat and eggs.

Lusine is young but very skilled in farm work and with her husband’s help they support their children’s needs. With this loan of 600.000 Armenian drams, Lusine plans to buy a cow and fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Kokoine

texts.en:
Kokoine is a married man with two children. He operates a retail business where he sells stationery. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals.

This is Kokoine's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stationery to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stationery to sell.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Ella es Diana, mujer de 29 años de edad, viven en el sector rural de Sonson, se dedica a la producción de lácteos, negocio que inicio por necesidad económica y en el que trabaja junto con su marido para sostener su hogar.
Para los productos de leche, este ha sido un año bastante difícil marcado por las sequías que han acabado con la vida de sus animales, el bajo precio de venta de leche, múltiples factores que han afectado bastante sus utilidades.
Diana no se salva de estos imprevistos, por ello ante la emergencia, solicita un apoyo de dinero, el cual quiere invertir en la compra de dos vacas lecheras en periodo de gestación, vacunas, y en la compra de abono para los pastos.
Espera que con las dos vacas regule sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Diana is a 29-year-old woman living in the rural area of Sonson. She produces dairy products, an activity she started to face her economic needs. Her husband works with her to provide for their family.

This has been a rather difficult year for dairy products, ruined by droughts that have caused the death of her animals; the low selling prince of milk and a great number of other factors have affected her profits quite a lot.

Diana was not immune from these contingencies, and for this reason she is requesting a loan tp invest it in the purchase of two pregnant milk cows, vaccines and manure for her pastures.

She hopes to restore her income thanks to the two cows.

loans.use: to buy two pregnant milk cows, vaccines and manure.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a Kiva borrower. She has one child. She describes herself as intelligent. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals.

This is Mariam's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loans. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more tailoring materials, and she will use the anticipated profits to cater for family needs.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Eder Jose

texts.es:
Eder un hombre tierno y simpático, honrado y responsable, es soltero y no tiene hijos, es un excelente hijo pues trabaja para darle todo a su amada madre, se dedica a la distribución de pipetas de gas en el municipio de Chinu, es un proveedor pequeño que tiene sueños de grandeza, el cual con trabajo constante quiere salir adelante y obtener éxito en la vida.
El cliente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pipetas de gas, busca tener mayor inventario y así ampliar su cobertura.
texts.en:
Eder is a kind, charming, honest and responsible man. He is single and has no children, and is an excellent son as he works to give everything to his beloved mother. He makes his living distributing gas cylinders in the municipality of Chinu. He is a small supplier who has dreams of grandeur, and who with constant work wants to get ahead and be successful in life. 

The client is requesting a loan for the purchase of gas cylinders. He seeks to have a greater inventory and and in this way increase his coverage.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders to increase his total capacity of gas service

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 56-year-old married father of one child, and a person with no registered nationality. He has worked for 24 years in selling scrap to cover his family's needs and living expenses.

Khodor is trying hard to provide his family with better living conditions. Thus he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a van to facilitate transporting his scrap and thus to develop his business.

He is a loyal Al Majmoua borrower. Through his previously acquired loans, he renovated his house and made it a healthier and better place for his beloved family.

loans.use: to buy a van to facilitate transporting his scrap and thus to develop his business.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is married and has one child who is still too young to attend school. She lives in her own house which has neither electricity nor piped water.

Binti has operated a grocery for two years, selling consumables such as wheat and maize flours and sugar. Her major challenge is the creditors who demand repayment for goods she’s taken on credit.

Binti decided to join Kiva's field partner Yehu to access the loans it offers that would help her build up her business. With the 30,000 KES loan she is applying for she will buy additional stocks of sugar, rice and maize and wheat flours.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of sugar, rice and maize and wheat flours.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: José es un hombre emprendedor de 65 años de edad que hace 15 años encontró en la venta de dulces una manera de llevar el sustento a su familia, es gracias a ello que logro sacar adelante a sus hijos, que ahora tiene sus propios hogares, por lo que actualmente vive solo con su esposa. José sabe que la única manera con la que cuenta para surtir su negocio es un crédito, ya que no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: gomitas, dulces de coco, dulces tradicionales, maní salado y con dulce, entre otros productos que vende de forma ambulante.
texts.en: José is a resourceful man aged 65, who has been selling sweets for 15 years, finding in this activity a way to provide for his family. Thanks to this activity he succeeded in providing for his children who now have their own families, so now he lives only with his wife. José knows that asking for a loan is the only way to stock up his activity, as he doesn't have the necessary economic liquidity. For this reason he is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest it in gummy bears, coconut sweets, traditional sweets, sweet and salted peanuts, and other products he sells as a street vendor.

loans.use: buy gummy bears, coconut sweets, traditional sweets, sweet and salted peanuts.

loans.name: Nzalambi

texts.en:
Nzalambi is a married woman with six children, four of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Nzalambi has operated a business for the past ten years where she sells consumables such as wheat and maize flours and sugar. Her major challenge is the creditors who demand repayment for goods she’s taken on credit.

Nzalambi decided to join Kiva's field partner Yehu to access the loans it offers that would help her build up her business. With the 20,000 KES loan she is applying for she will buy additional stocks of sugar, rice, and maize and wheat flours.

loans.use: buy additional stocks of sugar, rice, and maize and wheat flours to sell.

loans.name: Dan Asabe

texts.en:
Dan Asabe is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dan Asabe has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dan Asabe would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Dan Asabe can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Dan Asabe will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Dan Asabe is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
In 2013 and at the age of 26, Bilal decided to establish his own gym, since he is very into sports and works hard to keep his body fit and in good shape.

When he decided to establish his current business, he intended to spread the love of fitness among his neighbors and convince them to work hard on developing a healthier body. Today and after two years, Bilal turned 28, and he is working hard to diversify his provided services.

He is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to open a snack bar inside his gym as an additional income business and to provide his customers with diversified services. He believes that this snack bar will be very helpful to his customers since most of them spend a long time exercising and need energy to continue.

loans.use: to open a snack bar inside his gym as an additional income business and to provide his customers with diversified services.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 31-year-old, Lebanese, single man living with his parents and his five siblings. All the family members cooperate in order to satisfy their needs and to improve their lifestyle. Mohamad owns a men's clothing shop in his town, and he is doing well so far.  Currently, he is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay his nephew’s educational fees. He states that this loan will help him to ensure a good education for his nephew.

loans.use: to pay his Nephew’s educational fees

loans.name: Yesica Paola

texts.es:
Yesica es una mujer de 28 años de edad, una mujer que se gana la vida vendiendo carne de cerdo en el municipio de Corozal, actividad que realiza por necesidad económica, pero gracias a su perseverancia, ganas, responsabilidad y honestidad con la que trabaja ha sabido salir adelante y superar múltiples obstáculos en su negocio, como lo es la fuerte competencia.
Yesica tiene dos hijos de 10 y 7 años de edad, hombre y mujer respectivamente, su principal objetivo es seguir pagando la formación de sus muchachos y mejorar las condiciones de vida y esto día a día lo está logrando trabajando en equipo junto con su pareja.
La cliente para mejorar sus ventas, quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de 3 cerdos en pie, los cuales procesara y posteriormente venderá su carne.
Sueña con un día tener su propia carnicería.
texts.en:
Yesica is a 28 year old woman, who earns a living selling pork in the municipality of Corozal, something she does due to economic needs. But thanks to her perseverance, attitude, honest and responsibility with which she works she has managed to move forward and overcome multiple obstacles in her business, which is a strong competency. 

Yesica has 2 children of 10 and 7 years of age, boy and girl respectively. Her main goal is to continue paying for their studies and improve the quality of life and she is working daily on a team together with her partner.

Her clients in order to increase her sales, want to get a loan to buy 3 live pigs, which they will raise and later sell the meant.

She dreams one day of having her own butcher's shop.

loans.use: to buy 3 live pigs which she will look after and later sell their meat

loans.name: Lestia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ella es Lestia, una mujer que no renuncio a su  sueño de tener negocio propio, un medio de sustento para alimentar y criar a su familia, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, a pesar de que ha batallado sola, a sus hijos nunca le has faltado nada pues ella con su venta de mercancía como ropa, electrodomésticos, esa es su manera de ganarse la vida, aunque trabaja todos los días, se siente feliz y orgullosa de sacar a su familia adelante.
Pensando en el mes de diciembre que es la temporada donde mayor mercancía vende, la señora Lestia quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de ropa para hombre, dama, niño y niña, electrométricos y accesorios, el préstamo tiene como objetivo principal abastecerla de productos para salir a vender a las calles.
texts.en:
She is Lestia, a woman who doesn´t renounce her dream of having her own business, a means of sustanance to feed and raise her family. She is a single mother of three children. Even though she had to struggle alone, her children never lacked anything, because of her sales of merchandise like clothing and household appliances. That´s her way of making a living. Although she is working every day, she feels happy and proud of bringing her family forward. 
Thinking of the month of december, which is the season when she is selling the most merchandise, Lestia likes to request a loan to buy clothing for men, ladies, boys and girls, household appliances and accessories. The loan´s main aim is to stock her up with products to sell out in the streets.

loans.use: to stock up with clothing for men and women

loans.name: Ah Kei Gyi Village Group 2

texts.en:
The Kiva community’s previous loan helped villagers from Ah Kei Gyi Village Group 2. With their previous loan, the villagers expanded their livestock business and increased their income. Since they do not pay high interest for their Kiva loans, Ah Kei Gyi Village’s clients were able to afford additional ducks and duck feed.

Ah Kei Gyi villagers are very grateful for all the help from the Kiva community, and are excited to continue growing their duck business with Kiva’s continued support.

This next loan will be used by these customers to purchase materials and furniture for new duck shelters, which will help them grow more ducks and prevent disease. Additionally, five more borrowers will join this group for their next loan.

loans.use: to purchase materials and furniture for new duck shelters.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 40-year-old married father of two. He is a hardworking Palestinian Refugee who is putting so much effort to develop his business in order to develop his family's living. He lives in a refugee camp and is working hard to improve their social and financial situation.

Nabil runs a bakery specializing in serving the tasty recommended Manakish. He is well known for his cleanliness, which is a remarkable need in this domain. He got his talents and skills from his father who used to work in the same domain, when he had to quit school and support him too.

He is acquiring his fourth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, where he proved to be a good standing borrower, and he invested in expanding his working sector and place. Today his acquired loan will be invested in purchasing gas bottles to start a new additional gas bottles trade business to develop his family's living.

He is working hard to be well known in nearby villages so that one day he can open another branch in a better region.

loans.use: To purchase gas bottles and start a new additional gas bottles trade business to develop his family's living

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a hardworking single lady who has been working as a tailor since 1995 to make her living. She is 46 years old, with special skills in her domain. She is well known in her region and highly recommended by her customers.

Electricity is a major problem in her region, and it is an obstacle that stands against developing her business. That's why Mona decided to ask for a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a power generator necessary for her business development and to please her customers. Mona is working hard to move her business to the main road to attract more customers and develop her business widely.

loans.use: To buy a power generator necessary for her business development and to please her customers

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo cuenta con 36 años de edad, él se dedica a la venta de dulces de forma ambulante, por lo que se siente feliz de poder sostener a su familia, con las ganancias de su negocio. Él vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 1 año de edad, a los que siempre trata la manera de brindarles lo mejor. Arturo desea invertir en su mercadería y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: gomitas, dulces, cocadas, maní con sal y con azúcar, semilla de marañón entre otros productos que vende.
texts.en:
Arturo is 36 years old. He makes a living selling sweets as a street vendor which makes him happy because he is able to support his family with the profits from his business. He lives with his life partner and his 1 year old son, both for whom he always tries to provide the best.

Arturo wishes to invest in his merchandise. To do this, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in gummies, candies, cocadas (sweets made of coconut), peanuts with salt and sugar, and cashews, among other products that he sells.

loans.use: to invest in gummies, candies, cocadas (sweets made of coconut), peanuts with salt and sugar, and cashews, among other products he sells.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis es un joven productor agropecuario de 24 años de edad, el cual tiene la responsabilidad de mantener dos princesas, de 2 años y la menor de 1 mes de edad.
Este joven luchador, padre responsable verraco, echado hacia adelante tiene un negocio de cría de animales, principalmente ganado bovino y cerdos, con el cual genera el sustento para el mantenimiento de su familia la cual la termina de conformar su pareja con la cual vive en unión libre.
Todo lo que tiene Luis lo ha ganado con trabajo honesto, fruto de largas jornadas laborales, dando todo de sí por consolidar un hogar digno para su familia.
Actualmente el cliente solicita un préstamo para dinamizar y potenciar su negocio de cría de cerdos, pensando en la temporada de venta de estos animales, por ello con el dinero comprara cerdos, alimento de engorde y vitaminas para acelerar su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Luis is a young farmer of 24 years of age, who has the responsibility of maintaining two princesses of 2 years of age and the younger of 1 month.

This young fighter, is a responsible father who throws himself forward, has a business raising animals, mainly cattle and pigs. He uses these to maintain his family who knock him into shape, he lives in union happily with his family. 

All that Luis has, has been earned from honest work, fruit of long working days, whilst keeping a respectable timetable for his family.

Currently he is asking for a loan in order to invigorate and expand his business raising pigs, thinking of the selling season of these animals. He would like the money to buy pigs, fattening feed and vitamins to accelerate their growth.

loans.use: to buy pigs, fattening feed and vitamins to speed up their growth.

loans.name: Miguel Enrique

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 43 años de edad que solicita tu apoyo para iniciar un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, el cliente se quedó sin empleo, busca pro todos los medios ganarse la vida y llevar el alimento a su familia, la cual está conformada por él, su pareja y dos hijos de 12 y 6 años de edad, el dinero será usado para la compra de insumos, mesas, básculas, canastas.
Este préstamo le permitirá a un padre preocupado, tener un negocio para generar el sustento de su familia, luchar por un mejor futuro para sus hijos y tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 43 year old man who is asking for your help to start a business selling fruit and vegetables, he has been unemployed but is looking for a way to improve his life and bring food to his family. His family consists of his partner and their two children of 12 and 6 years of age

The money will be used to buy supplies, tables, scales and baskets. 

This loan will allow a worried father to have a business in order to maintain his family, fight for a better future for his children and have a respectable life.

loans.use: to start a business selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Shuaibu

texts.en:
Shuaibu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Shuaibu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Shuaibu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Shuaibu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Shuaibu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Shuaibu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Marleen

texts.en:
Marleen is a 48-year-old married woman from Bethlehem City, West Bank. She lives in the old city with her family in a small, old house.

Marleen’s husband has a small project in the city; he has an auto repair workshop. It is a unique business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the West Bank is bad because of conflict.

Marleen took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help her husband to buy a new tool for his workshop. She hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers and eventually to save enough income to expand his business.

loans.use: to help her husband to buy a new tool for his workshop.

loans.name: Jonuary

texts.en: Jonuary is married. He owns a boutique, he started this business with savings got from coffee harvests. In his home, he caters for family expenses being the only provider. However he has a challenge of limited capital and changes in fashions and designs on the market. He has seen that women clothes sell better than any other clothing in his shop. He is requesting for money to buy more women clothes to increase his sales ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more women's clothes to increase his sales ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for the last three years. He got his capital from buying and selling coffee and is proud of his businesses.

He is faced with a challenge of competition and constant price fluctuations. He would like to compete favorably by adding soft drinks and bakery products in his shop that his customers are demanding. He is requesting money to buy the items above to sell.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and bakery products.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en: Ashot is 37 years old and he lives with his family in Gavar city in the Gegharkunik region. Ashot is a farmer and he never did any other work but farming. On his farm, Ashot has cows and calves on his farm and he sells a lot of milk, meat, macun (national dairy-product) and cheese. Ashot’s wife is unemployed and takes care of their three children and their house and she also helps her husband with their farm work. Ashot works a lot but still he does not manage to earn enough money to cover all his family's needs. He is short of money now but he must somehow make the purchase of fodder for his farm cattle and this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Ashot asks for will be used to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle to get prepared for the coming winter months.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for his farm cattle to get prepared for the coming winter months.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en: Miguela is from Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, and married with four children. Miguela prepares and sells cooked food in her community. She has been in her business for many years and earns 18,000 PHP per month. In 2004, Miguela joined GDMPC to gain access to microfinance services. Miguela is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed and utensils to be used in her carenderia. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients use for cooking.

loans.name: Goodness Group

texts.en:
Comfort is 35 years old and she is married with a 7 years old daughter. She has been operating in the sales of food stuffs such as plantain and cassava for 2 years.
Comfort lives in the city of Barack, an urban town in Teshie province. Her family is a low-income household in the town. The market need is low in this region and the income from this business is not high enough for her to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

The main hardship that Comfort faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food stuffs to increase her income.
This year, Comfort joined ID-GHANA to improve her business. Since then, she has bought food crops to supply more customers. She is the group leader of "Goodness Group", which consists of four members.
In the future, Comfort hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her child to find a good job after a good education.

loans.use: to purchase more food stuffs to increase her income.

loans.name: Ana Izabel

texts.es: Ana, tiene 27 años de edad, esta soltera y vive en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara junto a su padre y un hermano. Ana, siempre ha ayudado a su padre en la agricultura y también estudiaba. Con el propósito de generar sus propios ingresos desde hace 5 años se ha dedicado a cultivar su propia finca de café.  Actualmente solicita un préstamo por 27,000 Lempiras para comprar insumos, abonos, fertilizantes y limpieza de su finca de café para darle mantenimiento debido y sacar mejor cosecha y obtener más utilidades.  Tiene como meta la compra de más terreno para utilizarlo en cultivar café y así alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 27 years old, is single and lives in a small village called Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara together with her father and brother. She has always helped her father with agriculture, and she also studied.

With the intention of earning her own income 5 years ago she began cultivating her own coffee plantation.

At the moment she is asking for a loan of 27,000 lempiras to buy supplies, fertilizers and cleaning products for her coffee platntation to maintain it and obtain a better harvest and more profit. 

She has a goal of buying more terrain to use to cultivate coffee and therefore be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, supplies and cleaning products to maintain her coffee plantation

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Haruna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Victor David

texts.es:
Víctor necesita de tu apoyo, un capital de trabajo para iniciar un negocio de transporte de personas en zona rural, es un joven soltero de 25 años de edad que sueña con una mejor calidad, con tener un negocio y generar los ingresos para su sostenimiento, no quiere ser una persona mantenida, sueña con tener una casa propia, carro y solo le queda trabajar con mucho empeño, dedicación y amor para lograr sus objetivos.
El monto del dinero será destinado en la compra de una motocicleta, espera tener éxito y llevárselo muy bien con las demás personas que ofertan dicho servicio, ser un competidor sano y ante todo generar recursos que apoyen el sostenimiento de su familia y le permitan seguir soñando.
texts.en:
Victor needs your help, a working capital to start his own taxiing business in a rural zone. He is a young, single, 25 year old male who dreams of a better quality of life, having a business and earning enough income to maintain himself. 

He does not want to be a needy person, and dreams of having his own home and car and working with determination, dedication and love to achieve his goals. 

The money will be used to buy a motorbike, he hopes to be successful and be able to compete with others who offer the service, to be a clean competitor and be able to generate resources which will allow him to maintain his family and allow him to carry on dreaming.

loans.use: to start a business taxiing people, the money will be used to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 26 years old and single, he lives in Ramallah. He is a worker in Stars Company for one year.  Ali wants to purchase a new mobile because his old mobile was damaged, but he didn’t have enough money. So, he is requesting Kiva’s partner ALIBDAA a loan of $1110 in order to buy the new mobile.
Ali is thankful for the whole people who will help him, he is also a grateful for Kiva and ALIBDAA.

loans.use: to purchase a new cellphone.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 23-year-old single Palestinian refugee. He has been providing transportation services for five years to support his family and develop his living.

Mohamad, like most Palestinian refugees living in refugee camps, didn't have the chance to finish his education. He had to quit school during his intermediate classes to financially support his family.

His father also used to work providing transportation services, thus he was his first mentor. He used to accompany him on a daily basis for a certain period of time until he was capable of starting his own career.

Recently Mohamad had a car accident, and he has to fix his car to keep it suitable for the students and employees he transports. Thus, he acquired a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. He will invest the money in necessary maintenance to his business car and to develop his business. He will work hard to develop his business, so that he can improve his family's living situation.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance to his business car after he had an accident and to develop his business.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 43-year-old married mother with five children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. For the past 15 years, she has been selling clothes to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is doing her best to develop her business, and her husband's at the same time.

Hala is an Al Majmoua borrower for the third time. Her previous loans were all invested in the same way, developing her business through buying special season collections, and at the same time, supporting her husband's business through purchasing necessary tools requested. She proved to be a good standing borrower, and a hardworking woman.

Today, since she believes that her husband is the basis of her family, she is requesting a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua to purchase new business tools to facilitate and update his business that has to do with construction, especially plumbing work, so that he can take wider projects easily and increase his income.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. She is also looking forward to getting her children married and seeing her grandchildren soon.

loans.use: to purchase new business tools for her husband to update his construction (plumbing) work so that he can take on wider projects easily and increase his income.

loans.name: Angin

texts.en:
Angin ended her first Kiva loan successfully and of good profit for her farm. Angin lives in Ijevan city of Tavush region. With her also lives her son’s family and they all are engaged in farming and agriculture which is the only way of earning on their living.

Angin used to work many years at the carpet factory, then she worked at the hospital as a cleaner and then the same work she did in the school. Now she is unemployed but busier than before, since her farm care and farm products sale is mainly of her duty. She has pigs and piglets on her farm, also chickens and large plot of land on which she has nut, apple, grape, persimmon trees. At the city wholesale market she sells eggs, pork, nuts, apple, grapes, persimmon, wine made by her and also mushrooms. She mentions of her hard work since the family is big and her son is unemployed and farming and farm products sale is this only source of income.

With coming of winter Angin mentions that the demand of pork will become more and this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams she asks for the purchase of pigs and a lot of fodder for all of it in her farm, so that her pigs will be fed and profitable for sale.

loans.use: for the purchase of pigs and a lot of fodder for all of it in her farm, so that her pigs will be fed and profitable for sale

loans.name: Sojida

texts.en:
Sojida was born in 1985. She is a hardworking and industrious woman. Sojida is married and has three children: two daughters and a son.

Sojida is a seamstress. She sews national style and European style women's clothes. She has worked in this way for more than four years. Sojida has a lot of regular customers because she provides high-quality services.

Now, Sojida is asking for a loan because her daughter is ill and she must treat her. Sojida is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment of her daughter. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of her daughter.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 35 year old married man with 4 children and only three are attending school living in Fort Portal Uganda. He owns a business of selling coffee seeds which he started in 2010 and works there 9 hours a day and has hopes of expanding his business to a bigger area plus educating his children to attain a minimum qualification although challenges of weather changes and competition are major hindrances to his dream. Alex needs a loan to help him buy coffee seeds for selling.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds for selling

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora is a 32-year-old woman who is married to Yupiter, 31 years old. They are blessed with a son, Alfa, 2. To make money, Yupiter is working as a motorcycle taxi driver, but the income earned cannot meet all their daily needs. This situation encouraged her to do something that can help her husband in covering their living. With an amount of IDR 500,000, she initiated a business of selling vegetables at the market.

She loves to do this business, as it allows her to generate more income. She has been engaged in the business for two years. Due to the increased price of vegetables, she cannot buy them in larger quantity. This issue made her seek a loan for the business improvement.

She was grateful when an Account Officer introduced her to the TLM loan product for the small entrepreneur like her. She then requested a loan of IDR 2,500,000 from TLM to purchase carrots, tomatoes, cabbage, chilies, water spinach, etc.

She is happy that Kiva also cares for people like her who are still struggling for a better life.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbage, chilies, water spinach, etc.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 47-year-old married father of two. He is a Palestinian refugee who opened his current convenience store a year ago after he used to work providing transportation services for several years.

Marwan has been an Al Majmoua borrower for seven years. His previous loans helped him a lot in developing his family's living. But since he is facing a special needs health situation, he is working hard to develop this business, which requests less effort.

Today, Marwan is acquiring a Damej loan (Damej is the Arabic term for Integrating) from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, where Al Majmoua is working with a partner NGO to provide financing to disabled persons who have already been trained by by the NGO to perform a certain job. These disabled persons have an existing job, or are setting up a new business. It's purpose is empowering and integrating people with disabilities and special needs in the labor market. Targeted people are people with physical disabilities, or the parents or family member of a disabled person, under the condition that the loan will be for the benefit of the disabled person (ex. Home or business rehabilitation to fit the disabled person’s needs).

Marwan's acquired loan will be used to improve and develop his newly established business by diversifying his products, and increasing his business merchandise with special offer products. He hopes to stay capable of developing his family's living and increasing his income.

loans.use: To improve and develop his newly established business through diversifying his products, and increasing his business merchandise with special offer products

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Two years of experience in the domain of painting homes are enough for 22-year-old Ali, a single man who is working hard to provide five other members of his family the necessary standards of living. He is seeking a better income future through developing his business and expanding his working zone.

Ali is a hardworking man who is planning for a better income business and a brighter future. He is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a rapid car, necessary for facilitating the transportation of his business tools from one project to another.

He is very ambitious and hopes to make all his dreams come true by establishing a diversified construction services company.

loans.use: to buy a rapid car, necessary for facilitating the transportation of his business tools from one project to another.

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en:
Batoul is a bride to be! She is almost 19 years old, but she is very enthusiastic about getting married soon, and she is looking forward to making her longed-for small family of her own.

She has been working as a tutor from her parents' house for two years, and she is willing to continue after getting married because she loves providing education services and teaching others.

Today, Batoul is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to purchase necessary wedding needs and to pay for her personal bride needs and expenses. This is her first loan experience, and she hopes that in the future, she might acquire a loan to prepare her own tutoring center.

loans.use: to purchase necessary wedding needs and to pay for her personal bride needs and expenses.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard is 57 years old and she lives in Tsovagyugh village in the Gegharkunik region. She is married and she has a daughter. Alvard’s husband is a constructor and he also runs a farm in which Alvard helps him very much. Their pretty and single daughter is still school-aged and her parents do their best to provide her with the best living conditions. Alvard and her husband started repairing their house at the beginning of autumn but, having a lack of money, some work they did not manage to complete. This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Alvard asks for in order to end the work of repairing their house before the winter period and finally provide comfort for their single, lovely daughter.

loans.use: to complete repairs to their house before the winter period and finally provide comfort for their single, lovely daughter.

loans.name: Darwich

texts.en:
Darwich is a 23-year-old single Palestinian refugee, who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He has been working in providing transportation services to students and employees for four years to cover his living needs and expenses.

Darwich left school during his elementary level, to work and support his family in making their living. He is working hard to improve his life despite the hard living conditions in the camp.

He is acquiring his second youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to do necessary body work on his car to keep it in good shape for his customers. Through his previously acquired loan, he bought a new engine for his car, which is his only source of income, and did extra requested maintenance.

He hopes to open his own transportation company in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to do necessary body work on his car to keep it in good shape for his customers.

loans.name: Ribhea

texts.en:
Ribhea is a 46-year-old married woman from Hebron City, West Bank. She lives with her family in a small, old house. She is the only breadwinner for her family, and they depend on her for support.

Ribhea has a small stall selling used shoes and clothing in the city. It is a good business and provides her with a good income, but the economic situation in Hebron is bad because of conflict. Ribhea took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help her to buy a new collection of used shoes and clothing for her stall.

She hopes that this new inventory will enable her to increase her sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of used shoes and clothing for her stall.

loans.name: Mayis

texts.en: Mayis is 46 years old and he lives in Tsovagyugh village in the Gegharkunik region. Mayis now is a contractual military serviceman and at the same time a skilled farmer. He runs his farm with his wife and on the farm they take care of cows, bulls, a calf, a pig, sheep and chickens. He is a very laborious man who, with his work and busyness there, very cutely takes care of his farm and the cattle on it. He sells his farm’s milk, meat, cheese and eggs right from his farm. The potatoes he takes to the city’s wholesale market since, through the re-sellers, it is sold very quickly. Mayis has a son who is also a good helper in all the work about their farm. With this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams that Mayis asks for, he wants to make the farm richer with cattle by buying a calf and a bull and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to make the farm richer with cattle by buying a calf and a bull as well as fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en: Priscah is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells beauty products.. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for  her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as determined. He operates a carpentry business. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of carpentry materials. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials.

loans.name: Mahmuda

texts.en:
Mahmuda is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mahmuda has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mahmuda would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mahmuda can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Mahmuda will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Mahmuda is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Edinson Enrique

texts.es:
Edison es un joven de 24 años de edad que se dedica a atender un negocio de venta de abarrotes y víveres, residente en una zona de postconflicto, como lo es el municipio de Montería, se caracteriza por ser una persona perseverante, inteligente, que fabrica sus propias oportunidades y sabe en qué momento pedir apoyo, joven con gran proyección hacia el futuro.
Edison es padre de un pequeño de 5 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja e hijo.
Edison siempre ha querido crecer en su negocio, tener mayor variedad de mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes, al igual que nuevas líneas, peor la falta de capital siempre ha sido el impedimento para que pueda lograrlo, por ello solicita un préstamo para invertir en productos que no se encuentra en su tienda como lo son productos de uso personal, algunos refrescos, productos de aseo y granos.
El principal impacto que tendrá el préstamo en su negocio es que, debido a la variedad logrará atraer un mayor número de clientes, con lo que genera mejores ingresos para el sostenimiento y mejorar a de la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Edison is a 24 year old young man who works tending to his business selling groceries and sundries. He lives in a post-conflict area, which is the town of Montería. He is known as a persevering, intelligent person, who creates his own opportunities and knows when it's time to seek help. He is a young man with a great forecast for the future. Edison is the father of a 5 year old child, and lives in a common law marriage with his partner and son.

Edison has always wanted to grow in his business, to have a greater variety of merchandise to offer his customers, in addition to new products. However, the lack of capital has always been the impediment to achieving this. For that reason he seeks a loan to invest in products not found in his store, such as personal use products, some drinks, cleaning products, and grains. The primary impact the loan will have on his business is that due to the variety, he will attract a larger number of customers, which will generate more earnings to support him and to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to stock his grocery store business.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 43-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and is responsible to fulfill the need of all family members. Asma has been running her own beauty salon for the past 10 years. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, a hair brush, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Asma has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Asma is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics to increase her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Jad El Kareem

texts.en:
Jad El Kareem is a 30-year-old single man who has been working as a barber for 20 years. This wide experience has provided him with customers' trust and support and that's why he is working hard to develop it as much as he can.

In 2000, he opened his current business, and is working hard to develop it as much as he can so that he can respond to diversified clients' needs and improve his business level.

Jad El Kareem is the sole breadwinner for other family members. He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to develop his business by purchasing new beauty products and business tools.

He hopes that he can continue developing his business in a well-managed way to assure his social and financial situation.

loans.use: to develop his business by purchasing new beauty products and business tools

loans.name: Volodya

texts.en:
This young man is 21 years old and his name is Volodya. He lives with his mother in Gavar city of Gegharkunik region. Volodya has no higher education but he is very clever young man who runs a farm with his mother’s help.

He has cows, calves and piglets in his farm. His mother makes very tasty cheese, macun (national dairy-product) and also curd to sell. Volodya sells also his farm’s meat and milk. This activity of selling he organizes at the city’s wholesale market and for his farm meat Volodya does not need to look for customers since there are several butchers that buy beef and pork particularly from him.

Volodya is asking for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as he must buy a lot of fodder for all his farm cattle so as to store enough of it for the whole of the winter.

loans.use: to buy a lot of fodder for all his farm cattle so he can store enough of it for all the winter months.

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en:
Phyllis is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself as capable. She operates a farm where she keeps livestock and also grows maize, peas, beans. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a widowed woman with four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a trading center and her primary customers are locals.

Florence says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital. She will use this KES 30,000 loan to buy more cereals to sell. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially independent.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell.

loans.name: Lugo

texts.en:
Lugo is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past eight years, she has operated a mat weaving business, selling her mats from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase paints and sewing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and sewing materials.

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
Norayr lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. With his own car he gives taxi services around the whole region. Norayr lives in his native city with his wife, daughter-in-law (she works at the kindergarden) and two grandchildren.

Before Norayr used to work as a driver in the different organizations but now he is taxi driver. He has a lot of regular passengers who are his friends and neighbors. He is a very attentive and careful driver with 40 years of work experience in this field.

Now this loan of 500,000 Armenian drams is very important and urgent for Norayr since he must buy winter season car tires in order to drive safely and with comfort.

loans.use: to buy winter season car tires in order to drive safely and with comfort.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 47-year-old divorced father of two children, a Palestinian refugee, who lives and works in a Palestinian refugees camp.

Two years ago, Fouad decided to resign from working as an accountant and to start his own business to improve his living and increase his income. He opened a mini market, which he is working hard to develop and increase its merchandise to fulfill customers needs and increase his income.

Fouad's business is going fine, but needs external support to develop it, especially because it is considered as a newly established business and he has to make sure to develop it properly. For this reason, Fouad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special autumn and winter goods, in addition to special offer products.

He hopes that in the future he can open a supermarket instead of the current mini market and attract more customers.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special autumn and winter goods, in addition to special offer products.

loans.name: Nellys Esther

texts.es: Nellys  es una emprendedora mujer de 52 años de edad, residenciada en Barranquilla una ciudad donde ha logrado crecer comercialmente a través de su perspicacia para los negocios y el apoyo de su familia. Al quedar cesante manifestaba una enorme preocupación, pero  fue motivada por su cónyuge para llevar a cabo un proyecto de negocio desde casa y en medio de una lluvia de ideas, consideraron que el servicio de fotocopiado podría ser un buen comienzo, así que adquirió la máquina e inmediatamente empezó a funcionar. Para tener complementariedad en el negocio su cónyuge le obsequió una impresora y una vitrina exhibidora surtida con productos de papelería para que sus clientes encontraran todo en un mismo lugar. Hoy en día Nellys cuenta con tres años en esta actividad y está muy feliz de haber tenido éxito en su negocio con el que ha aportado a la economía del hogar. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de una fotocopiadora más completa para ampliar la capacidad de su negocio. A futuro se proyecta con un negocio mejor surtido con un incremento en las ventas y con una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nellys is an enterprising woman who is 52 years old. She lives in Barranquilla, a city in which she has been able to grow business-wise as a result of her business acumen and the support of her family.

When she became unemployed she was extremely worried, but her husband motivated her to start a business at home and while brainstorming they thought that a photocopying service could be a good start. So she acquired the machine and immediately started up her business. To complement her business her husband gave her a printer and a display case supplied with stationery items so that her customers might find everything they need in one place.

Today, Nellys has had her business for three years and is very happy to have had such success with it and to be able to contribute to her household's finances. Now she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so that she can buy a photocopier with added functionality and expand her business.

In the future she plans to have a more diverse business with an increase in sales and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a photocopier with more functions so she can expand her business.

loans.name: Danys Daniel

texts.es:
Danys, es un hombre de 34 años de edad, un hombre que quiere salir adelante, que quiere cumplir sus sueños, es soltero no tiene hijos, pero carga en sus hombros una enorme responsabilidad, mantener a sus familiares, no quiere ver a sus padres trabajando, quiere dárselo todo, por ello en su negocio de taller de mecánica para motos emplea 12 horas de trabajo diario.
Danys es una persona luchadora, que empezó de abajo, quiere crecer y posicionarse como el mejor mecánico de motos de San Rafael, ese es su sueño.
Ahora Danys se encuentra solicitando un apoyo económico para realizar ciertas modificaciones en su local, pensando en atender mayor número de motos y darle a los clientes de guardar su moto varios días por si el daño es muy grave.
El monto será destinado para comprar herramientas de trabajo, acondicionar taller, compra de materiales principalmente madera ya cero para construir estantes para ubicar la moto.
texts.en:
Danys is a 34 year old man. He is a man who wants to succeed, who wants to fulfill his dreams. He is single and has no children, but he carries on his shoulders the enormous responsibility of supporting his family members. He doesn't want to see his parents working. He wants to give them everything. For that reason, in his mechanics shop for motorcycles business, he puts in 12 hours of work a day. Danys is a fighter, who started from below and wants to grow and position himself as the best motorcycle mechanic in San Rafael. That is his dream.

Now Danys is seeking economic support to make certain renovations to his locale, as he's considering servicing a greater number of motorcycles, and offering to keep his customers' motorcycles for several days if the damage is severe. The loan will be used to buy tools for the job; to prepare the shop; and to buy materials, primarily wood and steel to construct racks in which to place the motorcycles.

loans.use: to make renovations to his locale, in order to park a greater number of motorcycles.

loans.name: Harisu

texts.en:
Harisu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Harisu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Harisu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Harisu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.as a Babban Gona member, Harisu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to (USD) $2,000 per hectare of land.

Harisu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Marcilia Maria

texts.es:
Marcilla es una mujer de 52 años de edad, dedicada a la venta de mercancía y artículos de papelería, negocio que inicio pro necesidad económica y con el cual espera en un futuro alcanzar un sueño que es realizar algunas modificaciones a su humilde hogar que como se ven en la foto tiene piso de tierra, y está construido en madera y plástico, su sueño a futuro es tener una casa en material (cemento y adobes) y con cerámica.
Ella vive en un unión libre con su pareja y tiene dos hijos.
Marcilla es muy consciente de que es la encargada de generar el sustento para el hogar, pero su negocio solo le da lo suficiente para vivir y así ve lejos la posibilidad lograr sus sueños, por ello hoy pide tu ayuda para aumentar su producción, mejorar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos, un dinero que será para la compra de accesorios y artículos de papelería.
texts.en:
Marcilla is a 52-year-old woman who sells merchandise and paper goods, a business that she started out of economic necessity. She hopes that in the future she will reach her dream, which is to make some modifications to her humble home, which—as can be seen in the photo—has a dirt floor and is constructed of wood and plastic. Her dream for the future is to have a house made of quality materials (cement and adobe) with ceramic tile.

She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner and she has two children.

Marcilla is well aware that she is responsible for providing for her household, but her business only gives her enough to live on, so the possibility of achieving her dreams seems far off. That's why today she is requesting help to increase her production and improve her sales and thereby her income. The money will be for the purchase of accessories and paper goods.

loans.use: to buy accessories and paper goods

loans.name: Chadi

texts.en:
Chadi is a 39-year-old Palestinian refugee who started his aluminum business in 1999. He is working hard to develop it and improve his family's living conditions at the same time.

Chadi is a hard-working man. He is a married father of four and works hard to provide his family with life's necessities.

He lives in a refugee camp and is working hard to increase his income and develop his family's social and financial living conditions
.
Four years ago, Chadi decided to start a new business for additional income., He started providing transportation services in his region, which improved his business through communicating with new customers.

Today, Chadi is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy aluminum necessary to develop his aluminum manufacturing business.

loans.use: to buy aluminum needed to develop his aluminum manufacturing business.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es: Carlos a sus 35 años de edad se dedica a la venta de minutas y dicha actividad la realiza de forma ambulante en su bicicleta la cual ha adecuado para el negocio, y es gracias a la movilidad que tiene que sus ventas son muy buenas. Él vive con su compañera de vida y su hija de 15 años de edad que es su mayor alegría. Carlos desea invertir en productos para su venta de minutas, pero además desea adquirir repuestos para la bicicleta en la que realiza la venta, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: fruta, jarabes, tamarindo, azúcar, hielo y repuestos para la bicicleta y las minutas.
texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old and sells shaved ices. He carries out his job as a street vendor on his bicycle, which he has adapted for the business. Thanks to the mobility he has, his sales are very good. He lives with his life partner and their 15 year old daughter, who is his primary joy.

Carlos wants to invest in products for his shaved ice business, but he would also like to acquire parts for the bike that he uses for sales. For that reason he seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in fruit, syrups, tamarind, sugar, ice and parts for the bicycle and the shaved ices.

loans.use: to invest in fruit, syrups, tamarind, sugar, ice and parts for his bicycle and shaved ices.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man who describes himself as honest. He operates a farm where he keeps cows and also grows peas, pumpkins and other crops.

John has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy seed for planting. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy seed for planting.

loans.name: Luz Danilce

texts.es:
Comenzar la línea propia es lo que motiva a la señora Luz a solicitar un préstamo con la corporación Interactuar el cual será invertido en una máquina de corte y telas, espera tener éxito pues tendrá dos línea de servicio, la confección directa y la confección a terceros, un paso muy grande para su empresa y en el cual piensa también en la estabilidad económica de su familia y la estabilidad laboral de su empleado.
Para Luz es una gran motivación ella como cabeza de familia dar este paso, pues siente que cada vez está más cerca sus sueños de comprar vivienda y un vehículo.
texts.en:
Luz wants to start her own line of clothes, and for this reason she is requesting a loan to Interactuar to invest it in the purchase of a fabric cutting machine. She hopes to succeed as in this way she will have two working lines, providing both sewing servicing and third-party tailoring servicing. This is a very big step for her activity, and in taking it she considers both the economic stability of her family and the working stability of her employee.
Being the head of her household, taking this step greatly motivates her, as she feels closer and closer to making her dreams come true: to buy a house and a car.

loans.use: buy a fabric cutting machine.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, de 53 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudio hasta segundo grado, no continuó estudiando debido a la falta de recursos económicos, está casada y junto a su esposo tiene 5 hijos, los cuales todos son mayores de edad y su esposo trabaja en la construcción.

Ana, se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la ganadería desde hace varios años, estos trabajos los aprendió de sus padres quienes siempre se han dedicado a este negocio.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar una vaca lechera, para poder aumentar la producción de leche y así logrará tener más ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Ana, es ampliar su vivienda y comprar más ganado.
texts.en:
53-year old Ana is a housewife. She has a grade 2 education and couldn't continue at school as her family was poor. She is married, and she and her husband and have five children, all now adults. Her husband works in construction.

Ana takes care of the house and has also raised cattle for several years, a job she learned from her parents who always earned their living in this way.

The loan she is seeking is to buy a milk cow. Then she will be able to increase production of milk, increase her income, and provide her family with a better standard of living.

Ana's greatest wish is to extend her house and buy more cows.
.

loans.use: buy a milk cow

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a widower with four children. He operates a farm where he grows tea. He has been involved in this business for seven years.

His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are tea factories. Joel describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more tea leaves to resell.

Joel hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves to resell.

loans.name: Zilpa

texts.en:
Zilpa is a married mother of two children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a salon where she offers beauty services.

Zilpa has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

Zilpa will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more beauty products for salon use. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yahaya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Yahaya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Yahaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: La Vecindad Del Cinco Group

texts.es: Son 6 mujeres responsables de distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellas residen en el distrito de  ATE. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal “LA VECINDAD DEL CINCO” una de ellas es la Sra. Eva de 63 años de edad. La Sra. Eva tiene como negocio una pequeña bodega (venta de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, etc.) ubicado en su propio domicilio ya hace más de 2 años el cual se dedica todos los días. La Sra. Eva  nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual a generado ingresos  para cubrir los gastos de su casa.  En el futuro le gustaría ampliar más su bodega para así poder vender más variedad de productos y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para comprar más mercadería (arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.) y poder tener más ingresos. La Sra. Eva  es la segunda del lado derecho y se le distingue por su polo de mangas largas color plomo,  un chaleco de color guinda  y una cartera negra. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y  Edaprospo diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en:
These are 6 women responsible for different business activities. They all live in the district of Ate. They are the members of the "La Vecindad del Cinco" communal group. One of them is Eva, who is 63 years old. Eva has a small corner store, in which she sells food products such as rice, sugar, etc. It has been located in her house for more than 2 years, and she works in it every day. Eva states that she has managed to create loyal customers, which has generated income to cover her household expenses. In the future she would like to increase her storage, in order to be able to sell a greater variety of products, and obtain greater economic earnings.

With the loan she has been offered she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise, such as rice, sugar, oil, etc., and be able to have more income. Eva is the second from the right in the photo, and is wearing a black, long-sleeved shirt, a red vest, and a black purse. She bids farewell with a hug to Kiva and Edaprospo, stating that she will meet all her proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Petronila Del Carmen

texts.es:
