Petronila, de 38 años de edad, es ama de casa, no estudio, está acompañada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 1 de ellos trabaja y los otros 4 aún se encuentran estudiando y su pareja es empleado.

Petronila, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras y a la siembra de hortalizas desde hace 30 años, este trabajo lo aprendió muy bien gracias a sus padres y para llegar a su trabajo camina 2 kilómetros y trabaja en el horario de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. todos los días.

Petronila, necesita el préstamo para surtir más su negocio de frutas y verduras, porque en el verano se vende mucho más y así logra tener más ingresos, para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El sueño de Petronila, es ahorrar mucho para poder construir su vivienda de ladrillo. porque en la que vive actualmente es de adobe y está en malas condiciones.
texts.en:
38-year old Petronila is a housewife. She didn't attend school. She and her husband have five children, one of whom has a job and the others attend school. Her husband is a laborer.

Petronila has earned her living growing and selling fruit and vegetables for 30 years, a job she learned from her parents. To get to work she walks two kilometers. She works every day from 6 am to 4 pm.

She now needs a loan to buy more stock for her fruit and vegetable store as in the summer months she sells much more. Then she will earn more money to provide her family with a better standard of living.

Her greatest wish is to save a lot of money so she can build a brick house as the one she lives in at the moment is made of adobe and is in a poor state of repair.
.

loans.use: buy more fruit and vegetables for her store

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey, a married man with eight children, rears cows and has a banana plantation. He has applied for a loan of UGX2000.000= from Ugafode to finance his activities and requests the support of Kiva lenders. He will buy farm inputs and manure to increase the production of his banana plants.

Godfrey is a hardworking and honest man. In the photo, he is shown with a Ugafode Credit staff member on his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and farm inputs.

loans.name: Thawra

texts.en:
A 44-year-old married woman from Jabalia City, Gaza Strip, Thawra lives with her family in a small, old house. Her husband has a small coffee shop in the city, a unique business that provides a good income.

The economic situation in the West Bank is bad because of the conflict. Thawra therefore has requested a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development to help her husband buy new chairs and tables for his coffee shop.

Thawra hopes that this new inventory will enable her husband to increase his sales and customers and eventually save enough to expand his business.

loans.use: help her husband to buy new chairs and tables for his coffee shop.

loans.name: Roxana Abigail

texts.es: Con 20 años de edad Roxana se ha visto en la necesidad de instalar un pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas, con el cual logra ganarse la vida, y apoyar a sus padres en su vejez. Ella vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en casa de sus padres, desde muy pequeña, anteriormente su madre atendía el negocio, pero ella está muy enferma, por lo que Roxana busca la manera de apoyar. Ella desea invertir en maíz por mayoreo, para que sus ganancias sean mejores, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en maíz por mayoreo y otros insumos necesarios para la venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Roxana, who is 20 years old, has had to start a small business selling tortillas that allows her to earn a living, and to give support to her parents in their old age. She lives together with her parents and siblings at her parents's place since she was a little girl. In the past, her mother worked at the business, but she is very sick, and that is the reason why Roxana is looking for a way to help out.

She wishes to invest in corn in bulk quantities, so that her earnings could be better. That is the reason why she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in corn in bulk quantities and other supplies needed to sell tortillas.

loans.use: to invest in corn in bulk quantities and other supplies needed to sell tortillas.

loans.name: Senad

texts.en: Senad is 23 years old and is the father of two children, ages 1 and 2 years old. He is the main source of income and works long hours to satisfy his family needs. Senad cuts wood and sells it to others for heating. At this time Senad is requesting a loan for 600 Euros to repair his wood cutting machine so that he can cut wood more effectively and efficiently, increasing his income and business. He appreciates the support and looks forward to this upcoming winter season.

loans.use: to repair his wood cutting machine so that he can cut wood more effectively and efficiently

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, a married mother of two, describes herself as humble. For 10 years she has been operating a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, bread, juices, sweets and other items. Her enterprise is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. Her biggest business challenge is low inventory.

Susan will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, flour, juice and other items. Her previous loan repaid, this will be her second one with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, flour,  juice and other items.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, de 54 años de edad, es ama de casa, no estudio debido a la falta de recursos económicos, está soltera, pero tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales uno está acompañado y trabaja para su hogar y 2 de igual manera trabajan pero viven con ella. 

Concepción, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, además trabaja en las caballerizas de la comunidad desde hace varios años, para llegar a su trabajo viaja 4 kilómetros todos los días.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para ampliar más su tienda con productos como jabón, detergente, pan, café, arroz y frijoles.

El sueño de Concepción, es construir su vivienda de ladrillo más grande, para poder vivir en más comodidad.
texts.en:
Concepcion is 54 years old and a housewife. She never studied in school due to the lack of economic resources. She is single but raised three children, of whom one is married and works for her own home, and the other two also work but continue to live with Concepcion.

Concepcion operates a small store at home and, in addition, has worked in the community's horse stables for many years. To arrive at her work place she must travel four kilometers every day.

The loan Concepcion is requesting will expand her store's products to include items such as soap, detergent, bread, coffee, rice, and beans.

Concepcion's dream is to construct a larger home of bricks, in order to live in greater comfort.

loans.use: expand her store more with products such as soap, detergent, bread, coffee, rice and beans.

loans.name: Ohan

texts.en:
Ohan is 33 years old and he is not married. He lives with his mother in Zovaber village of Gegharkunik region. Ohan is a farmer and he is especially busy with sheep breeding. In his farm he has a lot of sheep, lambs, also cows and chickens. Ohan sells a lot of mutton from his farm also milk and eggs. His mother helps him about their farm and they together overcome all the hardships in it. Potato cultivation is also profitable for Ohan as re-sellers buy it from him a lot of and right from his farm.

This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams will be very developing for Ohan’s farm as he wants to buy two sheep, a calf and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two sheep, a calf and also fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Celso Alberto

texts.es: Celso es un hombre emprendedor de 33 años de edad que vive con su esposa y los dos hijos de ella a los que él siempre apoya. Celso se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de pescado la cual realiza de forma ambulante recorriendo la playa en su bicicleta, desde hace 11 años, pero además en temporada baja presta sus servicios de ayudante de albañil, con lo que logra obtener mejores ingresos. Él desea invertir en su venta de pescado, ya que se acerca la mejor temporada y él sabe que las ventas serán mejores, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pescado, mariscos, cangrejos, entre otros productos para su venta de mariscos.
texts.en:
Celso is a 33 year old entrepreneur who lives with his wife and her two children who he supports. Celso earns a living by selling fish along the beach on his bicycle. He has worked doing this for 11 years, and in the low season he works as a mason's assistant, which allows him to earn additional income.

Celso wants to purchase seafood as the high season is approaching and he knows that his sales will increase. For this reason, he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase fish, shellfish, crabs and other products for his seafood business.

loans.use: purchase fish, shellfish, crabs and other items for his seafood business.

loans.name: Nora Lizeth

texts.es: Nora, de 51 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y vive con una hija y una nieta en el municipio de Colinas, Santa Bárbara. Ella maneja una pulpería desde hace 1 año donde ofrece varios productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, manteca, refrescos, churros, huevos, pan, productos de aseo, y otros abarrotes. Actualmente solicita la cantidad de 6,000 Lempiras para surtir su pulpería con productos como arroz, harina, frijoles, maíz, pan, embutidos, manteca, refrescos y más. De esta manera ella logra surtir su negocio, aumentar su inventario y sus ventas para generar más ingresos para su familia. Su meta es lograr que el negocio crezca y poder depender al 100% del negocio para el sostenimiento familiar.
texts.en:
Nora, 51, is a single mother of two children. She lives with her daughter and her granddaughter in the city of Colinas, Santa Bárbara. She runs a grocery store, which she has managed for a year. She sells a variety of basic goods such as: rice, sugar, beans, lard, beverages, churros, eggs, bread, toiletries, and other groceries. 

She is seeking a loan of 6,000 Lempiras to stock her store with products such as: rice, flour, beans, corn, bread, deli meats, lard, beverages, and more. This way, she will be able to fully stock her store, increase her inventory, and improve her sales in order to generate more income for her family. Her goal is to grow her business and be able to depend solely on her business to support her family.

loans.use: purchase products such as rice, flour, beans, corn, bread, deli meats, lard, beverages and more to stock her business.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor plumbing. Her greatest monthly expense is food .

She has operated a butcher shop for the past three years, selling goat meat to the neighbors and people at the market. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With this loan, she wants to purchase goats to slaughter and have meat to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats to slaughter and sell meat from.

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es: Aracely, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos,  con quienes  vive en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Ella se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace 8 años en su propiedad, ofrece los productos de café ya sea en uva, requinto, húmedo y seco. Con el fin de obtener recursos para darle asistencia a su finca ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo a la institución por 10,000 Lempiras que utilizará en la compra de fertilizantes y limpieza de su finca de café. Esto le ayudará ha asistir su finca lo que le dará una mejor producción y una mejor calidad de productos. Su sueño es salir adelante con sus hijos y tener mejores cosechas de café ya que es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Aracely, 30 years old, is a single mother with two sons who lives in Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. She has worked growing coffee on her land for 8 years, selling coffee cherries [the red fruit of the coffee plant], both wet-processed and dry-processed cherries and sacks of the beans.

In order to have more resources to help her business, she has decided to apply for another loan from the lending institution [ODEF] for 10,000 Lempiras. She will use this to buy fertilizer and maintain her coffee farm. This will help her tend to her farm, improving her production and the quality of her products.

Her dream is to get ahead in life with her children and have better coffee crops, as that is her source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and maintain her coffee farm.

loans.name: Ana Lorena

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 7 y 3 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta básica y verduras, posee su negocio desde hace 6 años y empieza su jornada a partir de las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m., la ventaja es que ya tiene clientela establecida con la cual puede obtener ingresos a diario para la subsistencia de su grupo familiar, el negocio lo aprendió con el apoyo de su madre.
Ella solicita crédito para poderlo invertir en jugos, gaseosas, pan, huevos, arroz, aceite y verduras frescas, lo que ella busca es poder incrementar sus ganancias, ya que tendría más productos que poderle ofrecer a sus clientes y público en general, además le ayuda a poder darle una mejor estabilidad a su familia.
Ella busca alcanzar su sueño que es poder tener un negocio más grande y estable para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella, sus hijas y su compañero de vida.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her life partner and her two daughters aged 7 and 3. She sells staple goods' products and vegetables. She has had her business for 6 years and begins her journey from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. The advantage is that she already has an established customer base with which she can earn daily income for her family group's sustenance. She learned the business with her mother's support.

Ana is requesting a loan to be able to invest it in juice, soda, bread, eggs, rice, oil, and fresh vegetables. What she's looking for is to be able to increase her profits since she would have more products to be able to offer her customers and the general public. Also, it helps her to be able to give a better stability to her family.

Ana seeks to achieve her dream, which is being able to have a larger and more stable business in order to have a better quality of life for herself, her daughters, and her life partner.

loans.use: to invest in juice, soda, bread, eggs, rice, oil, and fresh vegetables to increase her profits.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 38-year-old, single woman. She lives with her husband and her children. She has four children who she ‎loves with all her heart, and she is working hard to give them all they need. Due to bad financial conditions, she ‎decided to start her own business in 2008 from her home, where she offers a great variety of new clothes and shoes at good ‎prices.
‎
Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a new collection of clothes and shoes so that she can improve her ‎business operations. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales, and therefore, her revenues.‎

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
A 23-year-old, single, ambitious lady who has been working as a restaurant manager and an accountant for three years--this is Reem! The sole breadwinner for four other members of her family, Reem is a hardworking lady who puts so much effort into advancing in her work and increasing her income.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car, which is necessary to facilitate her transportation to her work since she lives very far away. She used to work as a private nurse, but she decided to turn to a business with more development.

loans.use: to buy a car, which is necessary to facilitate her transportation to her work since she lives very far away

loans.name: Mujahid

texts.en:
Mujahid is a young man who lives in Khanyounis, Gaza Strip. He works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of the high cost of living, he decided to open a new business. His business idea was to transport goods and inventory between traders in a rickshaw. A few years ago Mujahid bought a new rickshaw and became well-known. He has loyal customers.

Now Mujahid is taking a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to do some maintenance on his rickshaw. By taking this loan Mujahid can work more efficiently and increase his sales and profit.

loans.use: to do some maintenance on his rickshaw.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as trustworthy.

Joseph operates a farm where he grows vegetables, maize and beans and also keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Nyakitojo Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Jane is a member of Nyakitojo Tweyimukye, a group in which members guarantee each other in borrowing and loan payment. She is a 54-year-old widowed lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a business selling fresh foods, which she has been doing for three years. She went into this business with the hope of earning an income to look after herself and the orphans.

Jane is faced with hardships of price fluctuations, unreliable customers and perishability of her commodities. Besides that, she is looking forward to building a good-looking permanent house. Jane has asked for a loan to help her buy fresh foods like cabbages, matooke (green plantain), Irish (white potatoes) and fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods like cabbages, matooke, Irish and fish to sell.

loans.name: Nelly Maria Galu

texts.en:
Nelly is 54 years old. She’s an afro farmer who lives and works in Ibarra’s rural zone, which suffers from drought caused by climate change. She lives with her husband in a small house near the field where they grow sugar cane.

Sometimes Nelly and her husband have to hire more workers. Several times they have had problems in the field because they did not have enough money to pay for more labor or buy fertilizers. She is looking for finance to both buy seeds and fertilizer as well as pay for labor costs. Her biggest worries are the plagues which damage her crop.

Nelly is an entrepreneur and very disciplined. She and her husband have been working with cane for almost 30 years. They work very hard. She looks forward to one day being able to purchase a new piece of land where they can grow peppers and, in this way, have additional income and improve their life.

loans.use: to both buy seeds and fertilizer as well as pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en:
Edmond is a tailor who owns a tailoring workshop. He is a 56-year-old married man with 6 children, of whom 3 attend school. He also looks after an aged dependent.

Edmond has been in this tailoring business for the past 20 years, and his tailoring workshop has a number of sewing machines which are mechanically good. However his business is not really doing well because he is limited by capital, bad debtors, and a poor business location.

As a result, Edmond has decided to apply for a loan so he can relocate his business to a busy area, restock it, and attract more customers. He is requesting a loan to buy more cloth to sew.

With the profits from tailoring, Edmond hopes to have enough income to give his wife and their school-going children an improved standard of living and a quality education. A loan would help him to improve his family's overall quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to sew.

loans.name: Dinavence

texts.en:
Dinavence is a 58-year-old, single woman, living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She is a farmer, where she works eight hours per day growing bananas. She started this business with a hope of obtaining a good income-generating business. She is faced with the hardship of insufficient capital which hinders her from reaching her dream of diversifying her income and developing herself up to the required standard.

Dinavence has asked for a loan to prune and mulch her banana plantation.

loans.use: to prune and mulch her banana plantation.

loans.name: Nason

texts.en: Nason is a hardworking married man who takes sole responsibility for looking after his family. He owns a boutique where he gets income to sustain his family and pay school fees for his children, having been in business for four years. He desires to have diversified sources of income, vowing that his family will never lack anything. He says that his business is affected by inflation and high exchange rates. He is requesting a loan facility to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yakubu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support he can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest market price.

As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex operates a retail shop and also earns a salary at a motorcycle transport business. He is a very hardworking man.

Alex has managed to expand his shop by pooling funds from the sources of income that he has, and this has enabled him to provide for his family's needs.

Alex used his previous loan to both buy sand and cement as well as pay for the labor to plaster his house. However, he underestimated the job that was to be done.

Despite this shortcoming, Alex is determined to complete his house before Christmas. He is thus requesting a loan to buy bags of cement, sand, and aggregate.

loans.use: to buy  bags of cement, sand, and aggregate.

loans.name: Tarasisiyo

texts.en:
Tarasisiyo is thirty-five years old with children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He deals in general merchandise on a retail level, selling items like sugar, salt, soap, rice, as well as many others.

This is a business Tarasisiyo ventured into in order to support his family. He dreams of expanding his business into new markets and opening up other outlets in the nearby centers despite the challenges of bad debtors and price fluctuations.

Tarasisiyo has asked for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as sugar, soap, salt, and other items.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, soap, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Idris

texts.en:
Idris is a maize farmer from Ranau Danmantai village. As a Babban Gona member, Idris is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Idris would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Idris can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Idris no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Idris hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a postsecondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hussaini

texts.en:
Hussaini is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hussaini has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hussaini would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Hussaini can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Hussaini will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Hussaini is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is 48 years old and she lives in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. She has a higher pedagogical education and for many years until now she has worked at the school as a teacher.

Ruzanna is married and she has two daughters. Her elder daughter is employed and she works at the college and her younger daughter is a student. Ruzanna’s husband is unemployed.

Ruzanna is asking for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as she has some health problems and lacks money to solve those problems. With this loan amount she will be able to get a proper and good medical exam and find out the reason for feeling weak and unhealthy.

loans.use: to get a proper and good medical exam to find out the reason for feeling weak and unhealthy.

loans.name: Sale

texts.en:
Sale is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sale has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sale would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sale can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest market price.

As a Babban Gona member, Sale will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all of his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Alh. Basiru

texts.en:
Alh. Basiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. He is anticipating a good harvest this season, and he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Basiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alh. he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest market price.

As a Babban Gona member, Alh. Basiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all of his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Nafiu

texts.en:
Nafiu is a maize farmer from Liman village. As a Babban Gona member, Nafiu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs, which will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land; 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Nafiu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Nafiu can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Nafiu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Nafiu hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Wanjiru

texts.en: Wanjiru is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking utensils. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cooking utensils to sell. She will save the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking utensils to sell.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is a 24-year-old single lady who has her own clothes selling shop, which she established after getting the necessary requested experience from being an employee in the same domain. She started her own business in May 2014, and is working hard on developing it as much as she can.

Her business is going fine, but not good enough to cover her personal needs. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for travel expenses for a Holy Religious visit. She managed to develop and expand her working place properly, and is working hard to continue developing it and move to a wider place in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for  travel expenses for a Holy Religious visit.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 55-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 15 years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes.

Therefore Shamshad is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn a maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Shamshad is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his clothes business.

loans.name: Nyabusozi Youth Farmers Group

texts.en:
Moreen is a mother of 3 children. She is 34 years old, married, and a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda. She operates a fresh food stall selling fresh bananas (matooke), beans, vegetables, and tomatoes in addition to farming for extra income. She started this business to be able generate income to look after her family's needs such as paying for school fees.

Moreen usually complains of having a small capital base and the unfavorable weather changes, like in rainy seasons when customers fail to turn up in large numbers. But, all in all, she stands firm for her business.

Moreen intends to use her loan portion to buy more fresh beans, matooke, and tomatoes to sell from her stall. She is a member of Nyabusozi Youth Farmers Group wherein there is membership group guarantor for taking a loan facility.

loans.use: to buy more fresh beans, matooke, and tomatoes to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Ruth Balbina

texts.es: Ruth es una entusiasta madre de familia que emprendió su negocio de venta de mercancías con el objetivo de ofrecer a sus hijos un mejor futuro. Cuando llegó al municipio de Barranquilla, proveniente de Montería entabló muy buenas relaciones con sus vecinos y al poco tiempo realizó una inversión en una cantidad muy moderada de mercancías varias que posteriormente les exhibió sus vecinos del barrio en el que reside al sur de Barranquilla, contando con  éxito en su idea de negocio.  Así mismo consideró que sería una oportunidad ofertar sus productos a sus conocidos en el municipio de Montería y con el tiempo logró expandirse a más municipios del departamento de Córdoba.  Esta empírica comerciante ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia con su negocio y pretende continuar con mucho compromiso para  hacer realidad su sueño de prosperidad: terminar de construir su vivienda.  Ruth realizará unas compras de prendas de vestir, accesorios, tendidos de cama, toallas, ropa interior, encargos que le han realizado sus clientes y que pretende financiar con un credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Esta inversión le permitirá obtener muy buenas ganancias y con ellas continuar aportando a la educación de sus tres hijos, de los cuales dos aún son menores de edad y están cursando estudios académicos.
texts.en: Ruth is an enthusiastic mother who began her business selling goods with the objective of offering her children a better future. When she arrived in the town of Barranquilla, coming from Monteria, she established very good relations with her neighbors. Soon, she made an investment in a very moderate amount of various goods that she later showed her neighbors in the south of Barranquilla. Her business idea was a success. She also considered that it would be an opportunity to offer the products to her acquaintances in the town of Monteria and eventually managed to expand to more municipalities in the department of Cordoba. This empirical merchant has improved the living conditions of her family through her business and intends to continue with great commitment to realize her dream of prosperity: to finish building her house. Ruth will make some purchases of clothing, accessories, bed sheets, towels, and underwear, orders that her customers have made, and intends to finance a loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. This loan will allow her to obtain very good profits and with them continue to contribute to the education of her three children, two of whom are still minors and are pursuing academic studies.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, accessories, bed sheets, towels, and underwear, orders that her customers have made

loans.name: Munkaila

texts.en:
Munkaila is a maize farmer from Guibi Sarki village. As a Babban Gona member, Munkaila is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Munkaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member he can now store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later period. He can then obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the harvest market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Munkaila no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Munkaila hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is married with children. She operates a retail shop. It’s her main source of income. She has the responsibility of providing for her family's needs.

Zaituni is also faced with the challenge of competition. She is requesting a loan to buy bakery products, pampers, soap, as well as other things to sell, it being the Christmas season.

Zaituni has a business dream of moving into the wholesale trade.

loans.use: to buy bakery products, pampers, soap, as well as other things to sell.

loans.name: Hamisu

texts.en:
Hamisu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Hamisu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hamisu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Hamisu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Hamisu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Hamisu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
Mustapha is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mustapha has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mustapha would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Mustapha can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest market price.

As a Babban Gona member, Mustapha will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Mustapha is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yahaya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest market price.

As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Yahaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es:
José, de 72 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está acompañado y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con él.

José, se dedica desde pequeño al cultivo de maíz, frijol y café y actualmente tiene sembrado café y es para este cultivo que necesita el préstamo.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar plantas de café e insumos agrícolas para asegurar una buena cosecha. 

José, sueña con cultivar todos sus terrenos de café y cacao; pero también desea mejorar su casa y reconstruirla para hacerla de bloque.
texts.en: José, who is 72 years old, and studied up to first grade, has five children, two who live with him. He has worked since childhood in the planting of maize, beans and coffee. He has currently planted coffee and it is for this cultivation that he needs a loan to buy plants and inputs to ensure a good harvest. José, dreams of planting all his fields with coffee and cacao but he also wants to improve his house and rebuild it out of concrete blocks.

loans.use: To buy coffee plants and other inputs to ensure a good harvest

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe Group

texts.en:
The Yehowa Akwe group was created since the first cycle. It is composed of four women from the same neighborhood, united by good social and professional ties.

Ms. Aisha is the group’s official. She is 32 years old, married and the mother of two boys, all provided with education.

She is active in the processes of selling wigs, weave-ons, threads and slippers, and the braiding of the hair fish in her town, Teshea central.

With her new financing of 3,800 GHS, she is going to purchase more wigs, weave-ons, threads and slippers to resell to her regular customers. She makes use of proven experience and training obtained from ID-Ghana in this domain, for having worked at it for six years now. The profits earned will enable her to meet the food and educational needs of her children and to bolster her capital.

loans.use: to purchase more wigs, weave-ons, threads and slippers to resell to her regular customers.

loans.name: Mus'ab

texts.en:
Mus'ab is a 24-year-old single young man from a Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small house. The family has a store for selling spices and seasonings. It is a very good business and all the family cooperate together at work. 

Mus'ab is learning how to sell and operate the business, so he took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a new collection of spices and Seasonings for the family store.

This investment in inventory will help them increase sales and income. With the increase in income, Mus'ab and his family hope to expand his business.  Mus'ab appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new collection of spices and seasonings for the family store.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is a hard-working woman from Ormoc, City. At the age of 44, she juggles three jobs to provide for her family.

She operates a Sari-sari store and sells frozen food or processed meat products in her place. She sell hot dogs, spanish sausage (chorizon) and other basic merchandise in her store. Sometimes, Ma. Victoria even accepts laundry services to earn more income to support her five children, aged five to twenty-one.

Ma. Victoria is asking for a loan to buy tooth paste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar, bath soap, hot dogs and spanish sausage.

Ma. Victoria keeps a positive outlook in her life and hopes to be more successful in her endeavors.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her general store.

loans.name: Vilma Haydee

texts.es: Vilma a sus 29 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 13 y 5 años de edad, a los que está sacando adelante y apoyando en sus estudios. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado de manera ambulante, el cual adquiere con los pescadores que salen del mar, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes por la frescura de sus productos y la calidad. Vilma desea invertir en mayor cantidad de productos para vender, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pescado, mariscos, cangrejos, entre otros productos para su venta.
texts.en:
Vilma is 29 years old and lives with her life partner and two children who are 13 and five years old, who she is bringing up and helping with their studies. She is engaged as a street vendor in the sale of fish that she obtains when the fishermen come from the sea. She has many customers because of the freshness and quality of her products. 

Vilma wishes to invest in a larger quantity of products to sell so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: fish, shellfish, crabs, among other products for sale.

loans.use: To invest in: fish, shellfish, crabs, among other products for sale

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is a 44-year-old divorced woman. She lives in Kutaisi district with her 11-year-old daughter Elene. Maka works as a cleaner and gets a small income. As this is not enough to cover everyday expenses, she decided to start a trading business.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase clothes and resell them at higher price to generate income.

With the increased income, she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family. Maka hopes that the trading business will be profitable, and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading in clothes.

loans.name: Alhaji Abdulhamid

texts.en:
Alhaji Abdulhamid is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Abdulhamid has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Abdulhamid would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate income needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alhaji Abdulhamid can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Abdulhamid will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Abdulhamid is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, de 55 años de edad, solo estudio primer grado, está casado, su esposa de dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 4 hijos pero solo uno trabaja y los demás estudian.


José, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería desde hace más de 20 años, la parcela donde trabaja está a 15 minutos de su casa y en esta actividad se involucran sus dos 2 hijos mayores.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar 2 terneras que le venden baratas y así poder aumentar su ganadería.

José, sueña con tener una casa más grande, porque donde vive es muy reducido.
texts.en:
José, who is 55 years old, only studied up to the first grade. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. He has four children but only one works while the rest study. José has been engaged in agriculture and livestock rearing for more than twenty years. The parcel where he works is fifteen minutes from his house. He engages his two eldest children in this activity. 

José needs a loan to purchase two calves that are sold at low cost so that he can increase his livestock. He dreams of having a larger house because it is very small where he now lives.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Mphatso

texts.en:
Mpatsho is a bright, eager young woman who resides in a town called Blantyre in Malawi. Blantyre is sometimes referred to as the commercial capital of Malawi and Mphatso would like to set up her business there. At 23 years old, Mphatso is the youngest of eight children. She has a certificate in Business and Administration and is passionate about business management.

Mphatso has always dreamed of running her own business, but lacked the capital to make this dream a reality. Currently, the economy in Malawi makes it difficult for young people to find gainful employment. This makes it difficult for Mphatso to support herself and her family. She believes that becoming a Zoona agent and running her own business will turn her situation around. She would like to make a success of running a mobile money transfer business in Blantyre and eventually using the revenue generated to further her education and plow all that knowledge back into her business and her community.

Mphatso looks forward to a day when she will be able to contribute positively to her community by being able to provide employment and be a viable, trustworthy alternative in a country where banking is simply too expensive for most of the working class.

Mphatso would like to increase her Zoona footprint in Malawi. Zoona has done market research and found that with Blantyre being the second largest city in Malawi, the location is ideal to generate the traction she envisions for her business. Mphatso thanks the Kiva lenders for their support in her endeavor.

loans.use: to procure a branded trolley and an internet enabled phone as well as the funds needed to make the transactions so that she can start running her own business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a postsecondary education

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is maize farmer from Umbo village. As a member of Babban Gona, Dauda is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dauda would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Dauda is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Wendy Patricia

texts.es:
Wendy, es una mujer soltera que vive con su papá y su mamá, los cuales depende económicamente de ella, el negocio que tiene es una tienda en donde ofrece productos de la canasta básica mejor conocida; ella empieza su jornada desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m., Wendy fundó este negocio por necesidad de poder dar el sustento a sus padres que se encuentran de avanzada edad.

Ella solicita un crédito para poder incrementar su inventario y poder ofrecerles otro tipo de artículos a sus clientes como lo son: sodas, golosinas, pan dulce, huevos, etc., considerando que esto le ayudará incrementar las ganancias y así poderles dar una vida más digna a sus padres. 
El mayor sueño de Wendy es poder mejorar su negocio, atraer más cliente y de esa manera que su estabilidad económica sea mejor.
texts.en:
Wendy is a single woman and lives with her mother and father who are financially dependent on her. Her business is a store that offers common basic food items. She works from 6:00am to 4:00pm. Wendy started her business out of the need to support her elderly parents.

She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory and offer her customers other types of items such as sodas, candy, pastries, eggs, etc. She feels this will help increase sales and she will then be able to give her parents a more dignified life.

Wendy's greatest dream is to be able to improve her business and attract more customers resulting in greater financial stability.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and offer her customers other types of items such as sodas, candy, pastries, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Saád

texts.en:
Saád is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Saád has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Saád would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Saád can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Saád will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Saád is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dauda has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dauda would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate income needs for things such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Dauda will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Dauda is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Eder Isaac

texts.en:
Eder is a 27 year old man, single and has no children or economical dependents. He lives in a house that he rents.

Kubo looks up to Eder because he is a person who decided to follow his dream and break with the conventional way of life. 5 years ago, Eder decided he didn't like to work on an office with a boss and an imposed way of life, so he started an ice cream shop. He sells non conventional ice creams, is a new concept of dessert, in which the client receives an ice cream that is baked at the very moment by using a cooling device which is a kind of iron.

Eder struggled at the start, but he continued following his dream and now he owns two ice cream shops and is looking forward to open a new one. He dreams about creating a brand of his own which is recognized all around the country. But, in order to open his third store, he needs to buy extra merchandise and to do so he is looking for a 6,800.00 MXN loan that will give him a boost to open his new store.

loans.use: to expand his ice-cream brand by buying extra merchandise

loans.name: Zamoyoni

texts.en:
Zamoyoni is 28 years old and currently living with her husband and her children in Morogoro district. She is volunteering as a Camfed learner guide; she gives time each week to mentor young students and members of her community through a range of personal skills.

Her work involves renting bicycles, which enables her to earn money to help her family in basic daily needs. She plans to use the profit to expand her business and help her family members with daily basic needs.

Her “social-interest” loan will be repaid through Zamoyoni's weekly two-and-a-half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to buy additional bicycles.

loans.name: Anabell

texts.es: A muy corta edad Anabell inicio a realizar el trabajo de costura, su esposo es su principal apoyo en todo momento, con el tiempo vio que también tenían demanda los productos cosméticos y también decidió vender estos productos. Poco a poco ha ido diversificando sus diseños y ha aumentado la demanda de sus clientes, es por esta razón que Anabell solicita un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de telas y diversos materiales. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta realizar blusas acabados finos para luego ofrecerlas a diversas tiendas.
texts.en:
At a young age, Anabell began doing work as a dressmaker. Her husband is her principal support at all times. With time, she saw that cosmetic products were also in demand, and she decided to sell these products as well.

Little by little, she has diversified her designs and her clients' demand has grown. It is for this reason that Anabell requests a loan to buy a greater quantity of fabrics and a varied cloth. In her future plans, she is making fine, finished blouses to later offer to various stores.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of fabrics and a varied cloth.

loans.name: Candelario Antonio

texts.es: Don Candelario de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up desde hace 15 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Candelario is 50 years old. He owns a house where he lives with his wife and his son. He has been offering transport services with his pickup truck for fifteen years. He has many clients, who prefer his services because he is a responsible driver. With what he earns, he manages to cover some of the home expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy tires for and perform maintenance on his vehicle, which is his only source of income. This will result in better living conditions for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy tires for, and perform maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Alba Yeny

texts.es:
Alba es una mujer de 28 años de edad, mujer con gran liderazgo, sentido de pertenencia, responsable y honesta, cuenta con un negocio de confección a terceros, y cuenta con 3 empleados.

Debido a la temporada alta, trabaja todos los días 12 horas o más, ha sido un gran año para ella y espera cerrar con broche de oro, generando más empleo.
Su propósito a largo plazo es comprar una vivienda y ser considerada como una de las principales confeccionistas de Medellín.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para abastecerse de insumos de la confección principalmente hilos y remaches.
texts.en:
Alba is a woman of 28 years of age, a woman of great leadership and sense of  belonging. She is responsible and honest. She has a tailoring business to third parties, and has 3 employees. 

Due to the high season, she works 12 hours or more everyday. It has been a big year for her and she hopes to end with a flourish, generating more employment. Her proposal in the long term is to buy a house and be considered one of the principal tailors in Medellín. Currently she needs a loan to stock up on tailoring supplies, principally thread and rivets.

loans.use: to stock up on tailoring supplies, principally threads and rivets.

loans.name: Sibusisiwe

texts.en:
Sibusisiwe is 24 years old, the younger of two siblings. Sibusiswe is requesting a Kiva loan in order to start running her own business, a Zoona mobile money transfer business, in Mangochi, Malawi.

Sibusiswe completed high school in 2009, but she did not go to college as she did not have money to pay for her tuition. In order to support herself, she worked in Mwanza as a house keeper for a year. Sibusiswe is excited for the opportunity to start running her own business  as a Zoona agent. She looks forward to interacting with a lot of people in her community and being in a position where she is financially independent. Sibusiswe says the business will help her community have easy access to financial services and save money as they will not have to travel long distances to send and receive money.

When Sibusiswe gets this loan, she will be able to purchase a branded trolley and a web-enabled phone, and will have the funds needed for her to serve her customers and start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent in Mangochi. Sibusisiwe's dream is to grow her business and become financially stable. She thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ahmed has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ahmed would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Ahmed can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Ahmed will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Ahmed is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Bako

texts.en:
Bako is a Babban Gona maize farmer.  Bako is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Bako would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona Bako can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Bako has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. 

Bako is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having the money to feed his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sulkhan

texts.en:
Sulkhan is 28 years old and married. He lives in the Vani district with his wife and their 4-year-old child. Sulkhan is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he owns a plot of land where he grows nut trees. In addition they have a cow which produces cheese.

Sulkhan wants to start a trading business and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,200 GEL. With the received credit, he will purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and will resell them for a profit.

This will increase his income, and with increased income, Sulkhan will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to begin trading fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris, cuenta con 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, vive junto a dos de sus hijos en el municipio de San Jerónimo, Comayagua. Hace 14 años que cuenta con una pulpería en la cual ofrece productos como granos básicos, churros, refrescos, huevos, pan, dulces, productos de limpieza, también vende bisutería, medicamentos y cosméticos.  Ella solicita la cantidad de 25,000 Lempiras para surtir su pulpería, y comprar más granos básicos, abarrotes y medicamentos para vender y suplir la demanda de sus clientes. Esta inversión le ayudara a ampliar más su negocio, superarse económicamente y tener un mejor nivel de vida para poder ofrecer un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en: Doris is 42 years old. She is a single mother and has three children. She lives with two of her children in the municipality of San Jeronimo, Comayagua. For 14 years, she has had a grocery store where she offers products such as basic grains, "churros", beverages, eggs, bread, sweets and cleaning products. She also sells custom jewelry, medicines and cosmetics. She is requesting the amount of 25,000 Lempiras to stock up her grocery store and buy more basic grains, grocery store products and medicines to sell and fulfill her customers' demand. This investment will help her to expand her business, to progress financially and to have a better level of life so she can offer her family a better future.

loans.use: to buy more basic grains, grocery store items and medicines to sell.

loans.name: Maira Estela

texts.es: Maira tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas de 8 y 4 años de edad con los que ha logrado salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y flotadores cerca de la playa, lo cual le permite salir adelante y llevar el sustento a su hogar. Maira desea invertir en su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisetas, entre otros productos para su negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en: Maira is 26 years old. She lives with her husband and her two children aged 8 and 4 years old with whom she is getting ahead. She works selling clothing and flotation devices close to the beach. This allows her to get ahead and provide sustenance for her home. Maira wants to invest in her business. So she is requesting a loan to invest in pants, skirts, blouses and t-shirts amongst other products for her business selling clothing.

loans.use: to invest in pants, skirts, blouses and t-shirts amongst other products for her business selling clothing.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
lA ASOCIACION COMUNAL NUEVA ESPERANZA ESTA CONFORMADA POR TRECE MUJERES MADRES SOLTERAS CON VEINTE HIJOS TODOS MEJORES DE EDAD, SON ORIGINARIAS DE SANTA ROSA DEL PEÑON, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE OCCIDENTE DEL PAIS, ESTAS MUJERES SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE DINERO NO ESTUDIARON Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. EN LA ACTUALIDAD ESTAN LUCHANDO PARA PROPORCIONARLES A SUS HIJOS LAS OPORTUNIDADES DE VIDA QUE ELLAS NO PUDIERON, Y ASI PODER LOGRAR SUS SUEÑOS Y METAS COMO CONVERTIRLOS EN PROFESIONALES.

GRACIA A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA ES KATHIA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UNA PULPERIA ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZUCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, ACEITE, GALLETAS ETC. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACON, SU RUTINA DIARIA ES DE UNAS DOCE  HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. NUEVA ESPERANZA AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) is formed by thirteen women, single mothers with twenty children, all minors. They are natives of Santa Rosa del Peñon, a place that is located in the western zone of the country. These women are characterized as being hard-working and responsible, with the will for personal achievement. Unfortunately, because of the lack of money, they didn't go to school, and they saw the need to work to help with the household expenses. Now they are striving to provide their children with the opportunities in life that they weren't able to have, so that they can thus be able to achieve their dreams and goals, such as becoming professionals.

Thanks to her will to get ahead, the coordinator is Kathia. She has a grocery store as her business. It is a little store that sells food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, crackers, etc. She has the business located in her house. Her daily routine is some twelve hours daily offering her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business so that in the not-too-distant future she can obtain better income.

Nueva Esperanze is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people with scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, crackers, juices, etc.

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es:
Ana, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es una mujer luchadora, ha tenido 2 esposos en su vida, los cuales lamentablemente han fallecido, actualmente vive con una hija, porque sus otros hijos ya formaron sus propios hogares y otros han emigrado a Estados Unidos.

Ana, hace tortillas para vender todos los días, ella se levanta temprano para ir al molino y obtener la masa necesaria para hacer su producto y los clientes empiezan a llegar desde tempranas horas de la mañana y finalizan aproximadamente de 2 a 3 de la tarde, además vende refrescos en su casa.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar maíz, porque es su principal materia prima para elaborar las tortillas y se acerca la cosecha de dicho grano y quiere estar preparada.

Ana, sueña con que sus hijos prosperen y lleguen a ser personas de bien y que tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 51 years old, went to school through third grade. She is a hard-working woman. She has had two husbands in her life, who unfortunately have died. Now she lives with a daughter, because her other children have already formed their own households, and some have emigrated to the United States.

Every day Ana makes tortillas to sell. She gets up early to go to the mill and obtain the dough necessary to make her product. The customers begin to arrive in the early hours of the morning, and they finish at approximately 2 to 3 in the afternoon. In addition, she sells soft drinks in her house.

The loan she has applied for is to purchase corn, because it is her principal basic material for making the tortillas, and the harvest [season] for this grain is approaching, and she wants to be prepared.

Ana dreams that her children will prosper and become good people and that they will have a good education.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Las Pastoras Group

texts.es:
Una comunidad pequeña del Estado de México se caracteriza por ser una de las regiones con los habitantes más amables y trabajadores de la entidad. Ellos son, además, demasiado apegados a sus costumbres y tradiciones que contienen rastros prehispánicos y coloniales. Una de las celebraciones que reciben con más jubilo es la del santo de su región y la del 12 de diciembre, día de la Virgen de Guadalupe.  La unión es sin duda una de las características que vuelven única a la localidad.
   Doña Alicia es una mujer ejemplar quien toda su vida ha trabajado para mejorar su calidad de vida. El motor que la impulsa a esforzarse día con día es su familia integrada por su esposo J. Guadalupe con el cual, a lo largo de veinte años, ha mantenido a sus cinco hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando en la comunidad.  Doña Ali, como le dicen de cariño, inició con la compra y venta de verduras desde hace más de diez años; "siempre he buscado la manera de ayudar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de mis hijos, desde la cría de ovejas y hasta el negocio de verdura y fruta, todo es con el fin de ayudarlos" comentó contenta.
   Actualmente vende en las plazas de distintas comunidades mientras que su esposo se dedica a repartir en las tiendas de abarrotes de al menos 10 comunidades de tal forma que sus ganancias se han elevado. No obstante, Ali continúa con la cría de ovejas ya que es una actividad redituable y tradicional en su hogar. Asimismo está muy agradecida con el préstamo que le ofrece VFMéxico ya que puede comprar más fruta y verdura para ofrecer una gran variedad a sus clientes. Con las ganancias obtenidas han remodelado su casa y satisfecho las necesidades básicas del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Su meta actual es aumentar la producción de su negocio.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Paula y Olivia quienes invertirán en ovejas y Alejandro, en verduras y frutas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el centro municipal, Doña Ali es quien viste el suéter color morado.
texts.en: A small community of the State of Mexico is characterized by being one of the regions with the kindest and more hardworking inhabitants. They are also very loyal to their customs and traditions which have prehispanic and colonial features. One of the celebrations they celebrate with more joy is that of their regional saint and December 12, the day of the Virgin of Guadalupe. Their togetherness is undoubtedly one of the characteristics that make this village unique. Alicia is an exemplary woman who has worked her whole life to improve her life quality. The motivation that makes her work hard every day is her family, formed by her husband J. Guadalupe with whom, for twenty years, she has supported their five children who are studying in the community. Ali, as she is fondly called, started buying and selling vegetables for more than ten years. "I have always looked for ways to help with household expenses and my children's education, from raising sheep to the business of vegetables and fruits, everything with the purpose of helping them", she comments happily. Currently, she sells at town squares of different towns, while her husband works delivering at grocery stores of at least 10 communities, and for this reason their earnings have increased. Nevertheless, Ali continues raising sheep because it is a profitable and traditional activity in her household. Also, she is very grateful for the loan offered by VFMéxico, because she can buy more fruits and vegetables to offer a great variety to her customers. With the obtained earnings they have remodeled their house and satisfied the basic needs of their household and their children's education. Their current goal is to increase the production of her business. The other members of the group are Paula and Olivia who will invest in sheep, and Alejandro in vegetables and fruits. *The photograph was taken at the municipal center. Ali is the one wearing a purple sweater.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Vumilia

texts.en: Vumilia is 23 years old and lives in Morogoro district. Vumilia is a Camfed learner guide who volunteers working with children in secondary school. She teaches them life and problem solving skills to help them improve their learning performance. Apart from volunteering as an education activist, Vumilia has a retail shop with a variety of products such as sugar, maize, tea leaves, beans and rice. Vumilia is asking for a Kiva loan to increase the stock in her shop by buying in bulk from a town where the price is low. Vumilia plans to use the profit she will earn to cover domestic basic needs for herself and her parents

loans.use: To buy products in bulk for her shop

loans.name: Las Nuevas Amigas Group

texts.es: Roxana es madre de una hija mayor de edad,labora como docente en un colegio cercano a su casa donde también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogos, sus principales clientes son colegas y gente amiga que la conocen y saben de los buenos productos que ofrece, se siente orgullosa de tener este negocio ya que le ha permitido conocer y tener trato directo con el cliente, agradece el préstamo que ha logrado conseguir ya que la ayudará a comprar más mercadería como perfumes, joyas , cosméticos,ya que hay mayor descuento por la compra en cantidad, agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo y la confianza.
texts.en:
Roxana is the mother of an adult daughter. She works as a teacher at a school near her house, where she also works selling beauty products by catalog. Her main customers are colleges and friends that know her, and who know about the good products that she offers.

She feels proud to have this business, which has allows her to meet and have direct contact with her clientele.

She is thankful for the loan which she has been able to receive because it will help her buy more merchandise, such as perfumes, jewelry, and cosmetics, as there is a bigger discount for buying in bulk.

She is grateful to the lenders on Kiva for their support and faith in her.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, jewelry, creams, etc.

loans.name: San Fernando Ii Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL SAN FERNANDO II ESTA CONFORMADA POR DIES INTEGRANTES SIETE MUJERES Y TRES HOMBRES, PADRES Y MADRES RESPONSABLES DE VEINTE HIJOS, TODOS MEJORES DE EDAD SON ORIGINARIOS DE EL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGION, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPAÑÍA DE SUS HIJOS. EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN DIA A DIA PARA BRINDARLES A SUS HIJOS ESTABILIDAD ECONOMICA ETC.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES MODESTA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDDD ECONOMCIA UNA PULPERIA ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE LA TIENE UBICADA EN SU CASA DE HABITACION, Y VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZUCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, DETERGENTES, JUGOS, GALLETAS, ETC. ELLA DEDEICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES SURTIR SU PULPERIA Y OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO. SAN FERNANDO II AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO
texts.en:
